loans.name: Allah Thantho Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Allah Thontho” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Mariatu K.. Mariatu is twenty-seven; she was born in Makeni, where she is currently residing together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a petty trader; two of her children are attending primary school and two are not of school-going age. Mariatu has been a businesswoman for four years now. She sells dishes, plastic bowls and cloth. Mariatu is requesting for this loan in order to improve her business size and quality. She will use the loan to buy the above-mentioned items to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: Buys dishes, plastic bowls and cloth

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine N. lives in the Busega neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 4 children, three of whom are in school.  She lives in a home that she owns, and has access to electricity and  piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family and medication.  

Justine runs a wholesale shop.  She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 7 days a week.  She sells her products at the market. Her main business challenges include seasonality and transportation.  

Justine has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil.  Her goals for her business are to start buying directly from manufuctures, and to own a delivery van.

loans.use: to buy  more merchandise like bags of suagr, boxes of soap and cooking oil

loans.name: Catalina Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Catalina del Carmen E. G. es trabajadora Activa para el Colegio Público “José Domingo E.  de la localidad Gutiérrez Norte” desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Primaria tiene Quince  años de trabajar para esta institución, es casada actualmente tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  seis   créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno los ha  realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para  ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Catalina del Carmen E. G. is an active employee of the José Domingo E. Public School in the town of Gutiérrez Norte. She has worked as an elementary school teacher at this institution for 15 years. Catalina is married and currently has two school age children.

She has received six loans from CEPRODEL. Each one was used to buy construction materials in order to expand and improve her home. The loans from CEPRODEL have been a great benefit since they have helped her improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, blocks, tiles, etc.

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen lives in Khanewal, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a two-room brick house with her family. 

She is 45 years old, married to M. M. who works in a private company earning a monthly wage. Perveen also works to support her family. She offers her services as a midwife in her community. She has done this for many years and has vast experience in this field. 

She is a mother of two sons, both of whom work. Her elder son has a game shop. His shop attracts many children and earns him a good income every month. Her younger son also works in a private company. 

Perveen couldn’t afford to send her children to school.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to help her younger son start a meat-selling business. He is not satisfied with his income and wants to run his own business. With the loan, he will buy chickens in bulk and then sell the meat.
 
Perveen is hopeful that an investment will gives her son’s business a good start, and that he will be able to make a good profit from his business in the future. 
 
She is a new borrower of Asasah and this is her first loan application. 

Note: In the photo, Perveen is the woman holding a book (called Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy chickens to start a meat-selling business

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es:
Victoriano tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Yencala León del distrito de Mórrope, un distrito poblado por gente humilde y trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura. Se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y venta de animales menores. El cría animales menores en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona y al público en general. El negocio le sirve para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar al sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Victoriano desea adquirir algunos animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar sus ventas durante esta  temporada navideña, que es cuando la demanda aumenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Victoriano is 28 years old.  He is single and lives with his family in the town of Yencala León, in Mórrope district, a district of humble and hard-working people who work as farmers.  The district is in Lambayeque province, more than forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Victoriano raises and sells young animals.  He raises young animals in the area behind his home and when they have reached a good level of development he offers them for sale to traders in his area and to the general public.  His business helps to cover his personal expenses and helps to support his family financially.

Victoriano would like to acquire some animals and balanced feed to increase his sales during this Christmas season which is when his demand increases.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy young animals and balanced feed to increase his business raising and selling animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy replacement parts to give better service in his shop

loans.name: José Gilberto

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 29 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en una zona marginal de la ciudad de Lambayeque, una ciudad de movimiento comercial considerable que se encuentra situada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para transportar carga y pasajeros) el brinda su servicio en las principales calles de la ciudad de Lambayeque y se vale de los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad para sacar adelante a su familia.

El continuo uso brindado a su vehículo ha hecho que este empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
José, 29, is a father living with his wife and children in a marginal zone of the city of Lambayeque, a city with considerable commercial movement located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He provides cargo and passenger transportation services in a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with an attached cabin to transport passengers and cargo).  He provides the service along Lambayeque’s main streets and uses the income earned from this activity to support his family.

The continuous use of this vehicle has led to some mechanical problems that require urgent repair in order to insure its correct functioning.  He has, therefore, deemed it advisable to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan to help him reach this objective.

loans.use: For mototaxi repair and maintenance costs.

loans.name: Norma Piedad

texts.es:
Norma Piedad T. M., tiene 28 años, vive en unión libre con su esposo, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 6 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Los Ángeles, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 14 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz. 

Norma Piedad se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, Compra sus productos en  Ecua - Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es mejorar su vida económica

Le gusta hacer amigos, ser amable y responsable.
texts.en:
Norma Piedad T. M., age 28, lives with her common-law husband in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios province. She has 6 children. The members of the V.R.C. Ciudadela Los Angeles are located in the Los Angeles district, belonging to the Ventanas Canton. The 14 members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture sowing corn.
Norma Piedad works in agriculture sowing corn. She purchases her products in Ecua-Agro and sells in the same location.
She is requesting this loan for sowing corn and purchasing supplies and seeds. The support of this loan will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to improve her economic life.
She enjoys making friends and kind and responsible.

loans.use: the purchase of tools and seeds

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan S. is from the town of San Francisco. She is 42 years old. Susan is married and has three children ages 18, 15 and 8. 

To make a living, Susan raises crops, primarily rice, for sale. Susan works hard in order to support her family financially.

Susan joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Susan is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This will be the first loan taken out by Susan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees. 

About CEVI:
Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides its clients credit, but also savings, insurance and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia D. is from the village of Tinagaan, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 38 years old. Sonia is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Sonia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily daily use products such as shampoo, soap, snacks, canned goods & toothpaste in the local community. Sonia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Sonia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sonia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Sonia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Sonia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Reinvest in their business

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar: علي عمره 36 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل في بيع الدجاج وغيره له في عمله 20 سنة يحب عمله يتميز بالدقة والنظافة في العمل يريد ان يساعد عائلته على تطوير نفسها وزيادة المدخول للعائلة خاصة ان لديه اطفال في بداية الدراسة يحب ان يتطور عمله له خبرة كبيرة في عمله وهو يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بيك اب لنقل البضائع يسعى الى زيادة زبائنه من خلال تقديم خدماة اكبر فهو يتميز بكثرة الزبائن من جيرانه واقاربه
texts.en: Ali is 36 years old and married with three children. He sells chickens for a living and has 20 years experience in this. He loves his job and is distinguished for hygiene and attention to detail in his work. He wants to increase his family's income and help them develop, especially since his children are beginning their education. He wants to develop his work and has extensive experience in his job. With this loan he wants to purchase a pick-up truck to transport his goods. He wants to increase his clientèle by way of providing a better service. He has many customers from amongst his relatives and neighbours.

loans.use: to buy a pick-up truck for transporting goods.

loans.name: Edita

texts.en: Edita has been managing a clothing shop since 2007. She lives with her husband, his parents, and her 3-year-old daughter.  Edita is currently pregnant. She imports clothing from other countries to sell in her shop.  Edita has applied for this loan in preparation of the busy spring season.  She  hopes to attract new customers and keep repeat customers happy with new fashionable inventory.

loans.use: to stock new clothes to sell in her shop

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (20203050113) is a 40-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong in Bắc Ninh province.  She is married and has 2 adult children.  To making a living, T. owns & operates a business venture raising pigs for sale.  T. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.  This loan will be her 2nd loan from SEDA.  She  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Nguyễn Thị (20203050113) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, T. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2010, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  T. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  hỗ trợ tài chính cho các thành viên gần gũi trong gia đình của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon T. Sr. is a 55-year-old fruit vendor from Brgy. Commonwealth, Quezon City, Philippines.  He is happily married to Soledad T., his business partner.  They have been blessed with two children who have settled also with their own families.  At this time, Ramon and Soledad are working hand in hand to meet their daily needs.

Ramon has been into the buying and selling of tropical fruits for quite some time now. He buys these tropical fruits such as bananas and pineapples from farmers and wholesalers of their town in bulk quantities and sells them at a piece meal rate.  He also incorporates in his stall some vegetables and spices. Monthly, he earns an estimated net income of around 11,000 PHP.

To help him continue operation of his business, he is requesting a 8,000 PHP loan.  He plans to use this loan to buy more fresh fruit from wholesalers and also vegetables and spices to replenish his current inventory.  Ramon believes an increase in his business income will result as he expands his business.

Ramon prays for good health and be able to enjoy life with peace and abundance.  As a CCT community partner, he faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he reads.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional fresh fruit to sell.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette B. is from the village of San Isidro, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 41 years old. Jeanette is married and has four school-aged children. 

To make a living, Jeanette makes and sells a variety of food products like fried chickens and banana cues (deep-fried bananas covered with caramelized brown sugar). Jeanette has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jeanette joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Jeanette has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients and for working capital. 

Jeanette is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed like chicken meat and ripe bananas. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Jeanette from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients like chicken meat and ripe bananas.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity, from the village of Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro City, is 42 years old, married, and has six grown children. To make a living, Charity owns and operates a specialized retail store selling ready-to-wear clothing, blankets, bed sheets and pillow cases in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2003, Charity joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 15000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, she is requesting her 12th loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional bed sheets, blankets and ready-to-wear clothes. Charity plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bed sheets, blankets and ready-to-wear clothing.

location.town: Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina  es una mujer esforzada, vive junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa. Desde hace 5 años  decidió no solo ser ama de casa sino generar fuentes de ingresos viables y acordes con su tiempo, es así que aprovecho los espacios amplios de su casa y puso su granja de cuyes que en la actualidad esta criando y vendiendo cada cierto tiempo. Adicionalmente a esto realiza bellos bordados artesanales en su casa elaborando los trajes típicos de su zona. Dentro de las prendas que realiza son fustanes de tela bien confeccionado, aplicaciones de de diversos colores, entre ellos predomina el dorado y el plateado que dan como resultados un hermoso trabajo que agrada bastante a sus clientes, quienes solicitan de sus bordados en fechas especiales como son las fiestas de Santiago, muy celebrado en su zona. Es así que en los meses de julio hasta agosto es donde más trabajo tiene y donde necesita de mayor cantidad de materiales para  confeccionar hermosos trajes. Es su tercera vez que esta solicitando un crédito en MFP y se siente orgullosa de ella misma por haber permanecido puntual en todo este tiempo y también porque ha invertido adecuadamente sus préstamos anteriores de las cuales en corto tiempo ha visto los frutos, es por eso que considera que tiene una experiencia exitosa. Este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de hilos de diversos colores al por mayor para sus bordados, aplicaciones de lentejuelas e hilos dorados y plateado así como también fardos de tela.
texts.en:
Karina is a hard worker and lives with her husband and three children in her own home.  For five years she has been working not only as a homemaker but also helping to generate a decent income.  She has taken advantage of the extra space around the house and has set up a farm to raise and sell guinea pigs.  She also makes beautiful hand-embroidered regional costumes from her area.  The under-garments she makes are well-made slips with different colored appliqués, predominantly in gold and silver, which makes the work beautiful for the customer.  Most of her orders come in for special festivities such as Santiago, which are very much celebrated in the area.  The months of July and August are when her work increases and she needs more materials for the beautiful costumes.

This is her third loan through MFP and she is proud to have been punctual paying them back on time and using them adequately and seeing the results.  She feels like the experience has been successful.  This loan will be used to buy different-colored threads, wholesale, sequins, gold and silver thread appliqués, and rolls of fabric.

loans.use: To buy sequins, gold and silver thread, and rolls of fabric.

loans.name: Nancy Elena

texts.es:
Nancy va por su cuarto crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea recibir su segundo credikiva, ella está satisfecha con sus avances en el negocio, porque ha logrado el aumento de su capital de trabajo y con ello la compra de materias primas para elaborar vestidos que ha vendido y con los que ha conseguido aumentar su clientela. Tambien  se siente muy feliz por encontrarse en su propia casa en el macroproyecto Ciudad Bicentenario, gestionado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en su enfoque misional de construir comunidades sostenibles, allí está fortaleciendo su mercado con nuevos clientes. Su sueño más adelante es tener su propia boutique y hacer su casa de dos plantas para separar el espacio productivo del familiar; con su credikiva comprará telas e insumos de confección y mercancia como cosméticos y perfumeria que ya tiene encargados. 
Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores de Kiva: “Me siento agradecida y le pido a  Dios  que sigan ayudando y el programa siga extendiéndose a muchas familias.” Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Nancy ingrese al siguiente enlace: http://kiva.org/lend/235029
texts.en:
Nancy is negotiating her fourth loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and plans on getting her second Kiva loan.   She is satisfied with her business’ advances because she’s managed to increase her working capital and with it the purchase of raw materials to make dresses which, in turn, has led to an increase in customers.

She also feels very happy to be in her own house located in the Ciudad Bicentenario macro project managed by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo as part of its mission to build sustainable communities.  She is strengthening her market there with additional customers.  Her dream for later on is to own a boutique and to add a second story to her house in order to separate living quarters from business space.  She will use her Kiva loan to buy fabric and sewing supplies and merchandise like cosmetics and perfume that she already has orders for.

She sends the following message to Kiva lenders:  “I feel very grateful and ask God that you will continue to help and that the program continues to reach many families.”

If you’d like know Nancy’s story, please enter the following link: 
http://kiva.org/lend/235029

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and merchandise like cosmetics and perfume.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia forma parte del banco comunal “Brisas Marinas” perteneciente a la comuna de Calbuco, ciudad de Puerto Montt.
Ella se dedica a vender mariscos envasados, específicamente centollas, choritos, erizos, pulpos y locos. Claudia ha llegado a vender 100 kilos cada semana. Ella cuenta con una pesa y una congeladora para mantener en buen estado sus productos. 
Claudia trabaja junto a su hermana y cuñado, como un negocio familiar, compran los mariscos todos los días directamente a lanchas. En su hogar se dedica a desconchar los mariscos, para esto utiliza fuentes de acero inoxidable y guantes. Sus productos los vende directamente desde su casa y también los ofrece en ferias libres.
Ella se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 3 años.
Con el crédito comprará tachos de acero inoxidable para cocer la centolla, fuentes de acero inoxidable, potes de plástico de ½ kilo y 1 kilo y una pesa.
Sus metas en su negocio son tener una cocina industrial y poder instalar su negocio en un local establecido con el permiso correspondiente de salubridad, ya que éste le permitirá vender sus productos a diferentes restaurantes en la ciudad de Santiago.
Claudia vive junto a sus hijos de 8 años y 2 años de edad, su hermana, su cuñado y su sobrino. Su sueño es que sus hijos reciban una buena calidad en su educación algún día sus hijos sean profesionales.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito recibido por Fondo Esperanza, ya que ha sido más accesible. Además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo del banco comunal al cual pertenece, ya que disfruta de las reuniones y organiza las actividades realizadas puesto que es presidenta del grupo. Respecto a las capacitaciones ha aprendido a registrar sus gastos e ingresos, por lo que su negocio también está más organizado. 
Calbuco, es una comuna ubicada al sur de Chile, en la región de Los Lagos. Su  origen etimológico es del mapudungun (lengua mapuche) y significa "aguas azules". Es un archipiélago conformado por 12  islas. Su economía está basada fundamentalmente en la extracción de los productos del mar. En la actualidad existen numerosas fábricas de conservas, centros de cultivos de salmones, ostras, choros etc.
texts.en:
Claudia is a member of the communal bank "Brisas Marinas", meaning "Ocean Breezes". It belongs to the community of Calbuco in the city of Puerto Montt.

She sells canned seafood, especially crabs, mussels, sea urchins, octopus, and clams. Claudia has come to sell 100 kilograms every week. She has a scale and a freezer to keep her products fresh. 

Claudia works with her sister and her brother-in-law in a family-style business. They purchase the seafood every day directly from the fishermen. She sells the seafood in her house and to work she uses stainless steel tanks and gloves. She sells her products directly from her house and she also sells them at open fairs.

She has been in business for the past 3 years.

With the loan she will purchase stainless steel pots to cook the crabs, stainless steel tanks, plastic containers of 1/2 kilogram and 1 kilogram volume, and a scale.

Her goals for her business are to have an industrial stove and to install her business in a store space if her health permits. This will help her sell her products to various restaurants in the city of Santiago.

Claudia lives with her children, aged 8 and 2, with her sister, brother-in-law, and with a nephew. Her dream is to give her children a quality education so that they will have a career one day. 

She is very happy and thankful for the loan received by Fondo Esperanza (Kiva Field Partner), especially because it is more accessible. She also feels very comfortable with her communal bank group. She enjoys the meetings and she organizes their activities. She is the president of the group. With respect to the training, she has learned to register her expenses and her profits, helping her business to be better organized.

Calbuco is a community located in Chile's south, in the region of Los Lagos. Its etiological origin is Mapudungun (Mapuche language) and it means "blue waters". it is an archipelago made up of 12 islands. The economy is fundamentally based on the seafood industry. There are many canning companies in existence, and fish farms of salmon, oysters, and mussels, etc.

loans.use: to purchase stainless steel pots to cook the crabs, stainless steel tanks, plastic containers of 1/2 kilogram and 1 kilogram volume, and a scale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR D. TORRECHAYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba,  y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia tiene 72 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, prepara todo tipo D. paltos típicos como cuy al horno, pollo al horno y sopas, la socia trabaja desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere implementar el restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ollas, vajillas, sillas y comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, carne y verduras.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Señor D. Torrechayoc Communal Bank.  The bank is in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

This member is 72 years old, married, and has four children.  She alternates her daily activities with her restaurant business.  She prepares breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  She makes all types of typical dishes like oven roasted guinea pig, roasted chicken, and soups.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.  She gets her children ahead through this business.

She wants to stock her restaurant.  She is requesting the loan to buy pots, dishes, and chairs.  She will buy food to cook with like rice, meat, and vegetables.

The member is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy pots, dishes, and chairs and to buy food to cook with like rice, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 37 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  Two of her children are currently in school. Jane has a small retail shop that sells sugar, which she has had for three years.         

To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jane hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, Jane hopes to expand her business into a wholesale business. Jane is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. 

Epifania has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy fish to sell. 

Epifania is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Epifania hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Reynaldo Antonio

texts.es: Reynaldo Antonio tiene 28 años de edad es un joven que brinda el servicio de triciclo. Todos los días Reynaldo sale temprano se su vivienda para ganarse el pan de cada día balo el arduo sol todos los días tiene que ofrecer su servicio y lo hace de una manera muy jovial. El crédito es para la compra de cadenas, asientos, llantas, entre otras reparaciones a su triciclo. Espera ampliar su negocio y obtener otro triciclo.
texts.en: Reynaldo Antonio is 28 years old. He is a young man who has a tricycle taxi service. Every day Reynaldo goes out early to earn his daily bread under the hot sun. He does this every day and he does it in a very cheerful way. The loan is to buy chains, seats, tires and do other repairs to his tricycle. He hopes to grow his business and obtain another tricycle.

loans.use: to buy chains, seats, tires, and do other repairs.

loans.name: Tomas Regalado

texts.es:
Tomas, se dedica al comercio de ganado y cultivo agrícola, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 3 y5 años de edad, él trabaja la agropecuaria desde hace 8 años, aprendió de su padre, trabaja todos los días de 7:00am a 4:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de ladrillo, Duralita, cemento y hierro, para terminar la construcción de su vivienda, esta compra le ayudara para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, ofreciéndole una mejor comodidad para garantizarles un lugar más seguro.
El sueño de Tomas ha sido la culminación de la construcción de su casa, el cree que gracias a Dios se está logrando este sueño.
texts.en:
Tomas raises cattle and farms.  He lives with his wife and their two children, 3 and 5. For the last 8 years every day from 7 am to 4 pm, he has worked on a fish farm -a skill that he learned from his father.

He is currently requesting a loan to buy brick, Duralite roofing material, cement and iron to finish building his house.  With this purchase he will be able to improve his family’s standard of living, offering them more comfort and guaranteeing them a safer home.

Tomas’ dream has been to finish constructing his house.  He believes that, thanks to God, he is succeeding with this dream

loans.use: to buy brick, Duralite roofing material, cement and iron to finish the construction.

loans.name: Yah

texts.en: Yah is 32 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and has four children between the ages of 9 and 16 years old. All are presently in school and live at home. For the past 16 years, she has been involved in a rock crushing business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rocks for her business. She plans to build a house and send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase more rocks for her business

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is a palm oil extractor in Abura. She has been in this business for 5 years. The yellow jugs shown in the picture above are full of palm oil. Ekua is also a single parent taking care of 4 children. She sees to the well-being of her home with the income from her palm oil sales.

Ekua will use her loan to buy more palm fruit to make oil. She hopes to reinvest her profits back into the business.

loans.use: to buy more palm fruit to make oil.

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband, who will invest it in his crockery business.  With the loan, he will buy crockery in bulk quantity which will allow him to sell in larger quantity and increase his income. He is the only bread winner in the family.  It is very necessary that his business improves and that he manages the financial cycle smoothly. 

Rehana is the mother of 3 children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. She is very active and performs her household duties very well. She is also a great administrator and manages her family expenses very well.  She is hopeful that after the loan investment, her husband will be able to increase his profits and help her family to live better financial life.

loans.use: To buy crockery to sell

loans.name: Kiswaras De Palcoco Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KISWARAS DE PALCOCO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro de Copacabana, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Severina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de papa, compra y venta de ganado, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, tienda de material de construcción, venta de colchones, venta de chuño, venta de mantas.

La señora Severina  indica es la primera ves que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio compra y venta de ganado que viene trabajando desde años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de su familia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de vaca lechera la misma será adquirida de su comunidad y posteriormente criará y comercializará la leche a las fábricas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tienen dos hijos.
texts.en:
A.C. “KISWARAS DE PALCOCO" will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro de Copacabana. It consists of 10 members and is lead by a board headed by Señora Severina, The members of the communal bank have various businesses among which are: food sales; potato sales; the purchase and sale of livestock; food sales; neighbourhood store; building materials store; mattress sales; sale of potato flour; sale of blankets.

Señora Severina says that this is her first time working with Pro Mujer, as she was invited to join by a promoter. Currently she has a business buying and selling livestock which she has run for many years, learning the trade from her family.

The loan she will now take is to purchase a dairy cow which she will buy in the area and subsequently raise to sell the milk produced to the factories. This kind of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, as she is married and has 2 children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en: Kassim is a 25-year-old single father of two children living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been in the photography business for the last three years. He faces a challenge of a lack of enough capital. His dream is to educate his children, build a permanent house, and expand his business. Kassim needs a loan to buy shoes and a digital camera for his studio.

loans.use: to buy shoes and a digital camera.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en: Jihad is a 38-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children; two of them are still attending school. He is the main income source of the family. He has owned a computer shop since 2009 in which he sells computer games, computers, and related accessories. Today, he’s requesting to borrow $1500 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional computers to satisfy his customer’s demands. In that way, he will be able to increase his business sales and therefore his income. In the future, he plans to expand his business and start networking work.

loans.use: To purchase additional computers.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 28-year-old married woman. She has two children, both of whom are in school. Her husband, who is employed, also contributes to the provision of the family’s basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and transport. 

Susan has operated a clothes selling business for the past two years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebeca is a 43 year old married woman with six children between the ages of 3 and 16 years of age. Three of the children are in school. Rebeca has a business of selling food stall in Bor, South Sudan for two year.

Rebeca has requested this loan through BRAC, South Sudan to purchase beans and cooking oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Concentidas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CONCENTIDAS” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Juan Pablo, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: viyuteria, macramé, costura de busos, venta de cosméticos, venta de pasteles, tienda, serigrafía, repostería, venta de mantas, venta de comida. 

La señora Lidia  indica que hace dos ciclos que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de los promotores. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta pasteles que trabaja hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de un trabajo anterior.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de harina, azúcar, etc.), que adquirirá de La Paz y posterior a la elaboración lo comercializara de forma ambulante (sin puesto fijo). Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y vive con sus padres.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que no existen mucha papelería.
texts.en:
The "Concentidas" communal bank will begin its second cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Juan Pablo Center. It is composed of eleven members and is managed by a board of directors, of which Lidia is the secretary. The communal bank's members have a variety of businesses. Among them, we have: costume jewelry, macrame, making sportswear, cosmetics sales, cake sales, a store, screen printing, pastry making, blanket sales, and food sales. 

Lidia says that two cycles ago they joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of the facilitators. Currently she has a business making and selling cakes, which she has done for years, learning the work from a previous job. 

The loan she is requesting now is for increasing her merchandise by purchasing flour, sugar, etc., which she will get in La Paz. After making the items, she will sell them as a street vendor (without a fixed stall). This work permits her to generate income to support her family as much as possible, since she is single and lives with her parents. 

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that there isn't a lot of paperwork.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Yaniris Patricia

texts.es: Yaniris de 29 años de edad desde hace 4 años, cuando necesitaba generar ingresos para auto sostenerse y pagar sus estudios universitarios, decidió emprender su aventura de negocios, en el municipio donde habita;  así fue como acudió a una amiga quien le vendía mercancía a un precio, en el cual ella ganaba esta  y por supuesto también Yaniris. Poco a poco fue adquiriendo su propia clientela, y con sus ganancias acumuló un capital de trabajo que gradualmente fue invirtiendo y con ello su negocio ha ido creciendo. En la actualidad sus metas de superación de ingresos, son muy importantes para lograr cada día mayor bienestar y esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el  comprará pantalones y suéteres artesanales, productos de los que tiene muchos pedidos, por parte de sus clientes mas rentables.  Su sueño es poder acondicionar mejor su infraestructura de negocios, para brindarles un ambiente confortable a sus compradores y generar puestos de trabajo mediante el crecimiento de él.  En el barrio donde habita con sus familias, está compuesta por gente trabajadora de negocios independientes y en empresas de transporte de carga rápida, que en su mayoría se encuentran muy cerca a su negocio y que son sus clientes reales y que potencialmente puede desarrollarse con inversiones permanentes a su negocio.
texts.en:
Yaniris is 29 years old. Four years ago she needed an income to support herself and pay for her university studies, so she decided to embark on her business adventure in the city where she lives. That is how she turned to a friend who sold her merchandise at a price. The friend made money this way, and of course Yaniris did too. Little by little she built up her own customer base, and with her earnings she accumulated some working capital that she gradually invested, and so her business has been growing.

Currently her goals to outdo her previous income are very important for her to improve her well-being everyday. This is why Yaniris is asking for a Kiva loan, the first loan she has had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy handmade pants and sweaters. She has many orders for these products from her most profitable customers.

Her dream is to be able to improve her business infrastructure so she can offer her buyers a comfortable environment and generate more work through this growth.

The neighborhood where Yaniris lives has many families. It is made up of hardworking independent businessmen and people working in rapid freight transport. Most of them can be found very near Yaniris' business, and these are her real customers who she could potentially develop with permanent investment in her business.

loans.use: to buy handmade sweaters and pants.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame  sells fanti kenkey at Mbem near Abura. She is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a farmer.  Maame has been selling fanti kenkey  for 20 years now. She is responsible for helping her husband to pay their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy maize in bulk to prepare her kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy maize to prepare kenkey

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is an honest Ugandan married man with four children aged 9 to 2 years old. Three of them attend school. He lives in Kagadi where he has been teaching for 15 years, as inspired by his father, alongside farming for extra income. He hopes to increase his daily income despite low salary payment that is often late as well. Moses is thankful to the lenders and is requesting a loan to buy iron sheets, nails, timber and pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets, nails, timber and pay for labor

loans.name: Laura Esther

texts.en:
Laura is a single mother of two sons, one of them of 23 and the other one of 15, both are studying and do not help her in the business because Laura’s preference is their studies and will have a better quality of life, do not pass all that she lives and also give their families all support that they will need in the near future. Laura’s business is tacos, hamburgers and food sales and to her sons just dedicate to study she has three person that help her in the business and all of them are her families, her aunt, her brother and her niece, they are working in a small rent place inside a commercial place called Gigante since 4 years ago.

Laura is requesting for a loan of USD $ 475 to purchase raw materials to her food business, because she had a very good demand in this place because this commercial place is very visited, she offers to repay this loan in a term of 4 to 8 months, and also appreciate all lenders that help her to achieve her dream of see one day her children professionals.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Laura es una mujer soltera y madre de 2 hijos, uno de ellos tiene 23 y el otro 15, ambos se encuentran estudiando y no apoyan en el negocio por que Laura prefiere que ellos estudien y tengan una mejor calidad de vida, no pasen lo que a ella le toco vivir y le otorguen a sus familias el sustento que necesitan. El negocio de Laura es la venta de comidas, tacos y hamburguesas y para que sus hijos se dediquen al estudio, Laura tiene a 3 familiares trabajando para ella y son su tía, su hermano y su sobrina, rentando un pequeño lugar en un centro comercial llamado Gigante, negocio que empezó hace cuatro años atrás con la visión de sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Laura esta solicitando un crédito por USD $ 475 para comprar insumos para las comidas que prepara, ya que tiene una buena demanda por que el centro comercial es muy visitado, ofreciendo pagar este crédito en un plazo de entre 4 y 8 meses, Laura les agradece a las personas que la apoyan a obtener el sueño de que sus hijos sean profesionales algún día.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to her food business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Aggie is 22 years old and mother of 2 children. She operates a hair salon in her surburb. She has the basic facilities but needs additional products, conditioning oils, shampoos, etc. As a student of KRABAN'S 'TEACH' learning sessions, Aggie is poised to make the maximum use of the KIVA loan if granted.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Eva Maria

texts.en:
Eva Maria has been a seamstress since she was very young, learning in her mother's office. With a lot of effort, Eva has been able to open her shop and has been successful because her customers have recognized the high quality of her products. In this way, she constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow. Eva is originally from Chiapas, in southern Mexico, but moved to Reynosa, in the state of Tamaulipas, 15 years ago in search of more opportunities.

Eva is a mother of three young daughters, one of which has a birth defect that requires a lot of care and costly treatments. To be able to cover all of these expenses, Eva has worked very hard and now she's requesting a loan of only $100, which she will use to purchase supplies like thread, fabric and needles that she needs to keep her business going. You can help improve the quality of life of her family. Eva and her daughters are grateful for your generosity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Eva Maria, se dedica a la costura desde muy pequeña, este oficio lo aprendió de su madre. Con mucho esfuerzo Eva ha podido iniciar un taller de costura con mucho éxito, ya que sus clientes conocen el trabajo de mucha calidad que ella realiza, de esta manera es como cada vez tiene mas clientes y ha visto crecer su negocio. Eva es originaria de Chiapas, al sur de México, pero desde hace 15 años, en busca de mejores oportunidades, vive en la ciudad de Reynosa, Tamaulipas.

Eva es madre de tres pequeñas, una de ellas nació con capacidades diferentes y requiere de muchos cuidados y tratamientos costosos, para poder cubrir todos estos gastos Eva se esfuerza mucho y ahora requiere de un préstamo por sólo $ 100 dólares que empleará en la compra de hilos, telas, agujas que necesita para continuar con su trabajo. Tú puedes ayudar a mejorar las condiciones de vida de esta familia, ellas agradecen tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase needles, thread and fabric

loans.name: Agossi

texts.fr:
At 68 years of age, Mrs. Agossi Z. has four (4) children. She has run a mat business for more than 20 years. These years of experience have given her a mastery of her profession, which allows her to meet her needs. However, her financial means are not enough for her to increase her turnover. The small income she obtains goes directly to the household expenses.

To provide herself with better means, she is asking for a loan of $850 to stockpile mats. The resale of these mats will allow her to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

A 68 ans, Madame Z. Agossi est mère de quatre (4) personnes. C'est une dame qui exerce le commerce de natte depuis plus de 20 ans. Ces années d'expérience lui ont donné une maîtrise de son activité qui lui permet de supporter les charges. Cependant, les moyens financiers lui font défaut pour rehausser son chiffre d'affaire. Le petit revenu qu'elle réalise rentrant directement dans la consommation du ménage.

Pour se donner les moyens, elle sollicite un apport financier de $850 pour faire un stockage de nattes. La revente lui permettra d'augmenter son revenu financier et portant améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy, stock, and re-sell mats

loans.name: Noshi

texts.en: My husband and I have been making plastic flower bouquets for several years, which we sell in Lahore and other cities. In the past, we took out loans which successfully helped increase our income. However, our present income is still not sufficient for us to educate all our children. Two of our three children are not of school-going age yet, but when they are, we would like them to get  education like their elder brother. We are trying to grow our business so that we can educate and make our children better citizens.  We need a loan of $325.

loans.use: To expand  our plastic flower bouquet business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her hardware stock.

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en: Yashar (his brother is pictured) lives in Khachmaz town. He was born in 1982. This single man has been in this business for a year. Yashar needs a loan of $850 to buy foodstuffs for improving his income.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Jalia's Group

texts.en: Jalia is 24yrs old and married with two children. Currently, she sells firewood to earn a living. She plans to expand her business by building a small house(kibanda) where she can keep the firewood.

loans.use: To buy more firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock in her retail shop.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
E. Justina is in the fish business, a fish monger to be precise. Currently her husband is outside the country and they have 2 children. Previously she sold saucepans but business went bad and she has now moved to selling fish which is doing well at the moment.

She is asking for $275 as additional capital to buy more fish for processing and sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more fish for processing and sale.

loans.name: Ayalibby Altagracia

texts.en:
Ayalibby Altagracia is 25 years old, and she lives with her mother and father in the Batey of Palavé community of San Cristobal. To supplement her family’s revenue and support her university studies, Ayalibby wants to start a call center, which will offer its services to the neighborhood. Ayalibby’s father has already acquired a small local, and the business will be operated there.

Ayalibby has a lot of experience in doing business, and she’s very popular in her community. Her dream for the future is to have a cyber café and to allow the people of her community have access to the ICTs (Information and Communication Technologies). But in the meantime, she'll start with a small call center and she's requesting a loan to buy goods in order to achieve her goals. The entrepreneur thinks that people of low income have the right to know about these technologies and be able to use them.

Ayalibby wants to have enough money to support her studies and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to start a call center.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ms. V. has been working with our institution for the last eight years. She dedicates herself to the sale of clothing as a street vendor. She purchases her product in Managua, Honduras and El Salvador to bring merchandise to Nicaragua. When she first started working with us she rented a home, through her business she was able to purchase a lot of land where she currently makes her home. She is a single mother and has three children that are in grammar school and middle school.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora V. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace ocho años ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante ella compra en managua y viaja a Honduras y el Salvador del mismo modo trae mercadería de esos paises a nicaragua, cuando comenzo a trabajar con nosotros alquilaba casa, producto de su negocio logro comprar un solar donde actualmente tiene una regular vivienda, ella es madre soltera tiene tres hijos los que etudian dos en primaria y uno en secundaria.

loans.use: Working capital to purchase new clothing

loans.name: Faizullo

texts.en: Faizullo K. lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan. Like many of his fellow villagers he is engaged in the livestock business. Mr. K. is very experienced in livestock and he has been in the business for 25 years. He has a large herd of cattle. His business includes raising the livestock, selling the meat and making milk-sour products and selling them. He is married and has five children so he has to work hard to ensure good lives for his family. Now Mr. K. is applying with KIVA with a request for financial support in his business's development with a loan of 2100 STJ for 6 months.

loans.use: Faizullo would like to expand his livestock business.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella O. is 43 years old and is married with 2 children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria with her family. Stella sells food and groceries. She has been in this business since 1982. She learned this business from her friend in 7 years.

Stella needs a loan of $875 USD to buy more food and groceries to sell. She says "thank you" to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy more food and groceries to sell

loans.name: Sophoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophoeun C., 39, and her husband, Mr. Thorn Pean, 39, who live in a small village across the Mekong River, were married in 1983 and have four children, one son and three daughters. One of their daughters is married and lives outside the family home. Their son has full-time employment in Phnom Penh. One daughter is a silk weaver and the other daughter is in school. Mr. Thorn has been a mason for twenty-five years.

Mrs. Sophoeun has been a silk weaver for fourteen years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a reseller in the village, who takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Sophoeun is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: Elshan is a married man, and he has 2 children. Moreover, he is an "internally displaced person" (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Kalbadjar region in Azerbaijan, but he has settled in the town of Khirdalan. Elshan was born in 1968, and he has been in this business for 8 years. Now, he requests a loan in the amount of $625 to buy additional foodstuffs to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing additional foodstuffs

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is 34 years old and lives in Benin City, Nigeria where she operates a fast food establishment named "Tieless Kitchen." Selling prepared food everyday from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m., Justina has help from her husband and a salesgirl and is working hard to keep her business growing. However, due to a lack of capital, her growth has been slowed and she is not able to afford enough raw ingredients to meet all the demands of her customers and is forced to turn some away. Consequently, she is losing some of her customers to nearby food vendors. Justina cannot afford to lose business and depends on the profit to pay for family expenses.

Justina hopes that Kiva lenders can help fund a loan of $675 to assist her in purchasing more ingredients such as rice and beans to keep her business healthy and meeting customer demand.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
A married mother of one daughter, Angela Irina works in one of the local marketplaces in Zaporozhye called “Yubileinyi.” She sells men’s shirts and ties. Irina has been in this trade for 10 years. She has gained rich experience dealing with customers, suppliers, and competitors. Presently, Irina has about 8000 Grivnas in merchandise. Her gross income is about 6000 Grivnas. 

Irina is requesting this loan of 6000 Grivnas to increase her inventory, boost her sales, and generate additional income. Irina is hoping to use a portion of profit she receives from increased sales for personal purposes and invest the rest in further development of her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa G. se dedica al negocio de venta de alimentos los cuales los prepara ella misma en su tramo en el mercado Iván Montenegro de la ciudad de Managua. Gracias a sus esfuerzos ha logrado salir adelante llevando a cabo la tarea de mantener su humilde hogar de habitación.

Hoy en día ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito el cual le permita la compra de la materia prima para la preparación de los alimentos. Por esta razón espera que su crédito será otorgado y así mejorará su condición económica.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Gaitan sells meals that she prepares herself in her booth at the Ivan Montenegro market in Managua. Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to stay afloat by carrying out the work needed to maintain her humble home. Now she is asking for the support of Ceprodel so she may benefit from a loan that will permit her to buy the raw material (ingredients) needed to prepare the meals. Because of this she hopes that her loan will be granted so that she will be able to improve her economic condition.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: A married man with five kids who are all currently in school, Stephen M. is 60 years old. He sells foodstuffs like cassava, plantain, and maize in the local market of New Edubiase, a suburb of Obuasi where he lives with his family.  He also supplies area boarding schools with ingredients to prepare meals for the students. He has been in business for the past eight years. Stephen is an achiever and stays focused on saving enough to provide his kids with a quality education. He plans to use this loan to buy stock of cassava, plantain, maize, beans, and so forth. Stephen wants to increase his stock so that he could more easily spend the Christmas holiday with his family. He is a member of the community group called Adom bi Apea Trust Group. In this group members assist one another to provide support in handling repayment. He will be grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy stock of cassava, plantain, maize, beans, and other foodstuffs

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 64-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa, Lebanon with his wife and their child. Mohamad has been working as taxi van driver for four years. He requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua (Kiva's Field Partner) in order to do some maintenance work on his van. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan.

His clients are passengers. Mohamad likes his work because he gets to meet people and his clients pay directly, which means no debts.

loans.use: Mohamad will use the loan to do some maintenance work on his van.

loans.name: Yolina Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora Yolina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca” del centro poblado de Chipana, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno; tiene 21 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 01 hijo, posee estudios de secundaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace poco tiempo, ella refiere que su negocio es la compra y venta de ganado menor (porcinos y ovinos); su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir dos pares de porcinos para engordarlos y comercializarlos en las ferias ganaderas de Pilcuyo.
Con este préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que se compromete a paga en 05 cuotas mensuales; el préstamo le servirá para poder adquirir mas ganado (porcinos y ovinos), y poder engordarlos para las fiestas de carnavales, época en la cual existe mayor demanda de carne en la zona. Con las ganancias ella podrá ayudar en el sustento de su hogar y en el futuro poder comprarse un auto para el acopio y traslado de su ganado a otros lugares.
texts.en:
Señora Yolina is a member of the community bank "Las estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca” in Chipana, district of Pilcuyo, Province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 21 years of age, lives with her partner, has one son, and has completed high school.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for a short time. She buys and sells small animals (pigs and sheep). Her first loan of S/ 300.00 nuevos soles was used to buy two pairs of pigs to fatten and sell in the livestock fairs in Pilcuyo.

With this loan of S/ 500.00 nuevos soles ($175) that she commits to repay in 5 monthly payments, she will be able to buy more livestock (pigs and sheep) and will be able to fatten them for the carnival holidays, a season when there is a greater demand for meat in the region. With these earnings she will be able to help to support her household and, in the future, will be able to buy a car for the gathering and moving of her livestock from place to place.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more livestock (pigs and sheep) and to be able to fatten them for the carnival holidays, a season when there is a greater demand for meat in the region.  With the earnings, she will be able  to help support her household and to buy a car to gather and move her livestock from place to place.

loans.name: Emee

texts.en:
Emee D. owns a small rice field in her village. Her family truly depends on it. Her harvest is what she uses to feed her family. Now that she is 30 years old, she wants to expand her farm and achieve better rice yield in the next harvest season. Her husband, Jenulito, manages their farm. Aside from planting rice, they grow vegetables. Emee waters them everyday and sells fruit to buy goods for their other needs. 

She is asking a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. The loan will be a big help in increasing her yield. In this way, she could pay the school and book fees her children need.

CEVI gives Emee credit assistance for her farm business. They provide training and insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase potassium and urea fertilizers.

loans.name: Nathalie

texts.fr:
D. Nathalie est née en 1963 à Porto-Novo, dans le 4e arrondissement de la capitale administrative et politique du Bénin. Nathalie est mère de cinq (05) enfants dont quatre (04) scolarisés. Nathalie est vendeuse de maïs, une activité qu’elle mène passionnément pour aider son mari à faire face aux charges familiales. Pour diversifier ses sources de revenus, Nathalie mène comme activité secondaire la vente de l'huile de palme et sodabi-boisson alcoolisée fabriquée localement- qu’elle distribue à ses clients à domicile. Mais Nathalie ne dispose pas d'assez de moyens financiers pour mener à bien son activité et se faire plus de revenus. Pour ce fait, Nathalie sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Nathalie D. was born in 1963 in Porto-Novo, in the 4th arrondissement of the administrative and political capital of Benin. Nathalie has five children, four of which are in school. Nathalie sells corn, a business in which she passionately participates so she can help her husband with the family expenses. In order to diversify her sources of income, Nathalie also sells palm oil and sodabi, a locally-made alcoholic drink, which she sells to her clients from home. However, Nathalie does not have the necessary financial means to effectively run her business and make money. To do this, Nathalie is requesting a loan to increase her working capital. The meaning of ALIDé in Fon, the local language of Benin, is “a path always exists for the poorest.” Benin is a small country in West Africa next to Nigeria, where the GDP per person is $1,500. ALIDé offers special zero-interest loans to needy persons and is part of a group that will soon launch a micro-health insurance program for those who receive microloans.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of corn and cansof oil.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
El señor Jhonny vive en casa propia con su esposa e hijos en la calle Ramos Gavilan de la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene un auto el cual lo trabaja como transporte publico (Taxi) con este trabajo el puede aportar para la manutención de su familia, ya que su esposa trabaja como profesora y su sueldo no les alcanza. El crédito que solicita es para la reparación y mantenimiento de su movilidad y poder mantener esta fuente de ingresos

Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Es cliente nuestro desde el año 2007.
texts.en:
Mr. Jhonny lives in his own house with his wife and children on Ramos Gavilan Street in the Achachicala zone of La Paz. He has an automobile which he uses as public transport (a taxi). With this work, he can support and maintain his family since his wife works as a teacher and her salary is not enough for them. The loan he is requesting is for the repair and maintenance of his mobility and to be able to maintain this source of income. Since 2007 he has been a customer of ours and his history qualifies him as a good customer. As a result, he can agree to a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance of his taxi.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Mrs. Jean A., a 23-year-old mother of one, is married to Mr. Marven A., a motorcycle driver earning about 5,000php a month.  Jean supports her husband through her business of renting boats for quarrying and she is also a barangay health worker. She is requesting a loan of 6,000php for the maintenance and labor costs of her business. Jean hopes to be more productive and have a healthy living.

loans.use: For the maintenace of her business renting boats for quarrying.

loans.name: Mouhamadou

texts.fr: Mouhamadou Touré est un jeune commerçant  qui s’active dans la vente de produits de mercerie dans un marché de la ville de Mbour située à 70km de la capitale sénégalaise Dakar. Il a 2 ans d’expériences dans le domaine du commerce dont 18 mois comme employer et depuis 6 mois il gère son propre magasin. Il n’a jamais eu de prêt. Les revenus tirés du commerce sont réinjecter pour renforcer le fonds de commerce. Avec le prêt qu’il sollicite  il compte  renforcer son activité en achetant plus de marchandises.
texts.en:
Mouhamadou Touré is a young merchant who is active in selling sewing supplies in a marketplace of the city of Mbour, located 70 km from the Senegalese capital, Dakar. He has two years of experience in the field of business, including 18 months as an employee, and for six months he managed his own store. He has never had a loan. The revenues derived from his business are re-injected to boost his working capital. With this loan he's requesting, he intends to bolster his business by buying more merchandise.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Jocelle Sherwin

texts.en:
At the age of 21, Jocelle Sherwin is now very responsible for his family. He is also a hard working person, and he knows how every cent is spent in his business. With his desire to become a successful farmer in the future, he is requesting to borrow a loan of PHP 25,000 to sustain the rice field entrusted to him by his father. Sometimes, with his income in the business, he is able to extend financial assistance to his younger sister who is currently studying. Sherwin believes that being an industrious person, he can become successful like other farmers in his village. He is proud of his choice and is really working to sustain and improve his farm.

Shown in the picture with Jocelle is a field person (the one in a jacket) from ASKI.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther sells children's toys and clothing materials. She goes to market once a week to get inventory. Esther started this business over six years ago and needs a loan of N70,000 to buy bundles of clothing materials to sell.

Esther is 36 years old, married and has two children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing materials to sell

loans.name: Alioune Badara

texts.fr: ALIOUNE BADARA M. est un enseignant de profession;il fait du commerce de produits divers pour améliorer ses revenus ;il loge au quartier grand thies avec ses parents;avec le crédit qu'il sollicite ,il veut renforcer son fonds de roulement
texts.en:
Alioune Badara M. is a trained teacher. He sells various products to add to his income. He lives in the Grand Thies neighborhood with his parents. With the loan that he is requesting, he wants to bolster his working capital.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to his working capital

loans.name: Blanca América

texts.es: Blanca América P. C.  vive en municipio de Cojutepeque del departamento de Cuscatlán. Blanca tiene 53 años de edad  vive con su esposo Ricardo y un tío Manuel de 87 años. Blanca posee un negocio de ventas de artesanías llamado ‘‘ Variedades Rosita’’, el cual tiene ya 4 años de existir, se encuentra ubicado en una zona de mucha afluencia ya que a su alrededor esta el parque central de Cojutepeque, municipio muy  visitado como turismo nacional, el crédito que solicita Blanca es para comprar más variedad de adornos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca América P. C. lives in the Cojutepeque municipality in the Cuscatlán department. Blanca is 53, and she lives with her husband, Ricardo, and her Uncle Manuel, 87. Blanca has a business, “Variedades Rosita”, selling handicrafts. She has had the business for four years. It is located in an affluent zone close to the central park of Cojutepeque. It is a municipality that is visited a lot as a national tourism attraction. The loan that Blanca is asking for is to buy a greater variety of decorations for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca E. is from the village of Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Rebecca is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rebecca raises pigs for sale. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rebecca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rebecca from GDMPC.
