She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Olga Sylvie

texts.fr: G. Olga Sylvie est née le 30/11/1971 à Porto-Novo. Olga Sylvie est mariée à ADANKON Roger, un analyste. Olga Sylvie et Roger ont cinq enfants tous scolarisés. Olga Sylvie et son mari supportent ensemble les charges de la famille. C’est les chaussures et les articles de mercerie que Olga Sylvie vend. Olga Sylvie a déjà six ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Olga Sylvie vend ses articles devant son domicile et s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Olga Sylvie a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit d’ALIDé ; crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Olga Sylvie sollicite un deuxième prêt d’ALIDé pour acheter les chaussures en gros.
texts.en:
Olga Sylvie G. was born on 11/30/1971 in Porto-Novo. Olga Sylvie is married to Roger Adankon, an analyst. Olga Sylvie and Roger have five children who are all in school. Olga Sylvie and her husband bear the family expenses together. Olga Sylvie sells shoes and sewing supplies. Olga Sylvie already has six years of experience in this business. Olga Sylvie sells her items in front of her home and gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the large international market of Bénin. Olga Sylvie has already received a loan from ALIDé; a loan that she has repaid well. Olga Sylvie is requesting a second loan from ALIDé to purchase shoes in bulk.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is a member of the Tanganyika borrower group in Kinyambo, Iringa, she is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are 14, 11, 7, 3 years old.

Neema has owned a shop business selling commodities like beans, wheat, salts etc for 12 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Neema`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more  shop commodities for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Neema hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shop commodities

loans.name: Onn

texts.en: Onn T., 62, is a low-income person living in Siem Reap Province. She is a good and determined mother who tries to feed her ten children. She has four married children who lives separately, while the remainder are staying in family home and working in a variety of jobs. Onn T. sells fresh fish that she gets from her husband's fishing. She also goes them to a place that is full of fisherman to buy fish in bulk. She retails fish in the local market. Onn T. said that she finds it hard to commuting to buy fish or anywhere else, because she doesn't have a vehicle for riding needs. Therefore, she has decided to ask a loan on Kiva which she will uses to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Maria Auxiliadora T. tiene 61 años de edad. La señora Maria tiene una venta de productos varios, tales como ropa, calzado, electrodomésticos y otras cosas, este negocio está ubicado en el mercado. Hace 45 años que se dedica a esta actividad, cabe señalarse que este negocio empezó de forma ambulante, luego logro establecerse en un tramo pequeño en el mercado y fue allí que sus ventas se incrementaron y logro reinvertir de manera eficiente para poder tener el negocio que posee en nuestros días. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de mercancías, ya que se está acercando la época navideña que es cuando se incrementan grandemente la venta de sus artículos. Maria sueña con llegar a tener una tienda grande y una venta de electrodomésticos bastante amplia que brinde mayor estabilidad económica a sus familiares.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Auxiliadora T. is 61 years old. Mrs. Maria runs a business selling various products like clothing, shoes, applicances, and other things. Her business is located in the market. She has worked in this business for 45 years. She began the business selling door to door and later was able to establish herself with a small booth in the market. There she was able to increase her sales and reinvest in an efficient manner and build the business that she has today. The loan will be used for the purchase of merchandise because Christmas season is coming and this is when her sales go up greatly. Maria dreams of owning a large store where she can sell enough appliances to offer economic stability for her relatives.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (clothing, appliances)

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 45ans et 2 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de DJININA, sous préfecture de FANA, Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parentés. Elles exercent comme activités génératrices de revenus, le commerce de charbon de bois et d’articles divers il y’a un peu longtemps. 
Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. Elles sont à leur onzième prêt et tous les dix prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, 250 sacs de charbon de bois et une grande quantité d’articles divers tels que les habillements et les produits de premières nécessités. Les articles divers et charbon de bois sont achetés en détail dans les villages environnants et à Fana et sont revendus sur place à DJININA  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 20 000FCFA par mois. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi group are married women who are, on average, 45 years old with 2 children. With their husbands and children, they live in large traditional households and reside in the village of Djinina, Fana sub-prefecture, Koulikoro region, in the Republic of Mali. They know each other through neighbourhood and familial relations. They have been running income-generating businesses selling firewood and various items for a little while now. These women work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners) with the goal of making their lucrative businesses more durable. They are seeking their eleventh loan, and their previous ten loans were all repaid properly. With this loan, they intend to buy 250 bags of charcoal and a large quantity of various items such as clothing and basic need goods. These various items and charcoal are bought at retail in the neighbouring villages and in Fana and are resold on-the-spot in Djinina to a clientele composed of men and women. They each foresee realizing an average profit of 20,000 FCFA per month. A portion of these profits will be reinvested in their businesses and the rest will be used to meet their daily family expenses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal and various other items

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a 40-year-old married mother of two children who are both in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment a farming community in the Western Region of Ghana.  Most of the community practices farming alongside other trading activities. Regina is a trader, running a cold store in her community where she sells fresh fish and all kinds of fresh meat. Regina says she also supplies fish and meat to retailers and food vendors in her community. She buys her goods from big stores in nearby towns. She has been in business for ten years and requests a loan to procure goods in bulk so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fish and meat for her store.

loans.name: Suleman

texts.en: Suleman, 60 years old and married with four children, sells foodstuffs in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria, where he lives. He is excited to request a Kiva loan and will use it to purchase foodstuffs in bulk at a better price. Suleman hopes that this loan will help make the business more profitable and provide benefits for his children. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ton

texts.en: The two persons shown in the picture are Mrs. Ton S. and her husband at their own family home. Ton S. is a cloth trader; she buys pieces of cloth from garment factories and then sells them to the people who turn it into other products to sell. She is married to Chomnan, age 30, a local farmer. The couple now has three young children who attend school. Since the rice crop is coming to maturity, Ton S. needs a loan to purchase rice in bulk from rice cultivators to store temporalily.  She will then sell the rice when it is commanding a high price. She will use the remainder of the loan as capital in her cloth business.

loans.use: To order rice in bulk from rice cultivators

loans.name: Gissella's Group

texts.es:
El grupo  Jazmín integrado por tres mujeres tragadoras ellas son Gissella C. quien tiene una mini tienda de  ropa usada en su casa de habitación, Elia E. trabaja con la venta de recargas, tarjetas y alquiler de llamadas y Gissel Campos tiene una pequeña pulpería.

Ellas desean iniciar el nuevo año con trabajo para que sus negocios crezcan. Es por está razón que desde los primeros días de este año trabajaran arduamente.
texts.en:
The Jazmín group consists of three women; Gissella C. has a mini-store of used clothing in her home, Elia E. works selling refillable phone cards, phone cards, and phone service and Gissell Campos has a small convenience store. They wish to start the new year with work so that their businesses grow. For this reason they will work hard from the first days of the new year.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is a 26-year-old man who lives with his wife and their two children in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. He has been selling aluminum to clients in his region since 2006. When he first started business, he had to face competition, but because of his experience he stayed with it. Walid’s work is special in that he performs it well.

Walid is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase more aluminum for his business. This is his second loan cycle; as for his first loan, he always paid on time. In the future he plans to continue improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase more aluminum.

loans.name: Anas

texts.en:
Anas Al- B. is looking for a good sustainable project to start, as are all other Palestinians from Gaza. Grocery stores are easy to start, because Gaza is known for its high population.

Anas took a loan from FATEN to purchase goods for his store, which will increase sales and enable him expand his business. Anas tells us that his store is in a high population area of Deir A.Balah\ Gaza Strip with few stores to provide its inhabitants with their needs.

Anas is an employee of the government and, like everywhere else, his government salary doesn't cover his life expenses.

loans.use: Purchase Goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of products and a display case for the store

loans.name: Aïda

texts.fr: Aïda DIAW est une femme de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KHANDIAR depuis 9ans et demi et a été 19 fois des suite bénéficiaire de crédit. Elle développe un petit commerce d'arachides et avec le bénéfices réalisés elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aïda DIAW is a 47-year-old woman who is married and is the mother of 8 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of KHANDIAR for the past 9 and a half years and has taken out 19 loans during that time. She is developing her business selling peanuts with the funds from her loan in order to help to improve her family's circumstances.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce de diverses marchandises

loans.name: Fuerza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Fuerza está integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras que en búsqueda de un mejor futuro laboran incansablemente y aprovechan cada oportunidad para crecer como personas. Tal es e caso del proceso de capacitación y formación que ofrece Adim donde según comentaron es un espacio en el que pueden  aprender y relacionarse con las otras beneficiarias lo cual les ha ayudado mucho. 

La coordinadora de este grupo es la señora Ana Julia R. quien desde hace diez años vende gaseosas, cosméticos, bisutería y piñatas entre otros productos. R. de 33 años  casada y con tres hijos de 12, 8 y 7 años quienes le ayudan en el negocio sueña con poner una pulpería ya que su lugar de origen no hay de este tipo de comercio por los alrededores.

Mientras la señora María Bertha A. se dedica a comercializar todo tipo de productos en el mercado  esta según comento  inicio vendiendo chicha donde un cuñado pero con el tiempo y nos unos pequeños ahorros instalo su propio negocio. Su otra compañera Raquel del Socorro Barrios Vazquez vende yoltamal, atol, arroz de leche, güirilas entre otros postres tradicionales a base especialmente de maíz. 
 Ellas invertirán el crédito para acrecentar sus negocios con la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de productos o materia prima.
texts.en:
The group "Fuerza" is made up of three enterprising women in search of a better future. They work incesantly and take advantage of every personal growth opportunity. Such is the case with the training process that is offered by Adim and where they feel they can learn and relate to other women, which has help them a lot. The coordinator for this group is Mrs.Ana Julia R. who has been selling soft drinks, cosmetics, trinkets, and piñatas among other products. R. is 33 years old, is married, and has three children aged 12, 8, and 7 who help her with her business. She dreams of starting a small grocery store since there are none where she lives. Meanwhile, Mrs. María Bertha A. works selling different products in the market. She started selling chicha at her brother in law's but with time and some savings she started her own business. Her other partner Raquel del Socorro Barrios Vazquez sells yoltamal, atol, rice pudding, güirilas among other traditional desserts made from corn. They will invest the proceeds from the loan to grow their businesses by purchasing more and better products and ingredients.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks, cosmetics, trinkets, and piñatas

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Maria Mercedes tiene 43 años, su actividad económica es la venta de productos plásticos, hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella dio inicio vendiendo de manera ambulante con el paso del tiempo con la ayuda de su Mama logro tener en su propio establecimiento en el mercado, por lo que siempre ha sido muy luchadora, ella ha sabido administrar muy bien sus ganancias. Por lo que actualmente solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de de diferentes bolsas plásticas, cubiertos, platos, vasos y recipientes. Su deseo es mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes, age 43, sells plastic products. She has been in this business for over 14 years. She started by selling as a street vendor. As time passed, and with help from her mother, she was able to have her own establishment in the market. She has always been very tenacious. She has known how to manage her earnings very well. She is currently requesting a loan to buy different plastic bags, cutlery, plates, glasses, and containers. Her wish is to improve the conditions of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different plastic bags, cutlery, plates, glasses, and containers

loans.name: Dineesha

texts.en:
Dineesha is a 28-year-old married woman living with her husband in Kekanadura, Sri Lanka. She has one son, who is in school.  She is a hard-working woman.  Dineesha manages a sewing business, which she started three years ago.  She co-operates well with others, and is very enthusiastic about her business.

She has requested a 10,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business by purchasing additional cloth. 

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Anna Cynthia

texts.en:
Anna Cynthia V. is a 49-year-old married woman with two children who lives in Bollos, St. Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. Anna Cynthia has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon for three years now and earns a living by running a general store business.		
		
She is purchasing a solar lantern with a 3,100 PHP loan from NWTF to extend her productive hours and at the same time cut fuel costs and save money in the long run.		

About NWTF’s Green Loan Products:
Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation believes that the key to poverty alleviation for the poorest is to provide services beyond just credit.  To that end, NWTF offers green energy products designed to save money for its clients.  In a partnership with SunTransfer and Arc Finance, NWTF distributes solar-powered lanterns that also function as a charging station for mobile phones. These families normally use kerosene lamps to light their homes.  The solar lantern offers a free, environment-friendly renewable source of energy that allows them to reduce their monthly fuel costs.   
	
About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Purchase of Solar Lantern

loans.name: Cristina Del Carmen

texts.es: Cristina del Carmen G. de 31 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Apopa, lugar en el cual vive junto a su familia, la cual esta conformada por su esposo y sus tres hijos de 11, 8 y 3 años de edad, de los cuales los dos mayores estudian y el menor se queda en casa junto a ella. Cristina posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos varios como alimentos, golosinas, bebidas, cremas para el cuerpo y rostro, papel para regalo y otros más, su negocio tiene varios años de funcionar y esta ubicado en su casa de habitación. Debido a que cuenta con mucha competencia en los alrededores, ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir su negocio comprando productos en cantidades más grandes, y así mismo haciendo énfasis en las cantidades de aquellos productos que más se venden como la leche, los huevos y el pan, de igual modo incluir otros nuevos como medicinas y productos que han sido lanzados al mercado recientemente. El mayor anhelo de Cristina es el de poder ver crecer su negocio y llegar a poseer una de las tiendas más fuertes del lugar, por medio de la cual pueda obtener mayores ganancias y pueda tener una vida mejor con su familia.
texts.en:
Cristina del Carmen G. is 31 years old, and she lives in the Apopa municipality. She lives with her family, which is comprised of her husband and their three children. The children are 11, 8, and 3 years old. The two oldest go to school, and the youngest one stays at home with her. Cristina has a store where she sells various products like food, sweets, drinks, face and body cream, wrapping paper, and other items. She has had the business for several years, and it is located in her house. She is requesting a loan because there is a lot of competition around. That way she will be able to stock her business by purchasing larger quantities of products. At the same time she will emphasize the products that sell the most like milk, eggs, and bread. She will include new things like medicines and products that have recently come on the market. Cristina’s greatest desire is to be able to see her business grow. She wants to have one of the strongest stores in the area. That way she can get greater income, and she will be able to have a better life with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic needs products

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Hun's Group

texts.en:
Five people are making up this group loan, located in Sleng Kong village, in Kandal province. Mrs. Hun D. is 66 years old and is a leader of the group loan, as selected by its members. While each member of this group loan will use it to support their different purposes, they are all responsible for paying back if someone is delinquent or defaults. 
Mrs. Hun D. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate vegetables and rice. For this farm, Mrs. Hun D. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farming crops. 
Mrs. Hun D. is widow with a child who is a chef in a restaurant.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Fuente De Paz 3 Group

texts.en:
Margarita is the coordinator of her group, Fuente de Paz 3 (Source of Peace), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Margarita’s group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her longterm partner and her three children.

Margarita is excited to be taking her eighth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her small bakery where she make bread, cookies and other baked goods.

Margarita will use the profits to improve her business and, little by little, provide everything her family needs. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more flour, oil, butter, sugar, etc., for her bakery

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. BELINDA OFELIA, TIENE 42 AÑOS D. EDAD, TIENE 4 HIJOS D. LOS CUALES 3 SON MAYORES D. EDAD Y UNO QUE ES EL MENOR QUE ES EL MOTIVO D. SU LUCHA Y TRABAJO POR SALIR ADELANTE. ELLA FORMA PARTE D. GRUPO "AMIGAS UNIDAS" FORMADO POR 11 INTEGRANTES, LOS CUALES SON RESIDENTES D. DISTRITO D. CARABAYLLO. SUS COMPAÑEROS LA ELIGIERON SECRETARIA D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA D. GRUPO.
LA SRA. BELINDA OFELIA SE DEDICA HACE DOS MESES A LA PREPARACIÓN Y VENTA D. DESAYUNOS POR LAS MAÑANAS EN EL MERCADO D. TRAPICHE; Y POR LAS TARDES INSTALA FUERA D. SU CASA UNA MESITA CON SU CARRITO SANGUCHERO QUE LE COMPRÓ SU HIJO PARA LA VENTA D. SANGUCHES, SALCHIPAPAS Y POLLOS BROASTER.
CON ÉSTE TRABAJO LA SRA BELINDA OFELIA CONSIDERA QUE SU MAYOR LOGRO ES HABER OBTENIDO INDEPENDENCIA ECONÓMICA, ADEMÁS D. QUE SU CLIENTELA CRECE CADA DÍA.
SU PRÓXIMA META SERÁ COMPRAR OTRO CARRITO SANGUCHERO PARA QUE SU HIJA D. 18 AÑOS PUEDA ATENDERLO, ES ELLA QUIEN ACTUALMENTE LA APOYA EN LA ATENCIÓN D. LA VENTA D. SALCHIPAPAS.
EL PRESTAMO OBTENIDO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA D. INSUMOS PARA LA PREPARACIÓN D. SANGUCHES, SALCHIPAPAS, ETC; EL PRÉSTAMO LA AYUDA A PODER OBTENER PRECIOS MÁS CÓMODOS YA QUE PODRÁ COMPRAR ALGUNOS INSUMOS A PRECIOS POR MAYOR.
texts.en:
Belinda Ofelia is 42 years old and has 4 children; 3 are grown, and one is still a minor and the reason she struggles to get ahead. She belongs to the group “Unified Friends”, which is comprised of 11 members that live in the Carabayllo district. The members elected her as secretary of the group’s board of directors. For two months, Belinda Ofelia has dedicated herself to preparing and selling breakfasts at the market of Trapiche. In the afternoons, she sets up a little table outsiD. her home along with a food cart that her son bought her so she could sell sandwiches, salchipapas (sausage and French fries) and roasted chicken. Belinda Ofelia considers her greatest triumph to be achieving financial independence through this work. In addition, her customer base is growing each and every day. Her next goal is to buy another food cart for her 18-year old daughter to use. It is her daughter who currently helps her with selling of the salchipapas. The loan would be used to buy supplies for making sandwiches, salchipapas, etc. These funds will also help her to obtain better prices for her ingredients, and also to buy some of the supplies at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of supplies for making salchipapas and breakfasts.

loans.name: Tsengel

texts.en:
Tsengel G. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two children Hovd province, western of Mongolia in their own ger--a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her husband works as a truck driver in their town while the two children attend a local middle school. 

Tsengel operates a fruit retail business in her town with the help of her husband. She began her business in 2000 and since then has gained much experience in the business. Tsengel and her husband are a very hardworking couple who have been trying their best to build their own house with their fruit sales profits. Tsengel is requesting a 3,500,000 Mongolian tugrug (MNT) loan to purchase a large amount of fruit and all kinds of vegetables, which she will resell at retail prices.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Philiph

texts.en:
Philiph is a farmer from the town of Litein in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been practising mixed farming for 20 years and has employed three people from his community. His farm produces tea and milk, which he sells to the local market.

Philiph has requested this loan, from Juhudi Kilimo, of 30,000 Kenyan Shilliings to purchase a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from the sale of milk will enable him to pay school fees for his children. His biggest challenge has been lack of good markets and poor prices for his products.

Philiph is 45 years old and married with seven children who are now between the ages of 5 and 17. All of the children attend school.

In five years time, he hopes to acquire two pure breed dairy cows. He says that Juhudi loans have improved the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: Bilal is a 41-year-old married father of two children from Nabatieh, Lebanon, and has worked as a shoe repairer, his only means of earning a living, for a long time. Bilal, a client in very good standing with AL Majmoua, is requesting his third loan in order to buy a new professional shoe sewing machine which will improve his quality of work and lead to an increased number of clients and income. Both his experience and perfectionism account for his client base, and he hopes one day to open a shoe factory to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy a new professional shoe sewing machine

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina R. is from the village of Libon, Gingoog City. She is 51 years old. Rosalina is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Rosalina runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products. Rosalina has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Rosalina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosalina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Rosalina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda M. is a 53-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: food vending/processing and buying and selling of ginger. She lives in Prk. Maligaya, Brgy. Magara, Roxas, Palawan. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food vending/processing and ginger businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,240. 

Yolanda is borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Yolanda aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Diomedes

texts.es: Diomedes, de 31 años, pertenece al banco comunal “zona semillero”, que junto a su esposa Elsa, de 29 años, trabajan y progresan juntos; ambos tienen un hijo, Ángelo de 11 años, al que cuidan y crían en su casa propia, ubicada en la zona rural de Yanapuquio. La principal actividad de ellos es la agricultura, junto a su esposa, siembran en sus terrenos agrícolas “papa”; ya tienen 9 años dedicándose a ello, lo que más les gusta es poder verlos crecer fuertes y nutritivos, ya que sus ganancias depende mucho de la calidad de sus cosechas. Pero no solo a ello se dedica Diomedes; como buen trabajador, él cría una variedad de carneros, a los que alimenta, para luego vender su carme en el mercado central de su ciudad, en donde también aprovecha para vender su cosecha de papa. Ahora con el apoyo de su banco comunal, está pensando abrir una pequeña tienda de ropa en una de las principales localidades de su ciudad; asimismo ya está juntando dinero para poder mejorar su casa. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y le gustan las reuniones que constantemente realiza con su banco comunal, donde puede intercambiar experiencias. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará guano; con ello podrá asegurar la calidad de sus cosechas.
texts.en: 31 year old Diomedes belongs to the community bank "Zona Semillero". He works and progresses alongside his 29 year old wife, Elsa. Together, they have 1 son, 11 year old Ángelo, who they are bringing up in their own home, located in the rural zone of Yanapuquio. Their principal activity is agriculture. Together with his wife, he grows potatoes in their fields. They have been doing this for 9 years already. What they most like is to see their crops growing to be strong and nutritious, as their income depends heavily on the quality of their harvests. But Diomedes does not only grow potatoes. As he is a hardworker, he also raises a variety of sheep which he feeds and then later sells the meat in the central marked of his city (where he also sells his potato harvest.) Now, with the support of his community bank, he is thinking of opening a little clothes store in one of the main centers of the city. He is also raising money in order to improve his home.  This is his forth loan from MFP, and he likes the frequent meetings that the bank has where he can exchange experiences. With the loan that he is requesting, he will buy fertilizer to ensure a good quality harvest.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve the quality of his potato harvest

loans.name: Hilum Gachanja

texts.en:
Hilum Gachanja, 39, is married to Ruth, and together they have three children. He runs a shop as his primary business, which he has operated for a period of four years. Hilum also sells charcoal as his secondary business.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing KADET client. His shop is located in Kiserian, which is well-populated and his business generates a monthly profit of Kshs 16,700.

With the loan, Hilum plans to buy 20 bags of charcoal to increase the stock for his secondary business, and the anticipated profit he plans to plough back into both businesses for a better and more stable source of income that will meet the basic needs of the family. His customers are contented with his goods, and this is a great source of motivation for him to aim higher to ensure that his customers are satisfied.

Hilum’s dream is to grow his business to a level that will generate enough income to buy a piece of land and develop it. This will ensure stability for him in taking care of his family. Hilum is vey hardworking.

loans.use: To buy 20 bags of charcoal to increase stock.

loans.name: Mary Njeri

texts.en: Mary is 50 years old, and a dairy and poultry farmer. She is married to Paul who is also a farmer. They are blessed with three adult children. Mary has been doing dairy and poultry farming for the past four years. Her monthly income is Kshs. 20,000, which she uses to support three members of her family. She will use the loan to purchase 30 bags of broilers mash, vaccines for the small chicks, and animal feed for the dairy cattle. With the anticipated profit from the business, she intends to expand her poultry farming and venture into greenhouse farming. Mary is applying for her second loan with Kadet. The first loan was paid successfully. Her hopes and dreams are to become a leading local investor in both broilers and layers production and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase 30 bags of broilers mash, vaccines for small chicks, animal feeds and poultry feeds

loans.name: Orm

texts.en:
Mr. Orm C., age 52, is a married man living in Takhmao City. To earn a living, Mr. Orm C. works making bricks in a factory in his district and he earns a proper salary every month in order to support his family’s daily expenses. Mr. Orm C.'s wife is employed as a cleaner in the factory. Besides working, Mr. Orm C. is also a farmer and he owns a piece of farmland that he inherited many years ago from his grandparents. In the past, Mr. Orm C. has always hired the neighbor’s cow in order to alleviate the chore of plowing the farmland. Now he hopes to buy his own cow and that is why he is applying for a loan from Kiva. This will provide him with an additional fixed asset. 

Note: Mr. Orm C.’s son is pictured here because he was not available when the photograph was taken.

loans.use: To buy his own cow.

loans.name: Elio

texts.es:
Elio es un padre de familia de 34 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el caserío La Estancia, una zona rural del distrito de Olmos, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde hace mas de cinco años, actualmente siembra maracuyá, que es una fruta muy producida en la zona, los agricultores se han venido asociando y actualmente existen diversos fundos (extensiones de terrenos agrícolas colindantes pertenecientes a diversos agricultores) especializados en el cultivo de esta fruta, esta asociación les permite conseguir desarrollar su cultivo de una manera óptima para poder obtener productos de buena calidad, así como también conseguir vender sus cosechas en el mercado a un buen precio.

Elio desea aplicarle a su cultivo fertilizantes y riegos para que la producción sea de calidad, siguiendo este objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el mantenimiento de su cultivo de maracuyá.

El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con un préstamo financiado por el Fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Capital Semilla. Con el dinero de este crédito el pudo brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo y gracias a ello pudo obtener una buena cosecha. Por este motivo el se encuentra bastante agradecido con los prestamistas de Kiva.
texts.en:
Elio is a 34 year old father who lives with his wife and their children in the hamlet of La Estancia, a rural area of the Olmos district in the Lambayeque province. Their home is 2 hours from the city of Chiclayo. 
For the past 5 years, he has been doing agricultural work. He currently grow passion fruit, which is grown a lot in the area. The farmers have formed an association and there are currently several properties (neighboring parcels of agricultural land belonging to different farmers) specializing in producing this fruit. This partnership enables them to develop their crop in an optimal way and produce high quality fruit. It also enables them to sell their harvest in the market at a good price. 
Elio wants to fertilize and irrigate his land so that he will have a good quality crop. To achieve this objective, he is requesting a loan of $725 that he will use to improve his passion fruit crop.
He has previously had a loan financed by Kiva through Edpyme Alternativa and it's business, Capital Semilla. He used that loan to improve his crop, and thanks to this he was able to get a good harvest. He is grateful to the Kiva lenders for this.

loans.use: To cover the costs for growing passion fruit

loans.name: Ruth Gardenia

texts.es:
Ruth Gardenia G. P. tiene 46 años de edad. Es Soltera, vive con los hijos en  el Cantón Ventanas en la  Provincia de los Ríos.  Tiene  2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVO HORIZONTE se encuentra ubicada En el recinto Cachel y Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul., esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Ruth Gardenia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Agro Karlyta y vende su producto en la feria de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder comprar un  terreno y un carro.

Le gusta el cocinar y la música.
texts.en:
46 year old Ruth Gardenia G. P. is single, and lives with her children in Ventanas county, los Ríos province. She has 2 children. 

The members of the V.R.C. NUEVO HORIZONTE are located in the Cachel and Grande precints of Ventanas county. This group primarily farms fast growing crops such as corn, rice, beans. They have been farming for a long time.

Ruth Gardenia is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. He buys his products from Agro Karlyta and sells his products in the Olivo market.

She seeks a loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers to grow corn, rice and beans. This loan would provide the economic support to meet her needs. Farming challenges include pests, diseases, and weather. Her dream is to be able to buy land and a car.

She likes to cook and enjoys music.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene 30 años, es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Roberto, de 37 años, y sus 5 hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.

La actividad a la que Martha se dedica es el cultivo de plátano y café. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, comienza con el cuidado de sus chacras, ya que sabe que mientras más cuidadosa sea con sus cultivos, mejores productos obtendrá en el momento de la cosecha.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucha paciencia, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta el mercado de la ciudad, que es donde vende sus productos. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras para aumentar sus cultivos.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Martha con MFP, sabe que tiene que ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetada por sus compañeras.
Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos, también comprará insecticidas.
texts.en:
Martha is 30 years old.  She is a very humble and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 37 year-old Roberto, and her 5 children for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life.

Martha's business is growing bananas and coffee.  She gets up very early every morning and starts working on her plantations since she knows that the more care she takes of her crops, the better the produce she will obtain when she harvests.

What Martha most likes about her work is sowing her land and she does this with a lot of patience.  She has been in this business for 6 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her crops to the market in the city which is where she sells her products.  Over time, she hopes to buy more land and increase her crops.

This is Martha's second loan with MFP.  She knows that she must be punctual in making her repayments if she wants to access another loan in the future.  Martha is a very responsible member of her community bank and, for this reason, she is well-respected by her fellow members.  She will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more manure and fertilizers for her crops.  She will also buy insecticides.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica W. W., 38, sells clothes to earn a living. She runs her business in an open-air market. She also does farming to supplement her income.  

She was able to start her business with help from Faulu Kenya. She dreams of expanding her business and  providing quality education to her children.  

She needs 20,000 KES to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en: From the province of Kompong Tom, the woman shown in the picture, Chhay T., 49, sells items such as cake, shampoo, powder, and cooking ingredients from the front of her house. She also sells Khmer noodle during breakfast time. Her husband is a local rice farmer who has been working in this sector for years. Chhay T. has given birth to six children. One of her sons is employed as a vehicle repair serviceman. Chhay T. is taking out her loan to purchase more spare parts for her son’s vehicle business.

loans.use: To purchase more spare vehicle parts for her son’s business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Khut

texts.en:
Khut S. is a 29-year-old farmer and mother. She was blessed with a kid, who is now attending the public high school. Her husband, Khut S., is 31. He is a car driver and earns a profit of about $2.50 daily. 

Khut S. inherited from her grandmother the farmland where she grows different kinds of crops. With this loan, Khut S. will buy a plot of land from a villager in order to build a new house, which will be bigger than her current house. This will allow her whole family to get a comfortable house. 

Khut S. and her husband appear in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land for building a new house

loans.name: Adriana Patricia

texts.es:
Adriana Patricia  desde hace 3 años inició su propio negocio de venta de mercancía, además también trabaja en un restaurante los fines de semana, ya que ella necesita conseguir y mantener el sustento diario de su familia.

Para ella es muy importante seguir creciendo en su negocio ya que su gran sueño es poder tener un almacén y así poder darles a sus hijos estudio y buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Adriana Patricia started her business selling merchandise three years ago.  She also works in a restaurant on weekends since she is responsible for supporting her family and providing for their daily needs.

For Adriana Patricia, it is very important to continue growing in her business as her big dream is to own a store so that she can provide her children with an education and a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock

loans.name: Layana

texts.en:
Layana is a 34-year-old married woman, mother of one child, who works and lives with her small family in Nabatieh. Layana has been selling clothes, accessories, and perfumes since 2008. Layana works from her house, because she likes being a mother and managing her small business, and that's the only way to do both at the same time.

Layana has been an Al Majmoua borrower for six loan cycles. She is a  borrower in good standing, who knows how to invest in her business. She's requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy a new spring/summer collection. Her clients like visiting her and buying from her, because through coming to her house, they feel as if they are members of her small family and this is what encourages them to support her. She has smart customer care methods that she uses to attract more customers.

Layana hopes to expand her business more through introducing more products to her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a new spring/summer collection of clothing.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita O. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Teresita is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop selling canned goods, noodles, soy sauce & food seasonings in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, foods seasonings & spices. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, foods seasonings & spices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Sowali

texts.en: Aged 29 years, Sowali hails from the Kyenjojo District of Uganda where he lives with his six children and their mother in a semi-permanent house. Sowali is requesting a loan to buy a motor vehicle engine for his transport business.  Having acquired his first motor vehicle from maize produce sales, he dreams of owning at least four more cars in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an engine for his motor vehicle.

loans.name: Aida Mercedes

texts.es:
Aida  D. 57 años D. edad, vive con su esposo en su casa propia, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en   el distrito D. Puerto Eten que pertenece a la provincia D. Chiclayo.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad pesquera y la crianza D. animales D. corral.

DesD. unos 8 años aproximadamente Aida se ha dedicado a la venta D. abarrotes (productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aciete, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos,etc) su negocio lo ha colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad y seguridad, con las ganacias por la venta D. sus productos  trata D. cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar su nivel D. vida.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  D. 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderias, con el único ideal D. que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes;  para cubrir su préstamo y sus obligaciones D. su casa.  Aida es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por tener más comodidades para su esposo y ella.
texts.en:
Aida is 57 years old and lives with her husband in their own house, which has full utilities service.  It is located in the district of Puerto Eten, which belongs to Chiclayo province.  This area is characterized by fishing and raising livestock.

For about the last 8 years, Aida has been working selling groceries (daily use products such as milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs, etc.).  She runs her business out of her home for comfort and safety.  With the profits from the sale of her products, she is able to cover all her costs and improve her standard of living.

In order to be able to expand her business, she is applying for a loan through Edpyme Alternativa of 2,000 New Soles.  She will use this to buy more merchandise, with the only idea being for her business to grow and to have more products to offer her clients, so as to meet her loan and home obligations.  Aida is a responsible, dedicated and hard-working person, who is concerned with having more comfort for her husband and herself.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise in order to grow her business.

loans.name: Jack Merlin

texts.es:
Jack de 57 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil, su esposa se dedica al hogar y tiene hijos mayores de edad. Su actividad es el taller de automotriz.

Comenzó hace unos años atrás y escogió esa actividad de arreglar autos porque desde pequeño aprendió hacerlo, taller de 8H00 am a 6H00 pm. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar mas repuestos para sus respectivas ventas a la vez para arreglos de vehículos para sus cliente a así aumentar sus ganancias. En un futuro quiere ampliar su taller.
texts.en:
Jack, 57, lives in an urban zone in El Guasmo, so called because of a species of tree: Guazuma ulmifolia.  El Guasmo is a low-income neighborhood which used to be a hacienda in Guayaquil.  His wife’s a housewife and he has adult children.  His activity is an auto repair shop.  

He started a few years back and chose the activity of repairing cars because he learned how when he was still a little boy.  The shop is open from 8am to 6pm.

With help from the loan he wants to buy more spare parts to sell and to use to repair his customers’ cars in order to increase profits.  In the future, he’d like to expand his repair shop.

loans.use: to buy automobile spare parts.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is married with three children. Elma is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. Elma is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 11 years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase feed for her pigs. 

Elma has been a member of PMPC for 14 years. In the future, Elma hopes to save the money from this business to support the family's future needs.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Niño Jesús de Praga”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos en estudios. Faustina cuenta con  educación secundaria.
Junto a su esposo se dedica a la venta de carne vacuna y porcina.  Trabaja  con Movimiento Manuela R. desde hace 10 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio de venta carne.
Con su nuevo préstamo de  S/ 3000.00 nuevo soles, invertirá en la compra de quince corderos bien gorditos, cuenta que los compra vivo y luego lo carnea poco a poco la vende al menudeo en un mercado de la zona en Yunguyo.
Su sueño es poner un emporio y así incrementar considerablemente sus ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las bromas de las socias y la solidaridad entre ellas.
texts.en:
Faustina is a member of the "Niño Jesús de Praga" (Infant Jesus of Prague) Communal Bank, located in Yunguyo District and Province, Puno Department. She is 38 years old, married and has four children who go to school. Faustina has a secondary level education.

Together with her husband she sells beef and pork. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela R. for ten years, and her first loan was for 300 new soles, which increased her capital for her beef sales business.

With this new loan of 3000 new soles, Faustina will invest in fifteen nice fat sheep. She says that she buys them live and butchers them later. Little by little she sells them retail in a local market in Yunguyo.

Her dream is to set up a large store and thus considerably increase her earnings. What Faustina likes about the Communal Bank are the members' jokes and the solidarity among them.

loans.use: to buy fifteen sheep

loans.name: Erastus

texts.en:
Erastus is 31 years old and married to Mawia. They are blessed with three children, ages 10, 7, and 3. He has been a shopkeeper for the past eleven years. He earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to add inventory of cooking fat and wheat flour maize meal in his shop.

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children and provide for his family's needs. His hopes and dreams are to purchase some land, build a house, and purchase his own vehicle.

loans.use: To purchase cooking fat and wheat flour maize meal for his shop

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta works hard to support her family.  Julieta is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Julieta requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her motorcycle sidecar.

Julieta has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Julieta would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the repair of her motorcycle sidecar

loans.name: Abdoul Aziz

texts.fr: Monsieur Aziz est âgé de 31 ans et habite au Sénégal. C’est un jeune qui s’active dans le secteur de la mécanique et la vente de véhicules et de pièces détachées. Pour faire face aux difficultés de la vie et avoir la possibilité de satisfaire  ses besoins  personnels il a choisi cette activité par nécessité. La satisfaction  qu’il procure a  sa clientèle  constitue pour lui un grand moment de plaisir. Il est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis novembre 2007. Il a déjà remboursé un prêt antérieur. Il sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs qui sera affecté a l’achat de pièces détachées destinées a la vente. Son objectif est d’augmenter son fond de roulement et en meme temps accroitre ses ventes et ses bénéfices. Ainsi il pourra mieux assister sa famille dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
Mr. Aziz is 31 years old and lives in Senegal. He is a young man who is active in the area of mechanics and in selling vehicles and spare parts. To cope with life's difficulties and possibly to support himself, he chose this work by necessity. What brings him the greatest joy is the satisfaction he delivers to his customer. 

Mr. Aziz has been an associate of one of the U-IMCEC branches since November 2007. He has already repaid a previous loan. He is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs that will be implemented for buying replacement parts for resale. 

His goal is to increase his working capital and at the same time to increase his sales and profits. Thus, he will be able to attend to his family better with regard to managing day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to resell

loans.name: Jorge Antonio

texts.es:
el joven Jorge tiene 25 años de edad y se dedica al cultivo de café, contando con 6 años de experiencia en dicha actividad, misma que le genera ingresos para cubrir las necesidades y obligaciones que tiene en su hogar, vive en unión libre y es padre de un hijo.   
El joven Jorge solicita un credito para poder cubrir lo que es la compra de una planta de energia solar, siendo este su mayor anhelo para él y su familia, ya que desean contar con este servicio para una mejor calidad de vida para su familia, desea eliminar todos los candiles que utiliza para la iluminacion de su casa, estos aparatos no son buenos para la salud ya que despiden un humo daniño para las vias respiratorias.
ademas con la casa iluminada hay mas tiempo por las noches para realizar actividades con su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge, 25, is a young man dedicated to growing coffee.  He has six years’ experience in this line of work which generates income to cover his needs and obligations he has at home; he’s in a common law relationship and is the father of a son.

Jorge is asking for a loan to cover the purchase of a solar electric generator which is a great desire of himself and his family because they’d like to have electricity for better quality of life.  He’d like to do away with all the candles he uses to light his house because they are not healthy in that they produce smoke that’s harmful to respiratory systems.  Besides, a well-lighted house allows for more family activities at night.

loans.use: to buy a solar electricity generator.

loans.name: Vimbai Group

texts.en:
Phinias is 48 years old and lives in Gweru. He is married and has two children aged ten months and seven years. 

Phinias is a general dealer and has two employees. He has been in the business for seven years. He sells groceries and chicken cuts in Zvishavane. The challenges he faces include a lack of funds and transport challenges. 

With the loan of $400 USD, he wishes to buy soap, cooking oil and sugar for his shop. The additional income will enable him to buy a house in Zvishavane.

In the future, Phinias plans to run a bigger supermarket.

loans.use: to buy soap, cooking oil and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a hardworking businessman aged 42. He is married and blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. 
For the last three years, Josphat has been selling sweets, biscuits and cakes to earn a living. He uses his bicycle to transport his goods. The main challenge he faces is competition. But he has been able to retain some of his customers because of his good reputation. In the next five years, he wants to manage a wholesale business. With his loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings, Josphat wants to buy more cakes for resale.

loans.use: to buy cakes for resale.

loans.name: Alaa'

texts.en:
Alaa' is a 29-year-old young man.  He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary.  He has another business which is a store selling computers and accessories.  He wants to expand this business to increase his income by purchasing more computers and accessories.  But, he hasn't enough money, so he needs to take a loan in the amount $2,500 from FATEN for this purpose. 

When Alaa' gets the loan, he will be able to purchase more computers and accessories.  He will have a larger collection and his sales will increase. That will increase his income and let him live in better life conditions. 

Alaa' is photographed in his store.

loans.use: buy computers and accessories

loans.name: Teresa Amparo

texts.es:
Teresa de 52 años de edad, es soltera, vive en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de luz solamente, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por ser  agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace algún tiempo Teresa se dedica a la preparación y venta de helados y gelatinas congeladas en vasos en su domicilio, sus clientes son las personas que viven cerca su casa, además puede atender a sus clientes a lo hora que sea, con los ingresos que obtengan podrá solventar sus necesidades personales.  También cría y comercializa aves de corral.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1600 nuevos soles para comprar insumos para preparar sus helados, gelatina y alimento balanceado para sus aves de corral, para seguir ofertándolos a sus clientes y con las ganancias poder pagar el crédito otorgado y mejorar su nivel de vida.  Teresa con trabajo y empuje a logrado salir adelante poco a poco.
texts.en:
Teresa, 52, is single and lives in her own house which only has electricity and is located in a rural part of Tambogrande District that belongs to Piura Department, a zone noted for farming, livestock raising and crafts making.

For some time now Teresa has been making ice-cream and frozen gelatin to sell in glasses at home.  Her customers are people who live near her house and she’s able to take care of her customers at any time.  With income earned she’s able to cover her personal needs.  She also raises barnyard fowl to sell.

She’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1600 new sol loan to buy ice-cream making ingredients, gelatin and nutritionally balanced barnyard fowl feed to continue to offer them to her customers.  With profits obtained she will be able to repay the loan and improve her standard of living.  With work and effort Teresa has been able to get ahead little by little.

loans.use: to buy ice-cream making supplies, gelatin and nutritionally balanced barnyard fowl feed.

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en:
Jemima has operated her clothing sales business in the town of Nakuru for the last nine years. She is 46 years old and has two children.

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers during marketing and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to open up another clothing business.

In the future, Jemima hopes to expand her business and sell new clothes and become one of the leading clothing dealers in Nakuru.

loans.use: to open up another clothing business

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
19 mujeres de la ciudad de Luque se han unido con muchas ganas de progresar y de salir adelante. Estas mujeres son muy trabajadoras luchadoras y muy sacrificadas. Día a día se esfuerzan por poner el pan en sus mesas y de que a sus hijos no les falte nada. Comentan que ellas hacen reuniones periódicas para poder tratar temas del grupo y problemas que ellas puedan tener.
La sra. Mirtha esta acompañada hace 10 años con el señor Gustavo quien trabaja como plomero por cuenta propia, tienen dos  hijos quienes son muy pequeños aun. La señora comenta que ella por medio de su esfuerzo y su trabajo ayuda a su marido con los gastos de la casa, para que todo sea más llevadero.
Mirtha retiró el crédito para la compra de variados tipo de lencería, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda. Ella tiene como meta abrir en su casa una mercería y así ir mejorando el ingreso de su familia y satisfacer sus principales necesidades.
texts.en:
19 women in the city of Luque have joined forces out of the desire to progress and get ahead. These women are hardworking and willing to make sacrifices.  Day after day they work hard to put bread on their tables and to make sure that their children don't lack anything. They say that at their periodic meetings they talk about different topics with the group and problems that they might have. 

Mirtha has been with Gustavo, who is self-employed as a plumber, for 10 years and they have 2 young children. She comments that because of her hard work she is able to help her husband with their household expenses which makes them more tolerable. 

Mirtha took out a loan to buy various types of lingerie, which will help her a lot. Her goal is to open a shop in her home and continue increasing her family's income so that she can satisfy their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy lingerie to sell.

loans.name: Ouindinmanegde Group

texts.fr:
Mme BINTA  est la représentante du groupe OUINDINMANEGDE. Elle est mariée  et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 10ans et le moins âgé a 01an09mois.02  vont à l’école. Elle a 03 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des  plats en plastique (gobelets, sceaux, plats, bouillards etc.) depuis  03ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché de sankariyaaré en ville .Ses clients sont  les femmes et les hommes.

Elle veut  s’acheter  01 douzaine de plats ,03 douzaines de  gobelets 01 douzaine de sceaux.

 Elle épargne  ses bénéfices pour  agrandir son commerce et pour s’acheter un motocycle. Elle ambitionne  ouvrir une grande boutique.
texts.en:
Mrs. BINTA is the representative of the Ouindinmanegde group. She is married with three children, of whom two attend school. The oldest is 10 years old and the youngest is one year and nine months, so she has three dependents.

For the past three years, she has been selling kitchenware (cups, buckets, dishes, kettles, etc.). She resupplies at the sankariyaaré market in town. Her customers are both women and men.

She wants to buy one dozen dishes, three dozen cups, and one dozen buckets.

She is saving her profits to expand her business and buy a motorcycle. She aims to open a large store.

loans.use: buy one dozen dishes, three dozen cups, and one dozen buckets

loans.name: Rachiel

texts.en:
Rachiel is a 50-year-old married woman with four children between the ages of 10 and 22, one of whom is in school. She has been selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan, for six years.

Rachiel has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 47 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is single and has 7 children, 2 of whom are currently in school. For the past 5 years, Betty has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, where she raises and sells chickens. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chickens for resale and will help Betty to generate greater profits and improve her business. Betty hopes that in the future she will be able to open up more structures for poultry.

Betty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Betty who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more chickens for resale

loans.name: Ramziyya

texts.en:
Ramziyya is a 33 year old woman, married with two daughters. She is a market vendor and sells detergents such as washing powder, soap, shampoo and others. She has seven years of experience in this field, which has made her a knowledgeable and skilled person.

The products she sells are very popular among women. Ramziyya is always friendly and polite with her customers, which makes her business successful. Her monthly profit is 250 AZN. This business is the only source of income for her family so Ramziyya`s husband helps her with the business. 

Ramziyya would like to expand her business and purchase more merchandise and diversify the range of products she sells. For this purpose, she applied for 1500 AZN.  She has already demonstrated herself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise and diversify her range of products.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Felicitas;  La socia continua con su negocio de ferretería, ella sigue implementando su ferreteria con la compra de clavos, pinturas, martillos entre otras herramientas. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de herramientas para implementar su negocio y mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en: The member is Felicitas. She continues in her hardware business.  She continues setting up her hardware store by buying nails, paint, and hammers among other tools. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of tools to further set up her business and improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her hardware store, such as nails, paint, nuts, and hammers.

loans.name: Blanca Esthela

texts.en:
Blanca lives in Apodaca, Nuevo Leon with her daughters since many years ago; she has a morning’s tacos sales business outside of her house, which decided to opened because she did not employment nor other income input, so she had the necessity to support her family and her daughters are educated and also they work. Now her daughters will get married and Blanca has not a husband because he died many years ago and her daughters help her in the family expenses, but now with her business and her good sales she could support alone her expenses.

To continue grow, Blanca need a loan of USD $ 200 to purchase pots and other articles to offers more and better quality in her business, and offers to repay this loan in a term of 3 months.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Blanca vive en Apodaca, Nuevo León con sus hijas desde hace un buen tiempo atrás, tiene el negocio de venta de tacos mañaneros afuera de su domicilio, el cual decidió abrirlo al no tener empleo ni alguna otra fuente de ingreso y teniendo la necesidad de salir adelante con sus hijas, quienes ya son educadas y trabajan. Ahora sus hijas están a punto de casarse y como Blanca no tiene esposo por que quedo viuda años atrás, eran sus hijas las que la apoyaban con los gastos de la casa, pero ahora ella con su negocio y sus buenas ventas ha ido solventado sus gastos por ella misma.

Para poder continuar creciendo Blanca solicita un crédito por USD $200 para invertir en nuevos utensilios y vaporeras, para poder ofrecer mas y mejor calidad en sus comidas, ofreciendo pagar este crédito en 3 meses.

loans.use: Purchase pots and other articles

loans.name: Kojo

texts.en: Kojo is a young man of 25. He sells meat to his community and has been in this business since his junior education. The cost of sheep and goats is increasing day in day out. A greater number of the animals are brought from either Bolgatanga or Bourkina Faso. Kojo therefore seeks to use the KIVA loan to purchase some animals and breed them for sale to his clients as dressed meat.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Elkhan

texts.en:
Elkhan is a single man, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of  Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, setled in Khirdalan settlement.
He has 3 years of experiences in this business.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to repair his own shop.

loans.use: Elkhan would like to repair his audio and video cassette shop.

loans.name: Eni .

texts.en:
S. is from a polygamous family and has five children, four of whom are in school. To support the heavy school needs of her children, she has had to work extremely hard. This pushed her to join GHAPE in 2004 and took her first loan of $40 which she used in opening up a pig farm. One of her pigs has given birth to seven piglets and she is now facing the problem of feeding the pigs.

Given a loan of $100, she plans to buy 500kg of pig feed. Members of her community interested in pig farming will be able to have piglets to start their own farms. 

She plans to repay the loan in 18 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Fattening of pigs for sale.

loans.name: Savoth

texts.en:
Mrs. N. Savoth, 49, lives with her husband, 55, in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. Savoth N. and her husband are farmers and earn $4 a day growing bananas and other crops. They have 6 children; 2 children are garment workers, 1 is a taxi driver, and the other 3 are students.

N. Savoth would like this loan buy a horse so that they can transport their crops to market. She would also like to purchase a motorcycle for the family's own transportation because hiring motor-taxis is too expensive.

loans.use: Purchase a horse to transport crops to the market

loans.name: Utkur

texts.en: A. Utkur is an experienced entrepreneur. He is the father of three children. His wife is a housewife, and Utkur is the one member in their family who earns money for family needs. His business is sales of food products. He has his own food shop in the central market Panjshanbe, in Khujand. He has wide assortment of candies and biscuits (cookies and crackers). He buys his goods from supplies from Bishkek, Kirgizistan. Presently he has good turnover of his business, and in the near future he wants to conclude an agreement with the distributor firm who supplies food products from Russia. Utkur is requesting 4000 TJS ($1175 USD) for 6 months for future expansion.

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Mahsim

texts.en: Mahsim  was born in 1953 and lives in the Khachmaz region, in the village of Gorky. He has three children. He has been breeding cattle for 10 years. Now he requests a loan of $725 to buy cattle.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Changamoto B Group

texts.en:
Zainab, age 32, is married with 2 children (ages 15 and 10). She is a shopkeeper and sells general items every day from 4am to 6pm. She opened this business 2 years ago and now makes a monthly profit of about $180 from her sales.

Zainab hopes for a loan to buy more stock for her shop. She will share this loan with her subgroup, who have businesses dealing in clothing and snacks sales.

loans.use: To expand their various businesses

loans.name: Fridda Alicia

texts.es:
Frida is a merchant who sells cosmetics. She works as a street vendor and also works in her home. She sells her products to her neighbors in the neighborhood where she lives.

Presently, Doña Frida has very little stock of her products. This is why she needs the credit to buy creams, perfumes, and cosmetics to be able to keep offering her merchandise. Valentine's Day is also getting closer, which is good for her because she can offer a larger quantity of products.

Frida is 35-years-old and is married with a teenage daughter. Her family lives in the Hugo Chávez neighborhood, a poor and marginalized neigborhood. Her husband works as a technician repairing radios and televisions. He has a small shop in their home and also attends to his clients in their homes. Both offer support to each other to be able to take good care of their small family. Doña Frida has had this business for three years and hopes to start a small store to offer her products with better service.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Frida es una comerciante que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Su forma de vender es ambulante y también atiende en su casa de habitación, ella comercializa sus productos entre las vecinas del barrio donde habita.

Actualmente Doña Frida se encuentra con poca existencias de productos, es por eso que necesita el crédito para comprar cremas, perfumes y cosméticos para poder seguir ofertando su mercadería, también se acerca e día de San valentín, que es aprovechado por ella para ofertar mayor cantidad de productos.

Frida tiene 35 años de edad, casada, con una hija adolescente, esta familia habita en el barrio Hugo Chávez, un barrio pobre y marginado. Su esposo trabaja como Técnico en reparación de radios y televisores, tiene un pequeó taller en su casa de habitación y también atiende a sus clientes a domicilio. Ambos se ofrecen apoyo para poder sacar a su pequeña familia adelante. Doña Frida tiene 3 años en este negocio y espera poder poner una tienda para ofertar con mejor servicio sus productos.

loans.use: Purchase of creams, perfumes, and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma's Msimamo E Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, age 38, is married with 2 children (ages 14 and 8). She has a business of selling eggs, which she started 3 years ago. She works at her business from 9am to 6pm daily and makes about $210 in profit a month.

In the past, Fatuma took out 2 loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy scrap metal parts to sell and was able to repay them back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to buy eggs to sell. She will share this loan with her subgroup, whose members have businesses dealing in food, eggs, and drink sales.

In the picture, Fatuma is in the middle at the back row.

loans.use: To buy eggs to sell

loans.name: Jesus Carlos

texts.es:
“I need to build a room in the back of my house. I will have to build it in the patio area, as placing it on the top of the house would require a hefty investment. Mi house is very small and we are very uncomfortable as there is little room for the furniture. I am requesting $ 800 to build this additional room.”

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo la necesidad de hacer un cuarto en la parte de atrás de mi vivienda. Voy a tener que construirlo en el patio, ya que si lo hago arriba de mi vivienda tendría que invertir mucho dinero. Mi casa es muy pequeña y estamos muy incómodos porque hay poco espacio para los muebles. Solicito 800 dólares para construir un cuarto atrás de mi vivenda”.

loans.use: Building an additional room in the back of the house.

loans.name: Yenoubé Sinandja

texts.fr:
