Mr. Yenoubé Sinandja K. was born on August 7th, 1969 in Korbongou, in the county of Tône in the far northern region of Togo. He is single, and takes care of two other people. Since 2003, he has run a shop that sells tires, motor oil, and spare parts. The name of his shop is "Fidel Routier" or the Honest Road. It is situated in Nukafu neighborhood in Lomé. One year later, he opened another shop in the Attikoumé neighborhood to be closer to his clients from the northwest part of the city. This is his first loan, and with it he will buy twenty tires, and three containers of oil. 

Translated from French by Megan Berwick, Kiva Fellow at WAGES. 

Monsieur K. Yenoubé Sinandja est  né le 07 août 1969 à Korbongou dans la préfecture de Tône à l’extrême nord du Togo. Il est célibataire et a deux personnes à charge. Depuis 2003, il a mis en place un magasin de vente de pneus, d’huile à moteur et des pièces de rechange sous le nom de « FIDEL ROUTIER » dans le quartier de Nukafu à Lomé. Un an plutard, il a ouvert un magasin annexe dans le quartier Attikoumé pour être plus proche de ses clients qui viennent des quartiers situant au nord ouest de Lomé.
Le premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter vingt (20) pneus d’occasion et trois (3) bidons d’huile à moteur.

loans.use: To purchase tires, motor oil, and spare parts.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel A. is a fashion designer. She has 4 sewing machines and 2 apprentices, and she also sells clothes in the Shibiri community where she lives. She is 32 years old and is married with of 3 children. She lives in Shibiri, Lagos State, Nigeria. She acquired the skill over 3 years and she has been in this business since 2004. She is requesting a loan of $275 to buy more tailoring materials for her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials.

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
Raúl is a man dedicated to his work as a farmer and along with his wife they pay for their children’s expenses. They also raise cattle and take them to graze in the pastures. Unfortunately one of their daughters was deceived and abandoned by her husband, and now her parents not only have to care for their children, but also for two grandchildren. Their adult daughters contribute to the maintenance of the household, but raising livestock is the principal source of income for their family. They have gone through many sad times together, but they have left those behind and keep working hard. Now they would like to buy new and better cattle in order to improve the breed of their animals. For this reason they are requesting a loan and they are confident in your hearts, and that you can help support them in moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Raúl es un hombre dedicado a su trabajo como agricultor y junto a su esposa solventan los gastos de sus hijos. Ellos se dedican también a pastear y criar vacas. Lamentablemente una de sus hijas fue engañada y abandonada por su pareja, entonces, estos padres no sólo tienen que mantener a sus hijos, sino también a dos nietos. Sus hijas adultas colaboran con el sostén del hogar, pero es básicamente la ganadería, el principal sustento de esta familia. Juntos han pasado muchas penas, pero han dejado atrás éstas y siguen esforzándose, ahora ellos desean adquirir nuevas y mejores vacas para mejorar la raza de sus animales. Por esta razón solicitan este préstamo, confiando en su corazón, que ustedes puedan apoyarlos a seguir adelante.

loans.use: Buy new cattle in order to improve the breed of their animals and improve their family situation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Fatma Bakari Tusongembele Group

texts.en:
Fatma is 38 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 22 and 8 years old. She became a food items seller in 2004. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Fatma is now requesting a loan to buy more food items such as rice, maize flour, and bananas for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Safia, Mwanagani, Asha, and Tabia.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

texts.es:
Rosario A. se dedica a la compra y venta de detergentes,  su esposo le ayuda en el negocio como repartidor en las oficinas y domicilios de la ciudad de La Paz y El Alto.
La pareja tiene tres hijos en edad escolar que también le ayudan en el negocio debido a que los esposos no pueden contratar asistentes y además desean que todos los ingresos sean para la familia.
El domicilio familiar esta ubicado en la zona de villa san Antonio de la ciudad de La Paz, la pareja paga un alquiler.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de mercadería (detergentes de limpieza).
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, el historial le califica como cliente 1, es decir, buen  cumplimento en el pago de créditos
texts.en:
Rosario A. is dedicated to the purchase and sale of detergents. Her husband helps her in the business, making deliveries to offices and homes in the city of La Paz and El Alto.

The couple has three school-aged children who also help with the business because they cannot afford to hire assistants, and also because they would like to keep all income for the family.

The family home is rented, and located in the San Antonio village of the city of La Paz.

The loan would be destined for the purchase of merchandise (cleaning detergents).

This is the second time that she seeks a loan in IMRPO, and previous history qualifies her as a 1 customer; that is, loan payments were made in good form.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina baji is the wife of N. M. and lives in a place named Walton in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house, where she has lived for 19 years. She is the mother of four children: one son and three daughters. Her eldest daughter is in the tenth standard. The middle daughter is in the eighth standard. Her youngest daughter is in the fifth standard.

Sakina baji’s husband works abroad. For the last 6 years, Sakina baji has had a business selling clothes. She successfully repaid her previous three loans from Asasah. She requests a loan to buy more clothes to resell.

Sakina baji's loan group includes a few more members. Razia baji requests a loan to buy seasonal fruits to resell. Parveen baji requests a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Katherin baji requests a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes.

loans.use: Buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Virgínia Benxane

texts.pt:
Virgínia Benxane X. é natural de Namaacha um dos distritos da província do Maputo, tem 31 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 4 filhos com idade entre 17, 15, 12 e 10 anos de respectivamente. Para alem dos filhos sustenta três sobrinhos que vive com eles na sua casa.

Virgínia é estudante da 6ªclasse curso nocturno, em 1980 mudou se do distrito de Namaacha para Boane na companhia da sua família. Virgínia é comerciante desde 1990, é dona do negocio com um estabelecimento que abre as 7:00h e fecha as 22:00h. onde vende com destaque os refrigerantes a cerveja compra a caixa por 230,00mt e vende a 300,00mt e o refresco compra a caixa por 184,00mt e vende por 240,00mt. Assim consegue um rendimento mensal de 6000,00mt e poupa 1000,00mt.

Para virgínia este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku  e primeiro no Kiva, o primeiro foi de 30000,00mt e o segundo de 15000,00mt ambos aplicados na compra dos produtos, este também pretende aumentar o estoque de forma a responder da melhor maneira a procura na quadra festiva que se avizinha do fim do ano.

Assim virgínia futuramente pretende iniciar outro tipo de actividades de rendimento alongo prazo que será de compra de 10 cabeças de gado bovino para criação. Virgínia aparece na foto com seus sobrinhos.
texts.en:
Virgínia Benxane X. is a native of namaacha, one of the districts of the province of Maputo. She is 31 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children with ages 17, 15, 12, and 10 respectively. Besides her children she also supports 3 nephews who live with them in their home. Virgínia is attending night school in a 6th grade course. In 1980 she moved from the district of Namaacha to Boane in the company of her family. Virgínia has been a merchant since 1990. She is the owner of a business with an establishment that opens at 7:00am and closes at 10:00pm. Her best products are refrigerated beer that she purchases for 230MT per box and sells for 300MT and refreshments that she buys for 184MT and sells for 240MT. She is able to achieve a monthly income of 6,000MT and saves 1,000MT. This is Virgínia's third loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. The first loan was for 30,000MT, the second was for 15,000MT, and both were applied to the purchase of products. This loan is also intended to increase her stock enough to respond to the demand from the holiday season that is approaching at the end of the year. In the future Virgínia intends to iniciate other types of income activities such as purchasing 10 head of cattle to raise. Virgínia appears in this photo with her nephews.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of a variety of products

loans.name: María

texts.es: María vive con su esposo y sus hijos. DesD. hace más D. 2 años se dedica a L. venta D. ropa, viaja a otras ciudades para adquirirL. y luego las reparte a sus clientes al crédito, solo a personas D. confianza, porque muchas veces, anteriormente, no cumplieron con su acuerdo D. crédito y debido a esa experiencia María trabaja con mayor prudencia y con deseos D. seguir creciendo. Su meta es tener un stand D. venta estable, que le permita manejar un capital considerable D. trabajo. Adicionalmente está analizando L. probabilidad D. asociarse con otra persona para el negocio D. L. venta D. comida. Pero por ahora está avocada en su negocio D. venta D. prendas D. vestir. Es L. primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete ser puntual con sus pagos. María invertirá en L. compra D. más prendas D. vestir, al por mayor, y aprovechar esta época naviD.ña para lograr incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her husband and their children. For more than 2 years, she's maD. a living selling clothes, travelling to other cities to buy them and then selling them to her customers on credit. She only sells to people that she can trust because she often had trouble before with customers who bought on credit and didn't pay. Because of her experience, Maria is more prudent now. Her goal is to set up a space where she can sell her goods, something that would allow her to better manage her business. She's also examining the possibility of setting up a food business with another person. For now, though, she's committed to selling clothes. This is the first time she's applied for an MFP loan and she's promised to make every payment on time. Maria will use the loan to buy clothes in bulk so that she can increase her sales during the upcoming Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resale.

loans.name: Kararaka-Acom Sofia Group

texts.en:
Sofia A. (far right) represents the kararaka group of cereal sellers. She is 29 years old, married, with 2 children. Sofia has 7 years of experience selling cereals. She is therefore using the loan to replenish her stock of millet, rice and maize. Millet is highly demanded by the local brewers who use it as a primary ingredient in preparing ajong (a local brew). Her profit margin lies at approximately 20% of sales.

Sofia and her fellow group members purchase their stock from local farmers and millers. Sofia is hardworking and hopes to open up a grains outlet in the district. Her income enables her to support her husband in caring for the family. When she achieves her business dream, she wishes to build a modern home for her family.

loans.use: To purchase millet, rice and maize.

loans.name: Acapulco Group

texts.es: El grupo "Acapulco" es un grupo conformado D. 13 socias ya van por su segundo ciclo donD. todas ellas han demostrado capacidad D. administración D. fondos así como responsabilidad en sus pagos. Las socias se dedican actividades en el rubro  comercial D. productos como pan, ropa, comida, cosméticos por catalogo, abarrotes y a la prestación D. servicios D. construcción, carpintería y al servicio domestico. La competencia es granD. en especial en el rubro comercial pero la experiencia D. las socias prevalece ante cualquier contingencia. El crédito esta destinado a la compra D. insumos, materiales y herramientas para poder brindar un mejor servicio y obtener mejores ingresos para mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The Acapulco group is a group formed of 13 members now going for their second cycle where all of them have demonstrated the capacity to administer funds with responsibility in their payments. The members are dedicated to activities in the area of selling products like bread, clothes, food, catalog cosmetics, and providing services like construction, carpentry, and domestic services. There is a lot of competition, especially in the commercial field, but the experiences of the members prevails before any contingency. The credit is destined to the purchase of ingredients, materials to be able to proviD. a better service and get better incomes to improve the quality of life of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Ni Nengah Juni Astuti

texts.id: Setelah Mendapat pinjaman tahap pertama, warung kecil di depan rumah milik Ni Ngh juni astuti kian berkembang. Hal itu tak lepas  karena makin berpariasinya barang dagangan yang di jual. Disamping juga karena keramahan Ni Nengah Juni Astuti dalam melayani setiap pembeli yang datang dan berbelanja di warungnya.Meski lokasinya yang jauh dari perkotaan tak menjadikannya kendala dalam menjalani usaha ini justru sebaliknya merupakan peluang yang sangat bagus untuk meraih keuntungan. Dalam sehari yaitu mulai pukul 07.00 pagi Ni Nengah Juni Astuti membuka warungnya dan tutup pada pukul 18.00  keuntungan yang di peroleh semakin meningkat yaitu kisaran Rp. 35.000.- s/d 50.000 . Hal inilah yang membuat Ni nengah Juni astuti lebih semangat dalam mengembangkan warungnya dan Dia memerlukan tambahan modal lagi untuk tahap ke dua yang akan di pergunakan untuk membeli berbagi jenis barang dagangan lain yang belum tersedia di warungnya..Dengan tambahan modal ini Ni Nengah Juni Astuti lebih optimis hasil yang di dapat akan semakin bertambah sehingga bisa menunjang perekonomian keluarga dan biaya seorang anak nya yang masih balita.
texts.en:
Ni Nengah Juni Astuti's small food kiosk grew as result of her first loan from Kiva. She managed to increase the variety of her offerings. However, her success is also a result of Ni Nengah Juni Astuti's warm service to clients. Despite being far away from the nearest town, she still managed to grow the business. She starts opening her kiosk at 7 am each day and closes it at 6 pm. She makes about $3 to 4 profit each day. This makes her more motivated in growing her kiosk. She is seeking additional capital to increase the variety of her offering. With this funding, Ni Nengah Juni Astuti is optimistic that she can grow the business even more to support her family's economic condition and support her infant child.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is a 45-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Abbas has owned a tractor since 1990. He transports things for construction. He has requested a loan of $660 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase bigger tires for his tractor. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loan helped him do some maintenance work on his tractor. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn't have the amount of startup capital he desired. However, in the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase bigger tires for his tractor.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 39 años, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en la casa que adquirieron años atrás. Siempre demostró ser muy trabajadora dentro de la comisaría donde presta servicios hace 5 años como cocinera, y gracias a este empleo logró adquirir algunas cosas útiles para su hogar, pero con el tiempo fue ahorrando y adquirió un motocarro hace 4 meses, el cual viene administrando con mucho cuidado, pues tiene que estar pendiente del mantenimiento mensual y tener mucho cuidado con las personas a quienes alquila el vehículo, tratando en lo posible que  dicho instrumento de trabajo, no se deteriore ni se devalúele rápidamente.  La meta de Martha es tener una mecánica donde pueda vender diversas variedades de repuestos, ya que son muy solicitados y costosos, lo cual hace rentable el negocio, y tiene proyectado asociarse con un sobrino que estudió mecánica y ambos abrir el pequeño taller de repuestos. Este es préstamo número veintinueve, y espera seguir trabajando con MFP, sobre todo con las compañeras de su grupo, quienes son muy unidas y en lo posible tratan de mejorar su capacidad de pago. Martha invertirá 2800 en la compra de repuestos para su vehículo, con el fin de estar en continuo mantenimiento de su motocarro.
texts.en:
Martha is 39 years old. She lives together with her husband and two children in the house they acquired three years ago. She’s always proved to be very hardworking inside the police station where she worked for 5 years as a chef. Thanks to this employment she managed to buy some useful things for her home, but with time she was saving money, and she purchased a 3-wheel delivery van (motor car) 4 months ago, which she has been managing with care. She is outstanding with the monthly maintenance and very careful with the people she rents the vehicle to, trying as much as possible to keep this particular working vehicle from deteriorating or declining in value very quickly. Martha’s goal is to have a mechanic’s shop where she can sell diverse varieties of spare parts, because they are very sought-after and expensive, which makes the business profitable. She has plans to partner with a nephew who studied mechanics and together open a small workshop of spare parts. This is loan number 29, and she hopes to continue working with MFP, especially with her group companions who are very committed to the possibility of improving their ability to pay back. Martha will invest 2800 to buy spare parts for her vehicle, with the objective of continually maintaining her motor car.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for her motor car

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza has been a clothes and plates seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $30. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

She belongs to Tumejidhatiti group loan (Group code 2091). She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes and plates to add to her current stock. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Aziza is 28 years old, married, and has a six-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and plates to add to her current stock

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice E. is thirty-five years old and married with four children. Her business is selling palm kernels. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm kernels to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernels to sell.

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Cheng S., 39, is married with one child and resides with her husband in Takeo province. She works in a grocery store and also sells silk skirts and scarves to earn a living. She is able to make US$3 per day. Her husband, El Daravuth, 37, is a local teacher who makes US$2 per day. Cheng S. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase more silk skirts and scarves. She believes that increasing her inventory and selling the clothes in larger amounts will increase her income and raise her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more silk skirts and scarves to sell.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.fr:
H. Nestor est né vers 1966 à Sado dans la Commune d’Avrankou. Nestor est marié et est père de cinq (05) enfants dont deux (02) seulement sont scolarisés. Nestor réside avec sa famille à Yèvié Wadon dans la Commune d'Adjarra.  Nestor est un photographe  et en a fait son activité principale. La photographie procure à Nestor des revenus qui l’aide à gagner sa vie. 

Toutefois, Nestor a besoin de plus de moyens financiers qu’il n’en a actuellement pour équiper son laboratoire de photographie en vue d’offrir de meilleures prestations à sa clientèle et de faire plus de revenus pouvant lui permettre d’envoyer tous ses enfants à l’école et de satisfaire mieux les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
H. Nestor was born around 1966 in Sado in the community of Avrankou. He is married and the father of five children, of whom only two are in school. He resides with his family in Yèvié Wadon in the community of Adjarra. Nestor is a photographer and has made it his primary business. Photography brings in the revenues that helps him earn his living. However, Nestor has need of more funding than he currently has for equipping his photo lab. The aim is to offer a better range of services to his customers and to make more income, thus allowing him to send all his children to school and to provide for his family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy equipment for photography

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: Juan Alberto R. H. de 46 años de edad reside en el departamento de La Libertad junto a su esposa y su hija de 17 años de edad que se encuentra cursando el bachillerato. Juan posee un negocio en el cual hacer reparaciones a celulares, venden recargas de celulares y accesorios para los mismo, Juan tiene 6 años de experiencia en su negocio el cual es atendido por él y un primo que le ayuda, sus ingresos diarios son aproximadamente 60$. Este crédito Juan lo solita por que quiere comprar variedad de estuches para teléfonos celulares ya que poseen gran demanda entre sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juan Alberto R. H. is 46. He lives in the La Libertad department with his wife and his 17 year old daughter who is in high school. Juan repairs cell phones. He sells cell chargers and accessories. He has been in this business for six years. He runs the business, and a cousin helps him. His takes in about $60 a day. Juan is asking for this loan because he wants to buy a variety of cell phone covers, which are in great demand by his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cell phone covers

loans.name: Sojida

texts.en:
S. Sojida is 42 years old. She is married and has five children. Her husband is currently unemployed. That is why Sojida is the only breadwinner in her family. Sojida sells dried apricots in the central local market. As a rule, she purchases apricots in the market and dries them by herself. She has been in this business for 30 years already. Dried fruit, especially dried apricot, is very popular in Tajikistan. Besides, it is very useful for the health. Considering the constant demand for this kind of goods, the business of Sojida is quite successful and brings a stable income for the family. Today Sojida requests 3000 Somoni. She is going to spend the loan to purchase apricots with the purpose of drying them in order increase the range of goods she sells. Sojida expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase apricots

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn B. owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She is 29 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the town of Sinian, Baliangao Mis. Occ. Jovelyn has been in this business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Jovelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Jovelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 2,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah G. is divorced and has four children. She has received schooling through senior high school. Hannah sells groceries at a market in Cape Coast, which she has done since 1989. Hannah uses her income to pay for food for her children, to pay their school fees and also to pay their utility bills. 

Hannah will use the loan to buy more Milo milk beverage, milk, sugar and so on to fill her shop with items for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hannah plans to further expand her business.

loans.use: Hannah will use the loan to buy more Milo, milk, sugar and so on

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda M. is from the village of Montol, Ozamiz City. She is 38-years-old. Erlinda is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a retail "sari-sari" general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste.  Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Erlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities.  Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC.  Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell as well as to invest in the expansion of her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children and to save for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell and invest to expand her business

loans.name: Atalia Dinis

texts.pt:
Atalia nasceu na cidade Maputo, tem 41 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 2 filhos com 14 e 16 anos de idade. Fez 7 classe tendo parado devido à gravidez precoce numa altura em que o governo não permitia que uma aluna grávida continuasse a estudar. Vive com o marido e filhos na casa própria. Não  sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu da cidade de maputo no ano 2000 para boane a procura de melhores condições e oportunidades de negocio. Vem fazendo negocio desde o remoto ano de 1980. Para alem do negocio que faz (venda de produtos de primeiras necessidades) também cria gado bovino e produz horticolas no vale do rio umbeluzi, no distrito de boane.
Na actividade comercial vende arroz, farina e bebidas donde obtêm o rendimento mensal de aprox. 5.500,00MT que aplica no sustento da família e consegue poupar na sua conta bancário no Barclays. O marido não tem emprego formal e vive também de pequenos biscates.

 Este é o primeiro empréstimo da Atalia na Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 10.000,00MT para compra e venda de produtos de primeira necessidade (arroz, farinha e outros). Já teve empréstimos numa instituição similar que opera no distrito em regime ambulatório, mas depois de concluir decidiu não continuar por varias razoes de varia ordem.

Propõe de na pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder a ceder a mais créditos com intuito de fazer crescer o seu negocio, principalmente na próxima quadra festiva.
texts.en:
Atalia was born in the city of Maputo. She is 41 years old, married, and has 2 children, ages 14 and 16. She attended school through the seventh grade when she dropped out due to pregnancy. At that time the government did not permit pregnant girls to continue attending school. She lives with her husband and children in their own home. They do not support anyone else. She left the city of Maputo in 2000 to move to Boane to find better conditions and opportunities for business. She has had her own business since 1980. Besides her running her business (selling commodity goods) she also raises cattle and grows crops in the Umbeluzi river valley, in the Boane district. In her business she sells rice, flour and drinks where she earns approximately 5.500,00 MT monthly. She uses the money to support her family and she manages to save money in her Barclays bank account. Her husband does not have formal employment and does odd jobs. This is Atalia's first loan with Hluvuku-Adsema, in the amount of 10.000,00MT, to be used for the purchase and resale of commodity goods (rice, flour, etc.). She has previously had loans with a similar organization that operated in the district on an ambulatory basis. She decided not to continue with them for various reasons. She plans to pay back the loan without incident in order to have access to future loans with the goal of growing her business, especially during the next holiday season.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and resale of merchandise (rice, flour, etc. )

loans.name: Teresita De Jesús

texts.es: Teresita D. Jesús es una mujer dinámica y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, región D. Ucayali, tiene 58 años y es madre D. ocho hijos, D. los cuales siete son mayores D. edad, ella  tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes que funciona en su casa y en la tarD. se dedica a la venta D. comidas como juanes (arroz envuelto en hojas), pescado ahumado, tacacho(plátano aplastado), ella venD. en la esquina D. su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso” desD. hace un año, el primer que obtuvo fue D. 500 soles que utilizó en la compra D. algunos artículos para su bodega, ahora ella necesita un crédito D. 1000 soles que será utilizado una parte para comprar productos para su bodega y otra parte invertirá en la compra D. manteles, sillas y cubiertos que utilizará en la venta D. comida. La meta D. Teresita es tener un restaurante D. platos típicos D. esta región.
texts.en:
Teresita D. Jesús is a dynamic, hard-working, 58 year old woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is the mother of 8 children, 7 of whom are now adults. She has a small grocery store that she operates from her home and in the afternoons she sells prepared meals like juanes (rice wrapped in leaves), smoked fish, tacacho (smashed plantain) on the streetcorner by her house. She has been part of the "Mujeres al Progreso" communal bank for the past year. Her first 500 soles loan was to buy stock for her store. She now needs 1000 soles which will be used partly to buy inventory for the store and partly to invest in the purchase of tablecloths, chairs and place settings that she will use for her meal sales. Teresita's goal is to have a restaurant specializing in the typical dishes of this region.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her store as well as tablecloths, chairs, and place settings.

loans.name: Alponia

texts.en: Alponia K. is currently in the business of selling beer and soda at her bar and is requesting a loan to purchase more crates of beer to sell. Alponia is 35 years old and is married to a fisherman. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Makiese Plus Group

texts.fr:
Annie D. est dirigeante de « Makiese Plus », qui est une Banque communautaire de 29 micro entrepreneurs constitués solidairement pour faire prospérer leurs petites affaires à travers des prêts reçus de Kiva et de l’IMF HOPE RDC.
Annie gère sa propre pharmacie qu’elle a commencée en 2003. Elle aime son activité et rêve d’aller plus loin grâce à cet appui financier.  Elle a déjà obtenu 3 fois les prêts de l’IMF HOPE RDC qu’elle a payé totalement et à temps. Annie compte acheter avec le prochain crédit quelques médicaments tels que les antibiotiques à revendre pour accroitre le revenu. Son affaire lui procure aujourd’hui un bénéfice de $323 par semaine. Son ambition est d’ouvrir un jour un centre médical pour desservir la population de son milieu et étendre ses activités. Annie a l’âge de 34 ans, mariée et mère d’un seul enfant scolarisé et âgé de 4 ans.
texts.en:
Annie D. is the leader of "Makiese Plus" which is a community bank of 29 entrepreneurs established in solidarity to have their small businesses prosper through loans received from Kiva and from the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC.  Annie manages her own pharmacy, which she started in 2003.  She likes her work and dreams of going further, thanks to this financial support.  She has obtained three loans before from HOPE RDC that she repaid completely and on time.  With the next loan, she intends to buy some medicines, such as antibiotics, to resell in order to grow her revenues.  Her business now brings in a profit of $232 a week for her.  Her ambition is to open one day a medical center for serving the people in her area and for expanding her work. Annie is 34 years old, married, and the mother of only one child, who is four years old and in school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy some pharmaceutical products, such as antibiotics

loans.name: Jadesola

texts.en:
Jadesola sells bags of pure water at retail prices to her customers. She is also a tailor and she makes lovely Nigerian designs for her customers. She has been in business for four years. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits.

Jadesola is 45 years old and is married with a child. With her combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family members. 

Jadesola is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more bags of pure water to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more pure water to sell

loans.name: Marites' Group

texts.en:
Marites G. is from the village of Bonfal West, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 36 years old. Marites is the group leader of a seven member group loan. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  

Marites is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns and operates a general store. Marites has been in the business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marites joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Marites is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marites from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Mama is 59 and married with 8 children.  She owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  She has 2 years of experience in this business.    Mama needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 40 talas or US $17 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Mama joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Mama's 2nd loan with SPBD. 

Overall Social Metric Score:*               1 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1 out of 3

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university. "

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. 

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Modou

texts.en:
Mr. Modou N. is among the first clients to receive a loan from the recently established UIMCEC branch in Notto, a small rural community about 20 kilometers from Thies. The branch began its operations in November 2009, with the objective to meet the demand for credit by farmers and other entrepreneurs in the community.

Mr. N. has grown up in the area and knows farming well, as his father taught him from an early age. With his loan of 50,000 XOF, Mr. N. will purchase phyto-sanitaire, a pesticide, to protect his crop of potatoes, cabbage and other vegetables. Mr. N. is married and the father of two children, ages three and four. The investment to protect his crop will help guarantee income for the upcoming year.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides to protect his crop

loans.name: Ifeoma

texts.en: Ifeoma is a widow with 3 children. Life as a widow has not been easy for her because she cares for her children alone. She sells mouth-watering Nigerian foods to her customers, who are usually residents and friends. She hopes to own a big restaurant in the future. She is hoping for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more food to cook and sell. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food to cook and sell

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora María Mercedes P. es una dama muy trabajadora del municipio de Nagarote que se dedica arduamente a laborar con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su familia compuesta por sus tres hijos ya que es madre soltera y también tiene a su deber el cuidado de su amada madre.
Está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los materiales de construcción para el mejoramiento de su vivienda y de esta manera brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia que tanto lo necesita. Entre los materiales que ella comprará se encuentran piedra cantera, arena, hierro y cemento para levantar las paredes de su vivienda y así culminar esta obra.
texts.en:
Señora María Mercedes P. is a very hard-working woman who lives in the city of Nagarote. She works hard with the goal of supporting her family, which is made up of her three children. She is a single mother and also cares for her beloved mother. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of construction materials to improve her home and therefore offer better living conditions to her family that needs them so much. Among the matierals that she will buy are quarry stone, sand, iron, and cement to raise the walls of her home and complete its construction.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construcion materials

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
El señor Rubén C. vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera este de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y su hijo.
El señor Rubén trabaja como empleado en un restaurante de esta ciudad y su esposa es empleada, ingresos con los que mantienen  su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para el amurallado de su terreno comprado con sus ahorros y que por no contar con el cerco, esta siendo amenazado de ser expropiado por la junta de vecinos.
Esta es la tercera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Rubén C. lives with his wife and son in his parents’ house in the Pasankeri area, which is on the hillsides to the east of La Paz. Rubén works in a restaurant in this city, and is wife is employed. Their incomes support the family. The requested loan is to build a wall around the land he bought with his savings. It does not have a fence, and there is a threat that it will be expropriated by the neighborhood council. This is the third time he has requested a loan. The evaluation that was conducted qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of fencing off his land to avoid expropriation of the land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy cow hides

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem S. is 48 years old. She sells different types of desserts from her store at her home. She sells to people who are her nearby neighbors and usually generates about $3 each day. She was busy at her business activity when the photo taken so her husband is pictured instead.

Sem S. now has five children, two of whom are married and live separately and the others attend school. She also helps a life partner in her husband, working on the farm field.

Because Sem S.’s business has many clients who come to eat her dessert, she doesn’t have adequate space for her client seating. She is requesting a loan in order to improve her store and buy more furniture such as chairs, tables, and other accessories for her business.

loans.use: To buy more chairs, tables, and other accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stocking and selling corn

loans.name: Ulfat's Group

texts.en:
Ulfat is a 50-year-old married woman with five sons. She owns a small, two-roomed house in the mid-sized city of Vehari in Pakistan, where she has been living with her family for over 30 years. Ulfat is a very active and caring woman. She stays at home to take care of her family. She prepares good food for them and manages her household chores efficiently.
Her husband is G. A., and he received an education until 10th grade. The couple is satisfied because they have given the children a good education so that they can recognize good and bad and have discipline and manners in their lives. G. A. operates his own business selling vegetables. He sells from his four-wheeled cart, which he takes into different areas of the community. He hopes to have his own vegetable shop in the market where customers would come to make purchases. He has 10 years of experience in this business.
Ulfat is a regular client of Kiva partner, Asasah – a microfinance institution in Pakistan. She has successfully repaid two previous loans. Now she is applying for a third loan to expand her husband’s vegetable-selling business.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal vegetables to sell

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Un M. is 56 years old and she lives in Samna Khmau village, in Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who own three hectare of land to cultivate rice for a living.  Aside from farming they also make and sell thatch to support their family.  Un is requesting a loan to add to her saving to purchase a motorbike.  This couple has five children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory another is a construction worker and the other three are students in the local school.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine H. is from the village of Vahramaberd in the Shirak area of the Republic of Armenia. She is married with two children, a daughter and a son. With only a high school education Armine has chosen farm work to help support her family. She has been an active farmer now for the past six years. She enjoys living in her village and her family plans to stay in Vahramaberd. Her main business is raising a few cattle and growing vegetables. Because her extended family lives in the city, she provides them with vegetables from her business throughout the year.

By taking a loan Armine is planning to increase her net income by 15%. She will expand cattle production and purchase fertilizers for her vegetable growing business to improve the yield. With agriculture production being the main business activity in Vahramaberd, the continuing success of her business is Armine's and her family’s main goal.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en:
Pelagie is married and has two children who are 17 months and 4 years old. She is 37 years-old and her husband is a policeman. Pelagie has a shop that sells a variety of items including children's clothes, shoes and clothing materials.  She also sells household items such as match boxes, cooking oil, candles, soap and other goods. 

Pelagie has had this business for three years.  She is requesting this loan in order to expand her shop and buy more items to sell, such as sugar.  She also wants to buy another wedding gown to add to the one she has for rent.

loans.use: To buy new items for her shop.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta P. is 22 and single with no children.  She sells bananas, which she plants and harvests.  Jacinta has 1 year of experience in this business.  Jacinta requests a loan of WST$1000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the earnings (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Jacinta joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Jacinta's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua A. sells groceries at Elmina. She is married to a security man and they live together with their two children. Efua has no educational background. She helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Efua will use the loan to purchase more groceries for sale. With the new earnings from her extended business, Efua plans to save towards the further studies of her children.

loans.use: purchase more groceries for sale

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a young farmer from the town of Nyamira, in Western Kenya. He has been practising mixed farming for four years. His main products are milk, maize and beans, which he sells locally. He is also a carpenter and makes an income of at least 6,000 Kenyan Shillings per month.

Peter has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from the sale of milk will help him to pay school fees for his children and to buy fertilizers and pesticides for better production.

Peter is 23 years old and married. He says that in five years time, he would like to buy more cows that will increase his milk production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en: Thu T. K. N. is 40 years old with two children who are attending secondary school. Ms. Thu is a farmer. Her main activities are growing rice and raising fish. Every day she sells fish to increase her daily income. She has participated in a credit program since 2006. She has borrowed three times and the loans have been used very effectively in her business. Currently, she wants to borrow 8,502,000 dong (VND) to buy food and seed.

loans.use: To buy food  and seed

loans.name: Joner

texts.en:
Joner R. is from the village of Tinabalan, Gingoog City. He is 38 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Joner owns & operates a business buying and selling coconuts and also selling coconut shells. He has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Joner joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional coconuts to sell. Joner is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating his business. This will be his 2nd loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in renovating his business

loans.name: Violet

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 38-year-old woman. She is the single mother of a 17-year-old daughter with whom she lives in a rented house. Her name is Violet. Violet is a civil servant and possesses a dream of seeing her daughter graduate from college. As for most parents, school fees are hard to come by thus a need for an extra push through accessing credit. This is her first loan from HOFOKAM and she intends to use the loan proceeds to pay school fees for her daughter.

loans.use: Paying school fees for her daughter

loans.name: Ticomo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Ticomo está conformado por tres féminas trabajadoras una de ellas es Gloria B. Sevilla quien vende cosméticos (base, vanidad, lápiz labial, delineadores, etc.) y ropa (camisas, pantalones, camisetas, etc) desde hace cuatro años. Ella con el préstamo comprara mercadería para mejorar su negocio.
Las otras integrantes son Antonia Doribel P. vende ropa variada desde camisas, vestidos, blusas, etc. desde hace 5 años y Clara Jiménez desde hace tres años tiene una pequeña pulpería la cual inicio con la venta de gaseosas y chivería.
texts.en:
The Ticomo Group is made up of three hard-working women. One of them is Gloria B. Sevilla, who sells cosmetics - including foundation, lipgloss, eyeliners, etc - and clothes - including shirts, trousers, tops etc. With the looan she will buy merchandise to improve her business. 

The other members of the group are Antonia Doribel P., who for 5 years has been selling a variety of clothes including shirts, dresses, blouses etc, and Clara Jiménez, who for 3 years has had a small general store, which she started by selling sodas and dairy products.

loans.use: Clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Ajarkul

texts.en:
Ajarkul T. is a 46 year-old farmer. She is married and has three children. Her family has been engaged in cattle breeding for the past 15 years, which is the only mean of subsistence for them. They started this business with the initial capital of 8,000 Kyrgyz Soms and managed to earn 5,000 Kyrgyz Soms monthly. To reduce expenses for the livestock's foraging, Ajarkul pastures her livestock in the mountainous areas with native grasses. With the revenues from these activities, she was able to pay for higher education for her son. 

Now Ajarkul is applying for a loan of 60,000 Kyrgyz Soms to buy bull-calves. With the revenues, she plans to broaden her business by means of breeding. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Unidad Vecinal C Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Unidad Vecinal C” iniciará su  segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, han superado el primer ciclo en el que han identificado sus virtudes y debilidades.  Está compuesta por diez integrantes.  Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados: venta de queso, leche, papa; venta de abarrotes, venta de mantas, venta de comida, confección de deportivos, venta de avena, venta de material escolar, ventas de chamarras.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por una presidenta, una tesorera y una secretaria de actas.

La señora Genoveva, presidenta de la banca comunal, indica que forma parte del B.C. “Unidad Vecinal C” gracias a la invitación de unas amistades. Casada, madre de cuatro hijos, su negocio es el de confección de deportivos, desde hace más de ocho años, el esposo fue quien le enseñó.  Comenta que con el tiempo ha logrado desarrollar un producto de calidad y que es muy importante la calidad de la tela y de la costura, para mantener un espacio en el mercado, pues hay mucha competencia.

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que es el ahorro en primer lugar, en segundo lugar la oportunidad que tiene de compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The “Unidad Vecinal C” C.B. [Neighborhood Unity C Communal Bank] will begin their second cycle in ProMujer as part of the Focal Center of The Andes. They have exceeded the first cycle in that they have identified their strengths and their weaknesses. The group is comprised of ten members. The businesses that they undertake are varied: the sale of cheese, milk, potatoes; the sale of dried goods staples; the sale of blankets, the sale of food, the making of sportswear, the sale of oats, the sale of school supplies, the sale of jackets. The directive board is comprised of a president, a treasurer and a secretary of minutes. 

Mrs. Genoveva, the communal bank’s president, says that she is part of the C.B. (communal bank) thanks to an invitation from a few friends. Married and the mother of four children, she has been in the sportswear making business for over eight years. Her husband was the one who taught her. She says that over time she has succeeded in developing a quality product and that the quality of the fabric and of the sewing are very important for maintaining a space in the market, as there is a lot of competition. 

When asked about what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that first and foremost are the savings, and secondly she likes the opportunity she has of sharing with her partners.

loans.use: The purchase of fasteners and thread.

loans.name: Ghulam Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Sughran is a housewife. She prefers to stay at home and perform her household responsibilities. She lives in Khanewala, Pakistan, a city that is famous for its agriculture industry. She has lived in the Basti Zahoorabad area with her family for over 9 years. 

She is the mother of three sons. Her eldest son operates a shop in the market where he sells milk and yogurt. Her youngest son is studying in 4th class. The middle one is free and doesn’t do anything. 

Sughran has applied for a loan from Asasah, a Kiva field partner, to help her husband's fruit business. He sells fresh fruits from his four-wheeled cart by visiting different streets of the city. He buys fruit cheaply from the fruit markets and sells them for a good profit. With the loan, he will buy a new cart and seasonal fruits to improve his business. He needs to replace his cart because many parts are broken and its wheels are out of order.
  
Sughran hopes that the loan investment in her husband’s business will be a profitable one and he will be able to improve his business. She is a regular Asasah borrower and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and attended every meeting.

In the photo, Ghulam Sughran is the woman who is holding the Asasah Passbook.

loans.use: To buy a new cart and seasonal fruits for her husband's fruit business

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian A.'s main source of income comes from making and selling snacks and other delicacies like rice cakes and cassava cakes in her community. She is 44 years old, married and has six grown-up children. She lives in the village of Comon, Mambajao, Camiguin province. Lilian has been in her business for over a year and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Lilian joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lilian has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Lilian is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed like flour. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed like flour

loans.name: America

texts.es: America, de 38 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 4 queridos hijos y lo que más desea es brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Con mucho esfuerzo America a logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, papa y alverja, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender hasta el mercado de la ciudad de Tarma, donde las vende al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Para más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus plantaciones. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, hará limpiar su chacra y contratará peones, para que la ayuden en el cultivo.
texts.en: America is 38 years old and is a very friendly and hardworking woman.  She lives in her own house with her four children and what she wants most is to provide them with a better quality of life.  With a lot of effort, America has been able to work her lands and make them very productive.  She grows potatoes and peas – products which she later brings to sell wholesale at the Tarma city market.  What she likes most about her work is caring for her crops.  She has been in this area of work for 10 years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her crops because the sacks that she carries are very heavy and tiring.  In the future, she wants to purchase new lands to expand her fields.  This is her ninth loan with MFP and she has been very punctual in repaying her previous loans and hopes to do so now as well.  She is an active participant in her communal bank and is always aware of the agreements that have been reached in the group.  With the 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) requested, she will clear her farmland and hire workers to help with the farming.

loans.use: To hire workers to help clear and sow the lands.

loans.name: Martha Mercedes

texts.es:
Martha Mercedes M. L., tiene 42 años, vive en unión libre con su esposo, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 6 hijos 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Los Ángeles, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 14 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz. 

Martha Mercedes se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, Compra sus productos en  Ecua - Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando

Le gusta hacer amigos y amable.
texts.en:
Martha Mercedes M. L. is 42 years old.  She is in a common-law marriage; she and her husband live in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province.  She has six children.

The members of the Ciudadela Los Ángeles Communal Bank are located in the Los Ángeles neighborhood in the Ventanas canton.  This bank has 14 members who devote themselves to growing short cycle corn.

Martha Mercedes M. L. grows corn.  She buys her products in Ecua-Agro, and she sells them at the same place.

She is requesting a loan to plant corn and to buy supplies and seeds.  The loan will help her financially so that she can get her necessities.  She faces challenges like pest infestations, diseases, and climate changes.

Her dream is to keep working.

She likes being friendly and making friends.

loans.use: To buy supplies and seeds

loans.name: Sabati Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe SABATI sont toutes mariés avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, et en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles monogamiques à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, le prêt passé a été remboursé dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les condiments alimentaires avec  FATOUMATA C.. 
FATOUMATA C.  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10 paniers de tomates et 10 kg d’oignons au grand marché de Sikasso. Les condiments sont revendus au  marché de SANOUBOUGOU I et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail et au comptant. 
 Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000 FCFA utilisée pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The six members of the SABATE group are all married, with an average age of 30, and an average of 4 children. They live in monogamous families in Sanoubougou I, a district of the city of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. 
This is the second loan they are requesting from the micro finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers. Their past loan was regularly repaid. This group of women sells sundry items such as condiments and the person in charge of this is Fatoumata C.. 
With this loan she intends to buy 10 baskets of tomatoes and 10 kg of onions at the big market of Sikasso. Their condiments are sold at the market of Sanoubougou I and among family members, to men and women, retail and cash. 
Their expectation is to earn an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA to use for the daily expenses of their families.

loans.use: Purchase of condiments ingredients

loans.name: Expedito

texts.en:
Expedito L. is from the village of Malagana, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. He is 30 years old. Expedito is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Expedito owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling seafood products, including fish like sardines and milk fish, in the local community. Expedito has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. He is also engaged in retailing business, as his wife is in charge in the store. Expedito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Expedito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Expedito is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like mackerel and salmon. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Expedito from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like mackerel and salmon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her cooking business

loans.name: Joeriza

texts.en:
Joeriza E. is from the village of LABO, ALORAN, MIS. OCC.. She is 27 years old, married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Joeriza owns & operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing retail mineral water in the community. Joeriza has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month from this activity.

In 2011, Joeriza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joeriza is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Joeriza from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business invest in another branch for the business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia del Socorro Ramírez Castillo es una fémina trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 40 años. Ella inicio su negocio con la venta de comida y nacatamales, luego puso una repostería la cual le proporciona un mayor ingreso. 
Ramírez  trabaja por encargo realizando queques, bocadillos, pizas… etc. por más de un año. Ella con el crédito comprara una batidora industrial lo que le permitirá trabajar mejor.
texts.en: Lucia del Socorro Ramírez Castillo is a hardworking, determined and enterprising 40 year old woman. She started her business by selling food and nacatamales [parcels of steamed maize with a savoury filling, wrapped in a banana leaf]. Later she set up a snack bar, which allowed her to increase her income. Senora Ramírez has been working making cakes, sandwiches, pizzas etc to order for over a year now. With the loan she intends to buy an industrial food mixer.

loans.use: to buy an industrial food mixer.

loans.name: Mot

texts.en: Mot O. is a 50-year-old farmer residing in the rural area of Kompong Cham province. She plants a rice crop that is her annual business. Besides this, she also works in the construction field as a requirement worker for extra-income. Her husband also earns money by working as a casual construction worker. Mot O. is looking for a loan to buy a motorcycle in order to ride to her work place. Mot O. has six children, five of whom are single and one is married and lives in their own house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle in order to ride to her work place

loans.name: Emerinciana

texts.en:
Emerinciana C. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 31 years old. Emerinciana is married and has nine school-aged children. To make a living, Emerinciana owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, shampoo, soap & instant noodles in the local community. Emerinciana has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Emerinciana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emerinciana is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & biscuits. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Emerinciana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & biscuits.

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en: Nguyen Thi Hien is a 36-year-old woman with 2 children who is living in Yen Phong district. She has been with our credit program since 2007. Nguyen invested in opening a small restaurant that serves breakfast. Her business has developed more and more and has created a stable income for her to manage her family life. Since participating in our credit program, Nguyen has always repaid her loans on time.  For new loan cycle, she wants to borrow a loan of 9,184,000 VND to  buy more  kitchen equipment  to ensure the hygienic  standard.

loans.use: to buy more kitchen equipment  to ensure the hygienic  standard

loans.name: Sawe Rahayu Indah Group

texts.en:
Ni Komang is a pig farmer in her village. Because she wanted to improve the welfare of her village, she formed a group of pig farmers and teaches them how to raise pigs so they can succeed. For financial support, the group borrowed from MUK. Ni Komang and the ten members of this group received loans of 1.5 million Indonesian rupiah per member to be used to buy three piglets. They hope their efforts will be successful and they will be independent. 

Ni Komang is in the front row on the far right.

loans.use: to buy three piglets.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: Carmen is 35 years old and lives in Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children. Carmen has had a shop that sells grocery products for three years. She requested a loan of 3,000.00 to purchase additional canned goods, noodles, and snacks to sell. Carmen has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, she hopes to use her earnings from the business to provide a decent home, food, and education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods , noodles and snacks to sell

loans.name: Maricela Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maricela, vive con su familia, tiene un hijo D. 5 años D. edad, ella con su esposo trabajan la agricultura, sembrando frijol y maíz, desD. hace 10 años, ella contrata mozos para que le ayuden a realizar la tarea D. preparar el terreno y sembrar, el horario D. trabajo inicia a las 6:00am hasta las 3:00pm.
Ella actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. fertilizantes para el cultivo, ya que es parte importante para realizar la siembra, siempre se inicia abonando y fertilizando el terreno, esta compra D. materiales le ayudara a tener lo necesario a través del préstamo, aunque su riesgo siempre será la época lluviosa.
Su objetivo es ver crecer a su hijo, apoyarle en sus estudios y trabajar arduamente para conseguir sus objetivos.
texts.en: Maricela lives with her family and 5-year old son.  Her husband and her have worked in agriculture for the last 10 years, growing corn and beans.  She employs farm hands to prepare the soil and plant crop seed, working from 6:00am to 3:00pm.  Maricela seeks this credit to purchase fertilizer to increase her crop yield, and hopes to overcome the uncertainty of the rainy season for growing her crops.  She hopes to be able to give her son a good education, and to meet her goals to prosper.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for crops

loans.name: Nuria Elizabeth

texts.es: Nuria Elizabeth de treinta y siete años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una tienda que le ayuda a solventar los gastos de su hogar; Nuria es una excelente vendedora y les da buen servicio a las personas que buscan su negocio, últimamente se ha hecho demás clientela pues los productos que vende son de muy buena calidad y a un precio accesible, ella siempre se encuentra adelante de la competencia pues es una mujer muy activa y con ganas de salir adelante, Nuria piensa que el mejor secreto en su trabajo es amar lo que hace sin darse por vencida es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mas mercadería como golosinas, especies, granos básicos, jabón, bebidas, embutidos, entre otros así podrá seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de su clientela. Nuria tiene la confianza de que su esfuerzo le permitirá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Nuria Elizabeth is thirty-seven years old and she lives together with her life partner and their three children, in a house of their own. She has a store and it helps her to cover the household expenses. Nuria is an excellent salesperson and she provides good customer service to individuals who patronize her business. Lately her clientele has grown, given that the products she sells are of very high quality and they are sold at an accessible price. She always finds herself ahead of the competition because she is a very active woman who is eager to get ahead. Nuria thinks that the key to her business is to love what she does without every giving up. She requests a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner).
