It will help her purchase more merchandise such as snacks, spices, basic grains, soaps, drinks, sausages, and other products to be able to keep satisfying the needs of her clients. Nuria trusts that her efforts will help her provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, spices, basic grains, soaps, drinks, and sausages.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Unidas se llama el comité formado por 15 mujeres de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, las cuales se unieron con el objetivo principal del crecimiento de cada una de ellas, tanto social como económicamente, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras. Lo destacable de ellas es la forma unida en la que trabajan, todo esto en consecución a los fines propuestos.
La Sra. Cipriana se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, gracias a este negocio ella ha podido generar un poco de ingresos que le ayuda a solventar todos los gastos de la casa. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora. Comenta que todo lo que hace es por el bien de su familia y de todos quienes dependen de ella. Sueña con un día poder abrir una mercería donde vender sus productos.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de cosméticos, que le servirá para abastecerse. Da las gracias a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le brinda.
texts.en:
"Mujeres Unidas" (Women United) is the name of the committee made up of 15 women from the city of San Lorenzo. Their main aim is to grow both socially and economically. The women are well known in their community for being very hardworking and having a fighting spirit. What stands out most about them is the way their work together as a team to reach the goals they have set for themselves. 

Thanks to her business selling cosmetics, Cipriana has been able to generate some income which has helped her to take care of her home expenses. Cipriana describes herself as a hardworking and enterprising woman. She tells us that everything she does is for the good of her family and everyone who depends on her. She dreams of one day opening a market where she could sell her products.

Cipriana is requesting a loan to purchase cosmetics to stock up her current supply. She gives thanks to the Foundation for the opportunity that they have provided her with.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 43 years old and lives in the airport community. She is married and has eight children between 7 and 30 years old. Four of her children are in school and they all live at home. Her husband is a driver. For the past nine years, she has been selling plantain and peppers. She started this business with a little capital that she received from her husband. She learned this business from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase plantain and peppers for her business. She plans to build her house and sent her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase plantain and peppers to sell

loans.name: Mayonita

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Mayonita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store. Mayonita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair and maintenance of her fishing boat.

Mayonita has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the repair and maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa nació en la ciudad de Pisaq (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 53 años de edad, ella es casada y fruto de hermosa relación tiene cinco hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades, ella se dedica a la venta de dulces en el kiosco del colegio de la comunidad Tambohuaso. 

Ya son 25 años que se dedican a este negocio y les va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El crédito que requiere Felipa es para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo dulces, galletas, pasteles, tortas y otras cosas más.

Banco Comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Urubamba” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Felipa was born in the city of Pisaq (Cusco, Peru), and she is 53 years old.  She is married and has 5 children from this beautiful relationship.  Now she lives in the city where she was born, and this is where she has her business.  She has a business selling sweets from a kiosk in a school in the community of Tambohuaso.

She has had this business for 25 years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  Felipe needs a loan to buy merchandise such as: candy, cookies, cakes and other products.

The communal bank “Señor de los Milagros de Urubamba” meets every 30 days in the Pisaq district of Calca province, in the department of Cusco, Peru.  Cusco is known for its tourism and trade, for its traditional Inti Raymi (Festival of the Sun) festivities, and because it is the gateway to Machu Picchu, one of the 7 wonders of the world.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as: sweets, cookies, pastries, cakes and other items

loans.name: Isabel Graciela

texts.es:
Isabel  D. 54 años D. edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con todos los servicio básicos, ubicada en el distrito D. Guadalupe que pertenece al departamento D. La Libertad.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

DesD. hace varios años Isabel se dedica la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad (leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, etc) golosinas y bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad y seguridad, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta D. sus productos  trata D. cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar su nivel D. vida.

Para poder  implementar su negocio ha solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  D. 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías, con el único ideal D. que su negocio crezca y tenga productos más surtidos para ofrecerles a sus clientes.  Isabel es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por el bienestar D. su familia.
texts.en:
Isabel is 54 years old and lives with her family in a home that they own. They have all the basic services. Isabel resides in the District of Guadalupe, which is part of the Department of La Libertad. This area is known for its businesses that involve agriculture and livestock breeding.

For several years Isabel has been selling basic necessities such as milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, candy, and beverages. Her business is located in her home so that she can be comfortable and secure. With the income she earns from selling these products, Isabel is able to cover all of her expenses and improve her standard of living.

To keep her business in operation, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN. The money will be used to buy more merchandise. Her ideal wish for her business is to grow and be stocked with more products to offer to her customers. Isabel is a responsible, dedicated, and hardworking individual who is concerned about the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 56-year-old married man living with his wife and two children. He has 25 years of experience working in selling fish. In 1990, since he works on a freelance basis, he bought a trolley to use for fish carrying. In order to develop his work and facilitate his business operation, Ali is applying today for a loan of $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a minivan. He states that the van will help him expand his business into other areas where his fish sales will be increased. He feels positive about his business prospects and is willing to open a fish store within the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase a minivan.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica used her previous loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy carrots. Her business improved and she was able to raise her living standards. Her desire is to become financially stable in the future. 
Veronica has requested another loan of 100,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy carrots and potatoes.

loans.use: to buy carrots and potatoes

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 52 years old, married, and has two children.  She works hard to provide for her family. Rosita runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 33 years.  She also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Rosita is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to purchase additional stock to sell.  Rosita has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF.

Rosita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Juana; la socia tiene 38 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 3 hijos ; La socia ahora se dedica al negocio de venta de productos secos como maiz,trigo,cebada entre otros productos secos,la socia vende en el mercado de Huancaro,ella vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de productos secos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maiz,cebada,trigo y papa al por mayor.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Juana is 38 years old and lives with her partner.  She has three children.  Her current business is selling dried products such as corn, wheat, barley, etc.  She sells her products in Huancaro market, from 8.00am to 4.00pm.  She would like to expand and improve her dried products business.  Juana is requesting this loan to buy corn, barley, wheat and potatoes wholesale.

Juana is grateful for her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy corn, barley, wheat and potatoes wholesale

loans.name: Albertine

texts.fr:
Cliente de 51 ans, celibataire avec 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 22 et 33 ans.A l'obtention de son diplôme comme agent de sante, n'ayant pas pu trouver du travail , elle se lance dans la vente de bois, il y'a bientôt 23 ans.
Étant bénéficiaire de Hope bientôt une année, ces differents prêts ont largement contribue a l'épanouissement spirituelle,financière et sociale de sa famille, Elle est parmi les clientes qui épargne le plus et  elle a des remboursements effectives  sans défauts de paiements quelque soit le temps.

Avec ce nouveau prêt , elle va renforcer le stock de son stock de prêt , elle a une capacité de vente de 2000 fagots par mois. Ces clients sont les restaurateurs qui font des grillades, des beignets et les ménagères de son quartier et les environs. 

Tres populaire dans le quartier, tout le monde parle d'elle et ses ambitions sont entrain de se réaliser petit a petit, elle a fini a construire sa maison dans la parcelle familiale et elle épargne avec ses benefices , elle est entrain de penser d'associer au bois la vente du manioc et ouvrir un dépôt de poissons sales.
texts.en:
This client is 51 years old, and is single with 3 children whose ages vary from 22 to 33 years. After getting her degree as a health agent, she could not find a job so she started selling wood about 23 years ago. 
Having been a HOPE borrower since about a year ago, her different loans have made significant contributions to her spiritual, financial and social growth, and that of her family. She is among the clients who saves the most and repays correctly without lateness no matter the time.
With this new loan, she will purchase new stock. She can sell up to 2000 pieces of wood per month. Her clients are the restaurants which grill food or make fried dough, and households in and around her neighborhood.
Very popular in her neighborhood, everyone talks about her and her ambitions are being realized, little by little. She finished building her house on her family's land and is saving with her profits. She is thinking of adding manioc-selling to her existing wood-selling business, and to open a dried fish-selling store.

loans.use: Sale of firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en: Gulshan is a 26-year-old woman who engages in milk sales and cattle breeding. She is married and has three children. Together with her husband, she raises cattle and resells them for a higher price for meat purposes. Her income comes from milk products as well. Her business generates a stable monthly income of 200 AZN. She applied for a 1,500 AZN loan to purchase one milk cow and two calves.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Mialie

texts.en:
Mialie is a married woman with two children who are grown up. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mialie has operated as a food vendor for the past 10 years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establishing a café.

With the 10,000 Kenyan shillings she wants to purchase more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, vive con su familia, su esposa y una hija, el trabaja atendiendo una granja de cerdos, el cual aprendió por medio de sus padres, ya que ellos son comerciantes de cerdos, no tiene un horario fijo porque la granja está instalada en la vivienda.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de cerdos y  concentrado, ya que quiere crecer en su negocio y mantener cerdos  con un buen peso, ya que esto le permite mejorar las ventas. 
La aspiración de Manuel es mejorar en su negocio, administrar bien el préstamo y estar al pendiente de las necesidades su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel lives with his wife and daughter and manages a pig farm, a trade he was taught by his parents who also raise pigs for a living.  On the farm, there is no set schedule of work.
He seeks this credit to buy pigs and feed stock for them, so they can grow large for sale at a good price in the market. 
Manuel aspires to grow his business, manage his funds well and take good care of his family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana integrante del Banco comunal “Caminando Hacia el Futuro” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Se dedica a la preparación de churrascas (masa de pan, pero cocinado en una parrilla), además prepara colaciones para almorzar, las cuales consisten en ensaladas con carne, atún o pollo. 
Trabaja en la producción de comidas, desde hace 3 años. Comenta que la preparación de la masa la realiza en la cocina de su casa y las vende en un carro que habilitó con una parrilla y un mesón. Su horario de trabajo es de 5ºº a 9ºº de la tarde, cuenta con un buen número de clientes, ya que su puesto lo ubica cerca de la calle, por lo que aprovecha esta situación de concurrencia peatonal, facilitándole sus ventas.
Con el crédito comprará los insumos para su producción de alimentos, entre harina y carbón.
Una de sus metas a largo plazo, es instaurar su negocio en un local establecido e instalarse con una amasandería.
Susana vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 18 y 19 años de edad, ambos estudian y le ayudan a su madre en la instalación de su carro y también venden colaciones en sus respectivos lugares de estudio. 
Su sueño a nivel personal es estudiar la carrera de cocina internacional, ya que le gustaría perfeccionarse en su negocio.
Una de las motivaciones de continuar con el negocio, se debe a que le proporciona cierta independencia económica.
Susana está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio, además comenta que aprovechado todas las instancias de capacitaciones, por lo que se siente también muy motivada. Por otro lado, el grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte es muy unido y comprometido.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
Susana is a member of the "Caminando Hacia el Futuro" (Walking Toward the Future) communal bank in the city of Talca.

She makes churrascas (a type of tortilla cooked on a grill). She also makes light meals for lunch; these are salads with beef, tuna or chicken. She has been working in food production for three years. Susana says that she makes the dough in her kitchen at home, and she sells the churrascas from a cart that she fitted with a grill and a counter. Her daily schedule is from 5:00 until 9:00 in the evening, and she has a good number of customers since she places her stand near the street. She can therefore take advantage of the pedestrian traffic, which makes it easier to make sales.

She will use the loan to buy food production supplies, including flour and charcoal. One of Susana's long-term goals is to move her business into a local shop and set up a bakery.

Susana lives with her husband and their two children, who are 18 and 19 years old. Both children attend school and help their mother with her cart. The children also sell lunches at their respective schools.

Susana's dream for herself is to study international cooking since she would like to perfect her work. One of her motivations to continue with the business is that it gives her a certain amount of economic independence.

Susana is very happy and grateful for the support from Fondo Esperanza since it has allowed her to invest in her business. She also says that she attended all the training sessions, and because of them she also feels very motivated. The communal bank that she is part of is also very united and committed.

Talca is in the Maule region, which is located in the center of the country. It is the administrative, economic and cultural center of the region, so it is the most important city in Chile's Central Valley. In Chile there is a curious reference to Talca in the phrase "Talca, Paris and London". Some of the stories about this saying state that it comes from a statement originally made by an Englishman, "Talca parece Londres" (Talca looks like London) because of the abundant cloud cover that is frequently over the city in winter, similar to the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour and charcoal for making foods.

loans.name: Beatriz Maricela

texts.es:
Beatríz es una mujer de 21 años, se describe como una persona alegre, amigable, honesta, trabajador y luchadora en conseguir las cosas que se propone. Beatríz tiene 21 años vive con sus padres en Julio Andrade que se encuentra a 15 minutos de san Gabriel en la Provincia del Carchi.

Beatríz trabaja con sus padres en la crianza de vacas para ordeñar y sacar leche para su venta. Es el segundo crédito que solicita a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser invertido en la comlra de una vaca lechera ya que anhelan incrementar su negocio y vender más leche para mejorar su calidad de vida y poder seguir con sus estudios universitarios ya que por falta de dinero tuvo que dejarlo y dedicarse a trabajar.

El sueño de Beatríz es poder seguir ayudando a su familia y en lo personal seguir estudiando para sacar su profesión.
texts.en:
Beatríz is a 21-year-old woman who describes herself as a cheerful, friendly, honest, hard-working person who is tenacious when it comes to achieving goals that she sets out for herself.   Beatríz lives with her parents in Julio Andrade, which is 15 minutes from San Gabriel, in Carchi province.

Beatríz works with her parents raising dairy cows whose milk they sell.  This is the second loan that she has requested from Fodemi and she will invest it in buying a dairy cow as she hopes to increase her business and sell more milk so that she can improve her quality of life and continue with her university studies.  Owing to a lack of money she had to leave her university studies and start working.

Beatríz's dream is to be able to continue helping her family.  On a personal level, she would like to continue studying so that she can get her degree.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase her business, to sell more and to make good income

loans.name: Policronio

texts.en:
Policronio is a 47-year-old married man with five children between the ages of 7 and 21. His wife works as a cook in an eatery.

Policronio runs a "habal-habal" (motorcycle taxi) business in Trinidad, Bohol. He earns about 6,000 PHP per month with his business. Policronio works hard to sustain his family, especially to pay for his children's education. He said he wants all of them to finish college and be successful.

Policronio has requested this loan to purchase spare motorcycle parts and to pay for his children's school fees. Policronio hopes to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare motorcycle parts and to pay for his children's school fees.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily, a youthful 30-year-old mother, is a wise farmer who is respected by her neighbors and fellow farmers as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kitale, which is in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Emily is happily married and is blessed with a lovely family.

For the past ten years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and she grows maize and vegetables. She also has dairy cows. Emily has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She earns profits selling a variety of food crops, but she is faced with the challenge of delivering the produce in a timely manner to the market. This challenge has not made her give up, and she states, “I have to do something for my family."

Emily joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She requests a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Emily is from a remote village that has poor roads, and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge. She has suffered many losses of perishable products (milk, vegetables, and tomatoes), which require timely delivery to the market. This loan will help Emily to achieve her dream and reach her goals.

Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Emily feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help women. The benefits of this loan are many because Emily will never suffer losses due to delay in delivering produce to the market. She will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. Her income will increase.

Emily is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike and help with farm work. Emily will use the loan to improve her living conditions and assure her children and siblings of a secure future.

Have a positive impact on the lives of Emily and her family: Make a loan!

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Rosa Elva

texts.en:
Rosa Elva lives en Apodaca, Nuevo Leon; she has a general store and paper sales business called “Rosy”. She started her business since 4 years ago because she lost her husband and she did not have employment and also she had to maintain her 3 nietas, which two of they are studying at the university and the last one still study at the college. Even Rosa Elva is an old woman; she is very enthusiastic that her nietas finish their studies. She does not have any employee in her business just is helped by her nietas in turn when they have free time to attend the business, her business help her to cover all her expenses and family necessities. Her business are growing because she works very hard and she could obtain success little by little.

Rosa Elva is requesting for a loan of $ 1100 USD to purchase merchandise and grow her business,, and offers to repay this loan in 6 months.

** \"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Rosa Elva vive en Apodaca Nuevo León, tiene un negocio D. abarrotes y papelería llamado “Rosy”. ElL. inició este negocio hace más D. 4 años ya que es viuda y no tenia empleo ni alguna otra fuente D. ingresos además se hace cargo D. sus tres nietas, D. las cuales dos D. ellas están cursando sus carreras universitarias y L. otra esta todavía en L. preparatoria. A pesar D. ser una sra. mayor, Rosa Elva está muy entusiasmada en que sus nietas terminen sus estudios universitarios. No tiene empleados en el negocio, solo elL. y sus nietas que le apoyan y se turnan para atender el negocio, este negocio le ha dado soporte para salir adelante. Su negocio ha ido creciendo ya que el trabajo arduo D. elL. y sus nietas lo han logrado poco a poco.

Rosa Elva esta solicitando un préstamo por $ 1100 USD que ofrece pagar en 6 meses, y lo utilizará para invertir en mercancía para L. mercería y así poder incrementar mas sus ventas y crecer en el negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ulfah

texts.en:
Ulfah is member of MBK who has requested a third loan for US$ 100. Ulfah is selling salad and snacks in small food stall near her village's school. She used to borrow the money from the local bank that has very high interest and very short payment terms (1 month), but she is very thankful now because in addition to strengthening her business, she could also now save some money and put her child into school. The loan that she requested from MBK will be used for her general food stalls inventory and some portion will be used to grow and farm chicken, goats and fish. In one day she could receive an income of US$ 8 while making profit of US$ 1.10.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by C. Patriawan, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Food and Snacks

loans.name: Emma Esperanza

texts.en:
Emma is 31 years old and has two children. She and her husband used to have a welding shop. Now they have decided to open a small cafe run out of their house to sell basic food (seafood, meats, etc). They hope they can use this loan to invest and grow their new business and prosper as a family. Emma belongs to Grupo Azalia 2.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

. EMMA TIENE 31 AÑOS DE EDAD, TIENE DOS HIJOS, JUNTAMENTE CON SU ESPOSO TENIAN UN TALLER DE SOLDADURA Y AHORA HAN DECIDIDO ABRIR UN LOCAL EN SU CASA DE VENTA DE COMIDA FAMILIAR(MARISCOS, CARNES, CECINAS, ETC ) ESPERAN CON EL PRESTAMO INVERTIR EN EL NEGOCIO PARA CRECER Y PROSPERAR COMO FAMILIA.EMMA PERTENECE AL GRUPO AZALIA 2

loans.use: COMERCIANTE

loans.name: Nora Irma

texts.es:
Nora is a single mother of three children; they are 12, 14, and 15 years old. Previously, she received economic support from her children's father. However, for three years now he has neglected his children completely. For this reason Nora started her own business producing and selling flour tortillas. This is how she has been able to obtain the resources to support her children and pay for their studies. It has not been easy for Nora, but her well-being is the greatest reward.

At this moment Nora asks for a loan of 750 dollars to purchase supplies to produce her products, as well as purchase tables, coolers, and grills. With these she expects to increase her production and business. She pledges to pay off the loan in 6 months. You can help improve this family's way of life. They sincerely appreciate your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Nora es soltera y tiene tres hijos de 12, 14 y 15 años de edad, anteriormente recibía apoyo económico del padre de sus hijos, pero desde hace tres años se ha desobligado por completo, por lo que Nora inició su propio negocio con la elaboración y venta de tortillas de harina, de esta manera es como obtiene los recursos para mantener a sus hijos y pagar sus estudios. No ha sido fácil para Nora sacar adelante a su familia ella sola pero su bienestar es la mejor recompensa.

En estos momentos Nora necesita de un préstamo de $ 750 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus productos, así como para compra de mesas, enfriadores y parrillas con lo que espera incrementar su producción y continuar creciendo, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda mejorarás la vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and work equipment

loans.name: Saide

texts.en:
Saide is 35-year-old widow living with her mother in Laylaki (Beirut suburbs). She learned embroidery while she was still at school but starting doing business only 5 years ago. Her work is sold to a workshop in the Barbir region. In order to expand her business, Saide needs $300 to buy 5 tablecloths and all the required material for the embroidery of the latter.

Saide is part of a group with other women. The members of the group are self-chosen women, living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rural areas. Group lending is based on incremental increase of the loan amount and group solidarity to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that is encourages the collaboration approach in the borrowing community. The group loan is a very powerful tool towards economic empowerment for women.

loans.use: To buy necessary material for the embroidery work

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson Centurión, 39 years old, and his wife Maria Liliana Franco, 27 years old, live and work together in Quiindy, Paraguay. Nelson and his Wife have two children; a boy of 3 and a baby girl, only 2 months old. Maria Liliana is a pharmacist, however she currently works with Nelson in his store and cares for their children. 

Two years ago, Nelson decided to open a hardware store. Before opening the store he worked in a cotton plant. He began the hardware store with his brother. Later the agreement between he and his brother was dissolved and he went on to run the hardware store alone. He has had much success doing so. 

Thanks to his good management techniques and hard work the store has been growing day by day. The credit he has solicited will go toward purchasing large quantities of high-demand items for the store. These include electronics and plumbing supplies.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of  electronics, and plumbing supplies.

loans.name: Blanca Aurora

texts.es:
Mrs. Blanca belongs to the communal bank “María Montesori.” She lives at 1031 Jr. Raymondi in the Calleria district of the department of Ucayali. She is 44 years old and is the mother of one son. She is separated from her husband, and that income does not cover the expenses of the family. That’s why Blanca Aurora, with her first loan from Manuela Ramos of $100 (S/.300), decided to invest in selling food out of her home.

Currently, she sells her food at a business located alongside the store that her sister, Mariluz, runs. She arrives very early to serve her customers breakfasts and lunches that are warmly received and well-liked by all. Additionally, in the afternoons she devotes herself to selling clothing door-to-door. She counts on a large number of customers that know her good taste in clothing and eagerly await the novelties that she can offer them.

With this loan from Manuela Ramos, which she will repay in four months, she will purchase 3 kilos of rice, 1 kilo of sugar, 3 packets of salt, beef, and five chickens. Additionally, she will expand her current location.

Blanca is very pleased to belong to Manuela Ramos; she has told us that it changed her life, and she is happy because she sees the results of her investment. She hopes and prays that everything will go well and that she and her son will stay healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Blanca pertenece al Banco Comunal “María Montesori”, vive en Jr. Raymondi 1034, del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 44 años de edad y es madre de 1 hijo, está separada y el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para los gastos de su familia, es así que Blanca Aurora, con el primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 (US$ 100.00) decide invertir en venta de comida a domicilio.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de comida, negocio ubicado al costado de la tienda que tiene su hermana Mariluz, en donde llega muy temprano para atender a sus clientes con desayunos y almuerzos que son de gran acogida y gustan a todos. Paralelamente, por las tardes se dedica a la venta de ropa a domicilio, cuenta con un gran número de clientes que saben de su buen gusto en lo referente a ropas y están a la expectativa de las novedades que les pueda ofrecer.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 3 kilos de arroz, 1 kilo de azúcar, 3 paquetes de sal, carnes de res y 5 pollos (aves para consumo), además ampliará el local donde actualmente esta atendiendo.

Blanca está muy contenta por pertenecer a Manuela Ramos, nos ha dicho que le cambio la vida y esta feliz porque ve los resultados de su inversión y espera y ruega al señor que todo le vaya bien y que no le falte salud para ella y su hijo.

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs. Expansion of her retail location

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en: Mary is 45 years old. Her current business is selling used clothes.She wants to begin a retail shop from the profits out of her business.

loans.use: Expand her used clothing business

loans.name: Sardar

texts.en: Sardar G. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 30 years old, married and has two children. He has a building materials shop and has lots of experience in this business. He has been involved in this business for a few years and has lots of customers. He needs to expand his business, so he has requested an individual loan to expand his business and make a better income. He needs a loan in the amount of $850.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Domptila

texts.fr:
Thirty-four years old and married, Domptila has been a member of her group for the last four and a half years. She specializes in selling lemon juice, forest products (palm oil) and processed fish products (dried fish), etc. She has gained solid experience in these areas. This loan will allow her to strengthen her production. She plans to reimburse it with a one-time repayment in six months.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 34 ans, mariée, Domptila est membre de son groupement depuis quatre ans et demi. Elle s'est spécialisée dans le commerce de jus de citron, de produits forestiers (huile de palme) et de produits halieutiques transformés (poissons séchés), etc.. Elle a acquis une bonne expérience dans ce domaine. Ce prêt va lui permettre de renforcer ses marchandises. Elle s'engage à le rembourser au bout de 6 mois en une seule fois.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Hafizallah

texts.en: Hafizallah lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and is the father of two children who are both in school. He is the only breadwinner for his family. He works in agriculture. He has lots of land to cultivate but he is unable to take the best advantage of it, so he wants to take an individual loan to complete his stock of agricultural necessities and be in a position to make good income. In this way, he believes that he can better help his family. He is happy with all members of his family.

loans.use: To complete his stock of agricultural necessities

loans.name: Jose De La Cruz

texts.es:
Señor José is married. He has one daughter and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. His wife works as a merchant and supports him with paying for the home's expenses. Señor José has a grocery store and has 25 years of experience. He started his business with his own funds. It was hard for him to acquire customers when he opened the store, but now he has many and sells a lot.

With this loan, he hopes to improve the bathrooms in his home because they are in bad shape. In the future, he hopes to expand his grocery store and support his daughter by giving her a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El Sr., José es casado, le tienen una hija y habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, su esposa trabaja como comerciante y apoya en los gastos del hogar. El Sr. José tiene una pulpería y con veinte cinco años de experiencia. Su negocio lo comenzó con fondos propios, y le costo conseguir clientes en su apertura pero ahora ya tiene muchos cliente y vende bastante.

Con el préstamo desea mejorar los baños de su casa que están en mal estado. A futuro desea agrandar más la pulpería y apoyar a su hija y darle una preparación educativa.

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Fausat

texts.en: When Fausat A. was visited our loan office, we discovered that she sells food on a small scale at the front of her house. She is 36 years of age, she has two children, and she has been in this business since 2003. She hails from Shibiri, Lagos State, Nigeria. Fausat has been in a LAPO Microfinance lending group for the past 3 years. She is now requesting a loan of $275 to buy more food for her business and to maximizer her profits. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell

loans.name: Lelis Inocenta

texts.es:
Lelis is a very hard-working woman who over the years has forged her future with her own hands, as she is an expert seamstress. In all this time she has maintained her home with this work. She has three children, all of whom are adults now and all demonstrate the good upbringing that their mother gave them. For Lelis the work continues, she does not want to give up knitting and now depends on it for income. She is such a creative and detail-oriented woman that her garments are works of art. At the same time, while times change and the world advances, Lelis wants to work on new and different garments in order to get the attention of her customers. Lelis wants to buy new knitting supplies and different types of wool. This woman truly has woven her own future with her own hands.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Lelis es una mujer muy trabajadora que durante años ha forjado su futuro con sus propias manos, ya que ella es una experta tejedora. En todo este tiempo ha mantenido su hogar con este trabajo, ella tiene tres hijos, los cuales ahora ya son mayores y todos demuestran la buena crianza que les dio su madre. Para Lelis el trabajo continúa, ella no quiere dejar de tejer y ahora depende su sustento de eso. Es una mujer tan creativa y detallista que sus prendas son una obra de arte. Pero así como los tiempos cambian y el mundo avanza, Lelis quiere también realizar nuevas y novedosas prendas, para llamar la atención de sus clientes. Lelis desea comprar nuevos implementos de tejido y diferentes tipos de lana. Esta mujer verdaderamente a teje con sus propias manos su futuro. Apóyala.

loans.use: Purchase new supplies and wool in order to continue knitting her beautiful garments

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a business woman in Tema.  She is married and blessed with two kids who are currently in school. She sells Dumas clothes and ice cream. Mary is very supportive to her family through her trading business. She has been selling for the past eight years, but progress has been persistently low due to insufficient funds. She hopes the loan will enable her to revive the business and make it more viable. She wants to purchase a bulk of Dumas clothes and also increase the production of ice cream. She belongs to the group called the Platinum Trust Group. The group provides assistance and support for one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase bulk of Dumas clothes and raw materials for ice cream.

loans.name: Zuwena's Tupendane Group

texts.en:
Zuwena, 43 and married with six children ranging in age from 24 to 8, has been a food and juice seller since 2005. Working daily from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m., she can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Zuwena is requesting a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Asha.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Ifeanyi

texts.en:
Ifeanyi, 57 years old and married with 6 children, lives in Benin City, Nigeria where she is a yam wholesaler. Travelling to the north of Nigeria to buy yams (this can be a 4 or 5 day journey), she loads them onto a shared lorry and meets them back in Benin City where she distributes them to other retailers. She has been doing well in her business, but now needs capital to finance her trips north.

The purchase of yams and transportation is costly, and during one of her recent trips north, she had an accident. Her goods were damaged and she was hospitalized for several months. During her recovery she ran low on money, which affected her ability to make her yam-buying trips profitable, thereby making it difficult to sustain her business. She is therefore in need of capital and hopes that Kiva lenders can help her. She is requesting a loan of $675 to enable her to restart her yam business and better contribute to her family's expenses. "I will be very grateful to you, Kiva, if you can help me come out of my predicament," Ifeanyi says.

loans.use: To buy more yams to sell

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma inició el negocio por iniciativa propia, para salir adelante con la economía de su hogar. Decidió emprender una actividad que le generara ingresos cuando se separo de su pareja y no tenía sustento ya que sus hijos no le ayudan y ella se quedo con la tutela de una nieta de 2 años, la cual ahora depende económicamente de ella. Comenzó su negocio hace 2 años, una hermana le dio ropa para que la vendiera fuera de su casa, y poco a poco con las ganancias fue comprando pacas de ropa.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $525 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar ropa de temporada y poder continuar con su negocio. Con tu apoyo podrá lograrlo!!.
texts.en:
Irma started the business on her own, to cover her living expenses. She decided to do an activity that would generate income when she got separated from her partner and didn’t have a way to support herself, her children don’t help her and she had to take care of her two year old grandaughter, who now depends on her financially. She started her business two years ago, one of her sisters gave her clothes to sell outside her house and with the profit she slowly started to buy more merchandise. She needs a loan of US $525 to repay in six months, to purchase season clothing and continue with her business. With your support she can get it!

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en: Zaur was born in 1975 and lives in Baku city. This single man plays a synthesizer, a business he started five years ago. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy the necessary instruments to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy instruments to improve his business

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en:
Aquilina is a member of the Prosperidad (“Prosperity”) Village Bank. Aquilina is 25 years old and lives with her partner and their son in the Chiara district. She has a store in her home, where she sells dry goods, vegetables, fruits, clothing and sneakers. She works at her store seven days a week, and also farms potatoes, which she sells in the Chiara market.  

At this time, Aquilina is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy sugar, milk and rice. Aquilina dreams of buying a car to transport her wares and improving her business.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and milk

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.en:
Z. Abdusattor is married and the father of four children. He works as a farmer. Educated until secondary school, he had to leave early because he couldn't afford to attend. Bestowed with a good work ethic, he has wholeheartedly committed himself to agriculture. 

He is growing vegetables: potato, onion, carrot and others. He is now seeking a loan of 4000 Somoni ($1175 USD) to buy fertilizer for his crop to be prepared for the upcoming season and to produce a good harvest at the end of the season. He can then better meet the needs of his family and improve his work conditions.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Lisset Guadalupe

texts.es: Lisset Guadalupe M.  vive en el municipio de Cojutepeque en la zona oriental de El Salvador . Lisset vive con su esposo y dos hijos aún pequeños. A sus 28 años Lisset se anima  aprender lo básico en cosmetología, para así  instalar una pequeña sala de belleza en su propia casa,  ya que se les era imposible subsistir solo con el sueldo de su esposo. Para incrementar sus ingresos  Lissett ha surtido su sala de belleza con productos básicos para el cuidado del caballo; pues sus clientes aprovechan en comprarlos cuando están recibiendo sus servicios de sala de belleza. Actualmente Lisset pide solicita un crédito para ampliar la   variedad de sus productos y así incrementar sus ventas .
texts.en:
Lisset Guadalupe M. lives in the municipality of Cojutepeque, in the zone of El Salvador. Lesset lives with her husband and two young children. At the young age of 28, she is learning the basics about cosmetology. This way she will be able to open her own business from her home, since living off her husband's salary is not possible. In order to increase her profit, she has added beauty products such as shampoos, conditioners. This way her clients are able to purchase these products while getting a haircut, etc. She currently requests this loan in order to puchase more products, this way increase her sales.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hair products for her beauty salon

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Ni Komang Sriani

texts.id:
Melalui  organisasi Tempek ( sebuah organisasi adat ) yang ada didesanya, Ni  Komang Sriani mendapatkan dana dari Yayasan DINARI untuk periode ke dua. Pinjaman pertama dirasakan sangat membantu usahanya, karena ingin mengembangkan usahanya, Ni Komang Sriani mengajukan permohonan untuk mendapatkan pinjaman yang kedua.  Dana tersebut sangat berarti dalam menambah modal usaha dalam usaha jual beli hasil pertanian. Dalam sehari Ni Komang Sriani dapat membeli coklat, pisang, kelapa dan hasil kebun lainnya. Esok paginya, Ni Komang Sriani akan menjualnya barang dagangannya dipasar ataupun beberapa pelanggan yang biasa membeli darinya. Keuntungan bersih dalam setiap hari dapat mencapai Rp. 25.000.- s/d 30.000.- 
Dari Usaha seperti inilah Komang Sriani dapat menggantungkan hidupnya bersama suaminya, Darma Kantun, yang tidak bekerja dan hanya mengandalkan hasil kebunnya sendiri.
texts.en:
Ni Komang Sriani is applying for second loan from DINARI foundation and Kiva through "Tempek," a traditional agricultural organization in her village. She felt DINARi/Kiva's first loan was very helpful in growing her business. this motivated her to apply for this second loan. The funding will be used to increase her business' working capital. She trades agricultural products like chocolate, banana, coconut and other products. She sells the products she purchased from farmers the next day in the local market. She usually can earn $2-2.50 per day. This business helps her supplement income from her husband, Darma Kantun, who is unemployed. Produce from his garden is his only source of income.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase more trading goods

loans.name: Chuluunbayar

texts.en:
Chuluunbaatar C. lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  His two children go to a local kindergarten.

Chuluunbaatar has a degree in software engineering from the Mongolian University of Information and Technology.  With the valuable knowledge he gained from his degree, he started a small retail business selling computers and computer-related accessories.  Since its inception in 2002, his business has been doing pretty well.  He now has a stable base of return customers.  He requests a loan to import cheap computers from neighboring China.  Chuluunbaatar dreams of one day having a large, full-service computer center. 

His wife also runs a retail business, in construction and development, with about 1,000,000 MNT of capital ($1=MNT 1,600).

Chuluunbaatar and his wife would like to expand their businesses, as far as their capital allows.  Their hope is to make sure they will be able to afford their children's college tuition.

loans.use: Import computers.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Kusirikuy que significa Alégrate en quechua.
Julia es casada, tiene 48 años y 5 hijos, Julia se dedica a la venta de golosinas, bebidas, frutas, actividad que realiza de manera ambulatoria en la puerta de un colegio para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de galletas, gaseosas y frutas.
Los sueños de Julia son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the community bank Kusirikuy meaning "Rejoice" in Quechua.

Julia is married. She is 48 years old and has five children. Julia sells sweets, drinks, and fruits. This activity is mobile and is located at the door of a school for which she counts on her children for help. Julia needs $350 (1050 PEN) which will be invested in the purchase of crackers, soda, and fruit.

Julia's dreams are to provide a good education for her children and to improve her business.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy crackers, soda, and fruit

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia makes a living selling juice in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to the Jambo nia loan group, and currently earns an average monthly profit of $40. She works for 12 hours a day.

Safia is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania, which she will use to buy sugar and mangos, make more juice and increase her income. She hopes that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to expand her business.  

Safia is 35  years old, married, and has three children.

loans.use: To buy sugar and mangoes to use to make juice.

loans.name: Lwiza

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania!  This is  Lwiza M. from Mbeya. She is 43 years old, and married  with 5 children between the ages of 15 and 25.

Lwiza, an orphan, has been running a genge business since 1995. A genge (grocery store) is typically a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chili, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

Lwiza works at the business for 9 to 12 hours per day, 6 days a week.  Lwiza currently earns about $80 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $300 in order to purchase items in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open a new business. 

Lwiza thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania, through micro-leasing. The organization supports the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase items in bulk for her business

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Phon P., 29, is married and has a young child living at home in the Saang district, Kandal Province. Working in a grocery store, she typically makes US$8 each day, while her husband, Vong Suth, who buys and sells rice, typically makes about US$12 each day. Phon P. would like a loan of US$1000 to purchase grocery items and rice.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items and rice.

loans.name: Barnabé

texts.fr:
H. Barnabé est né le 08 Octobre 1981 à Adjohoun dans le Département de l’Ouémé. Barnabé vit avec sa famille à Katagon dans la Commune d'Akpro-Missérété toujours dans le Département de l’Ouémé. Barnabé est père de trois (03) enfants dont un (01) seulement est scolarisé. 

Barnabé est couturier de formation et de profession. Pour renforcer sa capacité de service afin mieux satisfaire ses clients, Barnabé a besoin d’équiper son atelier de couture. Barnabé sollicite alors un crédit de ALIDé pour y arriver. Ainsi Barnabé peut faire plus de revenus pouvant lui permettre de mieux supporter ses charges familiales.
texts.en:
H. Barnabé was born on October 8, 1981 in Adjohoun in Ouémé County. He lives with this family in Katagon in the community of Akpro-Missérété, also in Ouémé County. He is the father of three children, just one of whom is in school. Barnabé is a tailor by training and by profession. To bolster his service capacity in order to satisfy his customers, he needs to equip his shop. He's therefore requesting a loan from ALIDÉ to do so. He can then have more income, enabling him to support his family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and an overcasting machine

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
El microempresario Benito Cárdenas R. tiene 73 años de edad es viudo es padre de 4 hijos los cuales son adultos y desde hace mas de 20 años tiene un taller de ebanistería con el cual ha podido sacar a sus hijos adelante y poder verlos graduar.

El señor Cárdenas tiene muchos clientes a quienes les fabrica puertas, muebles tales como sillas abuelitas, comedores, camas entre otros productos. El trabaja con uno de sus hijos en el taller quien le ayuda a la fabricación de sus productos.

Uno de los problemas que enfrentan es que la materia prima (madera) al igual que otros insumos (pintura, barniz) sube constantemente de precio por lo que tienen  que comprarlos en cantidades para evitar estos incrementos, por tal razón esta solicitando se le financie para comprar lo siguiente: 

300 pies de Madera Cedro Macho a US 0.90 cada pie, 250 pies de  Acetuno a US 0.56 cada pie y  300 pies de Caoba a US 1.30 cada pie.
texts.en:
The small businessman Benito Cárdenas R. is 73 years old and is a widower. He is the father of 4 adult children. For the past 20 years he has had a cabinetmaking shop which has allowed him to earn the income needed to take care of his children and send them to school. His children were able to graduate.

Mr. Cárdenas has many customers who he makes doors for, and furniture pieces like chairs, dinning room sets and beds among many products. He works with one of his children in the workshop.

One of the problems that Benito is confronting is the constant rising cost of the materials that he needs to make his furniture. Because of this he needs to buy the materials in large quantities so that he can avoid the rising costs. He is requesting this loan so that he will be able to buy the following materials; 300 feet of Cedar wood at .90 US a foot, 250 feet of olive wood at .56 US a foot and 300 feet of mahogany at 1.30 US a foot.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of wood like cedar, olivewood and mahogony.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry owns a computer business center. He is 36 years old and single. He is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more secondhand laptops and other computer accessories to sell. He says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase secondhand laptops and other computer accessories

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha M. is from the village of Bunawan. She is 59 years old. Editha is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Editha owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Editha has been engaged in her business for some years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Editha joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby pigs to raise & sell in the future and for snack vending at their place. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Editha from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby pigs to raise & sell

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda is thirty – five years old. She is divorced and has given birth to three children, one son and two daughters who are still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Linda is a trader. She is into palm oil production business. Linda supplies to retailers in her community. She procures the palm fruits from nearby communities. She has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith O. is a 37-year-old farmer who owns a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm. She has six children, the eldest, to whom she gave too much attention, is 17 years old. When she got married in 1991, she started to learn farming. This is her family’s only source of income which provides them food, clothes and other basic needs.

Judith needs a loan for additional capital. She would like to take this chance of investing more in her farm to be able to have a good harvest. Receiving the loan will help her also to pay the laborers who helped shape and prepare the field ready for planting.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital and to pay laborers

loans.name: Esperanza Del Barrio Azul Group

texts.en:
Marie L. M. (second from right in picture) is a borrower from the town of San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for the group Esperanza del Barrio Azul (Hope of the Blue Neighborhood), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in her group.

Marie is 35 years old and lives with her husband Isidro, her 19-year-old daughter, and also cares for a 14-year-old girl. Marie makes and sells sweets to her neighbors and friends, specializing with the local supply of coconut and peanuts. Since sweets are a luxury, Marie would like to use this loan to purchase rice and maybe some clothing that she can sell for a profit. These items will help her keep a steady income when the sales of her sweets aren’t as high.

This is Marie’s 3rd loan with Esperanza, and she has a perfect repayment record. She hopes that her two girls will have better lives due to her increase in profits. Marie is very thankful for her loan and her relationship with Esperanza, saying “when I have difficulties with my business, I know I can come [to Esperanza] for support”. Thank you for your loan to Marie and to the Esperanza del Barrio Azul group!

loans.use: Supplies for candy, rice, and clothing

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía es una mujer muy laboriosa y a sus 56 años no para D. trabajar todo el día. Vive con su esposo Amílcar, quien tiene 60 años y con su hijo Giancarlo D. 17 años. Su casa es pequeña, pero muy acogedora y está ubicada en un populoso distrito al norte D. la ciudad D. Lima.

Ella se despierta cada día al amanecer y abre la tienda D. abarrotes que tiene en su casa, así lo hace desD. hace un año atrás, tiempo en el que se animó a poner este negocio, ya que en la zona por donD. vive no hay mucha competencia. 
Durante las tardes le deja el cuidado D. la tienda a su hijo y se va a trabajar a un mercado cercano donD. tiene un puesto D. especerías (condimentos) que ella misma prepara en su hogar. Sofía no se cansa D. trabajar porque quiere salir adelante, y al caer la noche regresa a su casa para seguir atendiendo su tienda. Así transcurren sus días y lo hace con gusto, porque quiere darle una mejor calidad D. vida a su familia y porque tiene ganas D. salir adelante. 
En el futuro Sofía piensa en granD. y quiere ampliar su negocio con varias exhibidores D. productos y mayor cantidad D. mercancía.

Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y como siempre promete ser cumplida, porque ella sabe que solo así se sale adelante en la vida. Con el dinero que solicita comprará una máquina exhibidora moderna para lograr captar la atención D. los clientes y también surtirá mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Sofia is a very hard-working, 56-year-old woman who doesn't stop working all day. She lives with her 60-year-old husband, Amilcar, and her 17 year-old son, Giancarlo. Her house is small but very welcoming and it is located in a crowded district north of Lima. She rises at daybreak each day to open her grocery store that she has operated from her home for the past year, which was the time when she became motivated to establish this business since there isn't much competition in the area where she lives. During the afternoons she leaves her son in charge of the store and she goes to work at the local market where she tends a stand where she sells home-maD. spices and condiments that she prepares herself at home. Sofia is a tireless worker because she wants to get ahead and at nightfall she returns home to continue tending her store. Thus the days follow each other but Sofia faces them happily because she wants to proviD. a better quality of life for her family and because she wants to get ahead in life. In the future, Sofia is thinking big and would like to enlarge her store with several display stands and a greater quantity of merchandise. This is her sixth loan with MFP and, as usual, she commits to be punctual with her repayments since she realizes that this is how one gets ahead in life. With the funds she is requesting she intends to buy a modern display case to better capture the attention of prospective customers and she will also better stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase display stands and increase stock.

loans.name: Justus' Group

texts.en: R. Justus is 75 years old and is married with seven children. He is the leader of his group Rukungiri. Five of his children have university degrees and the other two are soldiers in the Ugandan army. R.’s business specializes in grazing and crop husbandry and generates 250,000 USH in profits per week. He has worked very hard to achieve his success, starting out as a simple shopkeeper and responsibly saving any money he made. R. would like to use the requested loan amount to buy bulls and fertilizers. His dream is to one day be able to purchase a modern farm. Additionally, he hopes to maintain a stable family life.

loans.use: To purchase bulls and fertilizers

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles M. is an entrepreneur, a Tanzanian, and a married businessman. He runs a foodstuffs shop at Vingunguti ward in Dar es Salaam. He purchases his business goods from the wholesale and retail shops and sells retail to his customers.

The business income enabled Charles to purchase a plot of land for house construction and also to meet his daily family needs and business capitalization requirements.

Charles has been running the business for four years and he needs a loan of Tsh 800,000 to capitalize his business.

loans.use: To capitalize his business

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson sells second-hand fridges and air-conditioners at retail prices to his customers. He is 49 years old and married with three children. His wife is a fashion designer and she also supports the home. 

He is a focused, hard worker. He has been in this business for a long time. He is requesting a loan amount of 60,000 NGN to purchase more second-hand fridges and air-conditioners to sell .

He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand fridges and air-conditioners to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia G. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old. Virginia is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of bananas and at the same time she also owned a sari sari store in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Virginia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en: Marisa M. is from the village of Clarin, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Marisa is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Marisa raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Marisa has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Marisa joined GDMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marisa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase feed for the pigs. This will be the second loan taken out by Marisa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed for the pigs

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 34 years old. She is married and has six children who are in school. She works hard to help her husband provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a mining community. Hannah has a bread baking business. She bakes bread in a conventional oven in her community and supplies to retailers and beverage sellers. She also trades in provisions and foodstuffs.  Hannah has been in business for three years and desires to expand her business. She requests a loan to procure bags of flour, sugar and other ingredients in bulk to be able to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Heghine

texts.en:
Heghine G. is 28 years old and she has school education. She lives in Vanadzor with her mother, son and husband. Her mother is jobless and her son is a schoolboy.

Heghine and her husband, Tigran, manage their own butcher’s shop, which they run in their own shop. Heghine has a verbal agreement with villagers about buying meat. Now she needs an 800,000 AMD loan to buy meat from villagers to increase the volume of her business.

loans.use: To buy more meat for her butcher's shop

loans.name: Jamilet Del Rosario

texts.es: Jamilet tiene 37 años de edad, es una Señora empresaria que le gusta mucho su trabajo. Pues disfruta diariamente de su actividad como es la venta de ropa, por lo que tiene todo el espíritu de salir adelante. Ella inicio este negocio hace 25 años estableciendo pocos productos como es sandalias, ropa interior y ropa en general, la mayoría de sus vecinos estaban muy contentos, pues Jamilet siempre se ha destacado por saber relacionarse y aconsejar a sus clientes. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima y ofrecer una variedad de productos. Sueña con mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Jamilet is 37 years old and is an entrepreneurial woman who likes her work very much. She enjoys her work daily, which is selling clothes, because with all her spirit she wants to move forward. Jamilet started this business 25 years ago, establishing a few products such as sandals, underwear and clothes in general. The majority of her neighbours are very content because Jamilet has always made the effort to relate to others and to advise her customers. She is seeking a loan for the purchase of primary material to offer a variety of products. She dreams of improving her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. est une femme de 55 ans, elle est veuve et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DAROU-KHOUDOSS depuis 2006 (3ans et demi) et a eu de bonnes expériences avec le crédit pour en avoir bénéficié à O7 fois de suite. Fatou D. est restauratrice, ce prêt lui permettra de mieux développer son activité en s'approvisionnant en denrées telles que du riz, de l'huile végétale, du mil, des légumes, et constituer un fonds de roulement. Les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son activité lui permettent de nourrir ses enfants, de prendre en charge leur santé, leur scolarité et leurs autres besoins.
texts.en:
Fatou Diange is a 55 year-old widow and a mother of four. She has been a member of the Darou-Khoudoss credit association since 2006 (three and a half years) and has had a positive experience with loans, having received seven consecutive ones. Fatou D. is a restaurant owner, and this loan would enable her to develop her business and stock up on goods such as rice, vegetable oil, millet, vegetables, and also to create some working capital for the business. The profits generated by the business would enable her to feed her children and look after their health, schooling and other needs.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promoting her business

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana María T. es otra de las socias del banco comunal Los Talvos, vive en la comunidad  San Miguel en la parroquia El  Valle, esta parroquia se caracteriza por ser una de las productoras  de maíz y por su belleza natural, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería y en su mayor parte los jóvenes han migrado a otras ciudades o al extranjero para brindarles un mejor porvenir a sus familias.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la cría de animales como pollos, chanchos, vacas,  vendiendo sus animales solo cuando tiene alugna necesidad de dinero, también  cultiva sus tierras sembrando principalmente maíz, estas actividades las coordina con la atención en su pequeña tienda de víveres en la que lleva cuarenta años pero no ha crecido porque no sabe administrarla.

Ana María tiene 60 años de edad enviudó hace 12 años porque su difunto esposo tenía un tumor en el cerebro, en su unión conyugal procrearon  diez  hijos de los cuales ocho  ya son casados y viven independientes solo tiene dos hijos solteros que se encuentran de 20 y 17 años que trabajan en construcción ayudando un poco económicamente a su madre, por la noche esutidan en un colegio de la localidad, nos comenta  con mucha nostalgia que su hijo de 20 años tiene una enfermedad que  no saben que es  y como es sola le ayuda comprando los medicamentos cada mes para calmar un poco su enfermedad.

Se encuentra once años trabajando con su banco comunal, con el dinero recibido de los créditos ha solventado los gastos de las recetas de su hijo y otros gastos propios del hogar, con el dinero del nuevo crédito va a  comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, sal,  jabón, etc., para abastecer su tienda de víveres y tiene como meta dedicarse un poco más a éste negocio para hacerlo crecer.
texts.en:
Ana Maria Tacun is another member of the Los Talvos community bank. She lives in the San Miguel community in the parish of El Valle. The parish is known for maize production and for the beauty of the surrounding countryside. The majority of its people make a living farming and raising livestock. Many young people have migrated to cities and other countries in the hope that they can help their families secure a better future. Our member makes a living raising animals--chickens, pigs, cattle--that she only sells when she needs money. She also farms her land, growing maize mostly, work that she has done diligently for forty years. The business hasn't grown, though, because she hasn't known how to do it. Ana Maria, 60, has been a widow since her husband died of a brain tumor 12 years ago. She and her husband had ten children, eight of whom are married and independent. The other two, who are 20 and 17 years old, work at construction jobs, helping their mother when they can. They also study at a night school. Ana Maria is worried about her 20 year old son who is ill with no-one knows what and they have to spend money every month to buy the medications they hope can help him. Ana Maria has been a member of her community bank for eleven years. She has used loans to pay for her son's prescriptions and other household expenses. She will use the new loan to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, salt, soap, etc. to stock her store. Her goal is to spend more time on the business so that she can expand it.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Mrs. Kim S. is 48 years old and she is a villager who lives in Svay Pear village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Phar Yarng, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare (3.75-acre) field on which they cultivate rice to earn a living.

Aside from farming, Mr. Phar Yarng is a motorbike taxi driver from which he earns a small income to support his family living. He is on the left in the photo.

For their farming, Mrs. Kim S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer and to pay for a plowing machine.

This couple has five children: one is a farmer who supports the parents’ farming; another is a laborer; while the other three are attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and to pay for a plowing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Oem

texts.en: Mrs. Oem N., 29, lives in Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. She has built a medium pigpen behind her house where she feeds a few pigs from which she earns a living. By doing this, she is able to generate a simple daily income, which helps to ensure her family has a stable sells it for a profit. Mrs. Oem N. is asking for a loan in order to purchase a new machine to allow her husband to pick up firewood from the forest.

loans.use: To purchase a new farm machine.

loans.name: Rem

texts.en:
Rem Y., 35, is married and lives with her five children in the Kampong Chhnang province. She sells dry fish and firewood, making approximately US $3 each day, and her husband stays at home helping her selling dry fish and wood. Her family is also supported by her child’s US $2 income each day.
