Rem Y. is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a motor-taxi. She believes that this purchase will allow her to increase her income and be able to better support her large family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Davlat

texts.en:
G. Davlat is 29 years old. He is married and is in the business of baking “lepeshka”- national bread. Davlat is the main bread-winner in the family. He believes that this business is profitable and is not subject to seasonality. Davlat gets up early and bakes lepeshka and other types of bread so that people have fresh bread on their tables for breakfast. All the input materials such as flour, salt, yeast he purchases at the local market. 

Now due to high demand Davlat wants to increase the number of his breads so that he is requesting a loan of 3600 Somoni. The loan will be spent to purchase flour and coal for baking the “lepeshka”. Davlat deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing flour for baking the national bread “lepeshka”

loans.name: Omar Alipio

texts.es:
Omar de 53 años,  vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil, (lugar urbano, en sus principios fue llamado Orquídeas por la abundancia de esa flor), tiene dos hijos. El trabaja haciendo ladrillos de distintos tipos hace algunos años atrás. 

El hace ladrillos de con lodo (tierra), acerrim y moldes para el tamaño del ladrillo, trabaja con dos ayudantes desde las 06h00am hasta las 15h00pm todos los días. Para iniciar este negocio fue muy duro pero poco a poco con esfuerzo ha podido continuar con éxito. Pero para incrementar mas su producción el quiere comprar con el préstamo aserrín y moldes de madera para los ladrillos.  

En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio y trabajar haciendo bloques.
texts.en:
Omar is 53 years old and lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil (an urban area originally named Orquídeas for the abundance of this flower, orchids). He has two children. He has been working for some years making different types of bricks. He makes mud and sawdust bricks and molds for brick sizes. He works from 6:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m. every day with two helpers. It was very hard to start up this business but little by little, and with his effort, he has been able to continue successfully. He wants to buy sawdust and wooden molds for the bricks with the loan to increase his production more. He wants to expand his business in the future and make cinder blocks.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sawdust, molds

loans.name: Puaina

texts.en:
Puaina  V. is 20 and single with 1 child. She owns a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community. Puaina  has 1 year of experience in this business. Puaina needs a loan of WST$1000 to buy raw ingredients for preparing cooked foods. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Puaina  joined SPBD. This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Puaina 's only access to capital, because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD:
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD, and since then it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients for preparing cooked foods.

loans.name: In Jesus Name. Group

texts.en:
Roseline N., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'In Jesus Name'. Roseline is 39 years old, married, and has five children who range from 2 to 19 years old. She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. For 2 years, she has been selling charcoal in Thinkers Village Market, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She describes herself as a serviceable woman.

Her dream is to expand her business, and continue to educate her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To  buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 28 years old. He is married with one child, aged 5 years. His child is currently attending school.

Francis has been been practicing mixed farming for four years in the town of Nyamira in western Kenya. His main products are maize, tea, sorghum and milk, which he sells locally.

Francis has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from this loan will go toward the education of his son. In five years time, he plans to buy t3 acres of land and own at least four dairy cows and a shop. 

His biggest challenge has been the fluctuation in market prices. He says that his biggest issue is lack of a market and he hopes that Juhudi will enhance it somehow.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Angie

texts.en: This is Angie G., 42, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Jaime G., a jail officer at the local penitentiary, and is the mother of three children, all of whom are still enrolled in elementary school. By the grace of God, Angie has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send all of them through college, a dream for most Filipino parents like Angie. She was a college undergraduate herself and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children. Angie operates an electronic cellular phone loading station. What she basically does is buy electronic cellular phone load (prepaid cellular phone credits) in huge amounts then sells them for on a retail basis. Profit is generated depending on the network's policy of dealership. She may buy a 3,000 PHP worth of load for 2,500 PHP, where she makes a 500 PHP profit, depending on promos and quota set by the networks. Angie is also currently readying a few pigs for slaughter and buying and selling a variety of products. To help her continue operation of her businesses, she is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of products to be incorporated into her buy-and-sell inventory. She will also invest some of the loan to buy electronic load from different local networks. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Angie dreams to be able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her businesses. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. About CCT All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: buy more products to be incorporated into her inventory and buy electronic load

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
Adoracion P. is from the village of Flores. She is 49 years old and she has three school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $88 when she sells a raised pig.

In 2009, Adoracion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. 

Adoracion is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CLORINDA MATTO DE TURNER”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Calca en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Silvia;  La socia tiene 38 años de edad;  ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos, La socia se dedica a la venta de jugos en el mercado central. La socia también vende comidas por las tardes y toda la mañana ella vende jugos en el mercado central en el cual ella tiene su puesto en la sección de jugos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar fruta y vasos para su negocio.

 La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member is part of the Clorinda Matto de Turner Communal Bank; this bank is located in the Calca district in the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.

The member is Silvia; she is 38 years old; she is married and has two children. The member sells juice in the central market. The member also sells food in the afternoon, and all morning she sells juice in the central market, where she has her booth in the juice section.The member is requesting the loan to buy fruit and cups for her business.

The member appreciates and values the loan, which has been approved by means of this site, and she promises to make her regular payments in the established time period.

loans.use: Purchase fruit and drinking glasses for her business.

loans.name: Ana Delfa

texts.es:
Ana A. Díaz habitante del municipio de Malambo, es propietaria de una miscelánea  que desde muy joven ha sido parte de su proyecto de vida,  cuando inició con una tienda de propiedad de su madre, donde aprendió a apreciar el trabajo independiente y su emprendimiento lo ha hecho parte de su familia, de sus ingresos personales y del sostenimiento de su hogar, conformado por su esposo y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 11 a 24 años.
Inició de manera independiente vendiendo mercancía variada al detal cuando se casó y gradualmente ha ido agregándole vitrinas y mas productos hasta convertirla en lo que es hoy: una miscelánea y su gran patrimonio  al que protege mucho, porque se constituye en un ingreso familiar importante para el desarrollo de su familia y en su referente empresarial para sus hijos. 
Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con él, su credikiva, comprará útiles, papelería, cosméticos y artículos de modistería que requiere incluir en su oferta mercadológica. Cuando inició en la Fundación inició con $1.000.000 COP y gradualmente aumentado, hoy espera recibir $1.500.000 COP; Ana dice que los financiamientos de esta organización,  le ayudaron a crear su historial crediticio y comprar un vehículo de transporte público, que hoy es otro ingreso para el hogar. Así mismo su espíritu emprendedor la orientó hacia la creación de un negocio en compañía de sus hijos,  dirigido a la limpieza y desinfección técnica de aguas, ofreciendo este servicio a varias empresas y también logró a través de la Fundación formalizarlo ante la Cámara de Comercio. En sus tres años que tiene con la Fundación,  ha visto el incremento de su capital reflejado en mejores condiciones educativas para sus hijos y respecto al negocio mejor infraestructura pues ya tiene 5 vitrinas. Sus principales clientes son los vecinos del sector . Su máximo sueño es que sus hijos logren terminar en la Universidad sus carreras y continúen fortalecidos en hacer emprendimiento lo cual los hace muy independientes. Su mayor desafio es el control de los gastos familiares para que no se excedan y terminen consumiendo no solo sus ganancias sino el capital del negocio.
texts.en:
Ana A. Díaz is an inhabitant of the municipality of Malambo. She owns a general store, which has been part of her plan for her life since she was very young. She started with a store owned by her mother, where she learned to appreciate independent work, and her efforts have become a basic component of her family life, her personal income and the sustenance of her household, which made up of her husband and their 4 children, ranging from 11 to 24 years old.

She began by independently selling a variety of merchandise when she got married, and she has gradually added display shelves and more products until the store became what it is today: a general store and her great legacy, which she protects with care, because it is a significant source of income for the development of her family and a model of entrepreneurship for her children. 

This is her second loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and with her Kiva loan, she will buy household products, paper goods, cosmetics and fashion items which she needs to include in her range of merchandise. When she began with the Foundation, she started with $1,000,000 COP, which she gradually increased; today she hopes to receive $1,500,000 COP. Ana says that the loans from this organization have helped her to build up a credit history and buy a public transport vehicle, which today is another source of income for her household. In addition, her enterprising spirit has led her to create a business together with her children, in the field of water purification and technical disinfection. They offer this service to various companies, and she was also able to formalize the business through the Foundation with the Chamber of Commerce. In the three years that she has dealt with the Foundation, she has seen the increase in her capital reflected in better educational conditions for her children, and with respect to the business, better infrastructure, since she now has 5 display cases. Her main customers are her neighbors in the area. Her greatest dream is that her children will be able to finish their degrees at the University, and that they will continue strengthening themselves as businesspeople, which will make them very independent. Her greatest challenge is controlling the family's expenses so that they are not excessive and end up consuming not only her earnings but also her business capital.

loans.use: Buying household items, paper goods, cosmetics and fashion items which she needs to include in her range of merchandise

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 26-year-old single man. For a living, he sells cows for slaughter. He has been operating this business for four years. He hopes to open his own slaughterhouse in the future. He also does construction work for extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more focused in his business. He has requested for a loan of 15,000 Kes to buy goats and cows.

loans.use: To buy goats and cows

loans.name: Amigas Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Amigas por siempre” inicia su ciclo Nº11 en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, es un grupo que ha compartido bastante tiempo juntas.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes mujeres.  Los negocios que desempeñan son: comercio de zapatos, tejido artesanal, venta de ropa, tienda de huevos, venta de chuño, tejido de mantas, venta de mercadería de ropa venta de carteras y calzados, mercadería de ropa, confección de polleras cochabambinas,

 La señora presidenta de la banca comunal, señora Aurelia está casada, es madre de tres hijos, comenta que trabaja en Pro Mujer cerca de seis años.  La señora Aurelia tiene como negocio elaboración y venta de confección de polleras cochabambinas (polleras plisadas, hasta la rodilla), inició este negoció gracias al apoyo de unos parientes hace 10 años, ahora produce independientemente.  Su primer préstamo fue por $us100.- y fue invertido en la compra de tela e hilo, actualmente su solicitud fue de Bs.3500.-, monto de dinero que será sumado al retiro de ahorro que hizo para la compra de Telas.
Cuando se le consultó que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que le gusta capacitación, salud, ha visitado el consultorio y ha sido bien atendida.
texts.en:
The “Amigas por siempre” (Friends for Life) community bank is beginning its 11th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes regional office.  It is a group which has been together for quite a long time.  The group has nine female members.  Their businesses include: shoe sales, traditional knitting, clothes sales, egg store, potato flour sales, blanket knitting, clothes sales, purse and footwear sales and 'Cochabambina' skirt sales.

The community bank president, Aurelia, is married and has three children.  She comments that she has been working with Pro Mujer for nearly six years.  Aurelia's business is making and selling 'Cochabambina' skirts (knee-length pleated skirts).  She started this business thanks to the support of one of her relatives 10 years ago.  Now she produces her skirts independently.  Her first loan was for $100 USD which she invested in buying fabric and thread.  Her current loan request is for 3,500 bolivianos, a sum of money which will be added to the savings withdrawal which she has made to buy fabric.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she commented that she likes the training and the health services.  She has visited the health clinic and was well looked after.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Liezyl

texts.en:
Liezyl R. is from the town of Bunawan. She is married and has 4 young children. Her eldest child is only 8 years old and the youngest is only 10 months. To make a living, Liezyl owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Liezyl also owns and manages a sari-sari store. She sells sugar, vinegar and other products.

Liezyl joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liezyl has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Liezyl is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Nita L. is from the village of Cogon, Agoho, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 50 years old. Nita is separated from her spouse and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Nita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling coconuts for copras in the local community. Nita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional coconuts to sell. Nita is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconuts & to use as working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase coconuts & use as working capital

loans.name: Kory Pankaritas Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal  “KORY PANKARITAS”, (en lengua aymara quiere decir Flor de Oro), está solicitando su tercer crédito en el centro focal de Villa Exaltación, un total de  9  personas integran este grupo, 8 mujeres y 1 varón.

Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, como por ejemplo: venta de cajas de madera, costura y venta de ropa deportiva, atención de brostería (pollo frito), venta de mantas, venta de fruta, venta de comida.

La Banca Comunal Alpacoma II está dirigida por una mesa directiva, a la cabeza se encuentra la presidenta, la señora Justina .

La señora Justina tiene un hogar conformado por ella y sus cuatro hijos, ella indica que es divorciada.   El negocio de la señora Justina es la venta de  verdura y fruta,  también tiene un negocio de alquiler de vajilla.  El crédito de ahora es para instalar una pensión (en su defecto comprar una máquina).
Los cierto es que la señora Justina desea ampliar el negocio.

Cuando le consultamos a la señora Justina sobre lo que le gusta de Pro Mujer ella responde que le gusta compartir con las señoras de su grupo.
texts.en:
The “KORY PANKARITAS” community bank ('Kory Pankaritas' means 'Golden Flower' in the Aymara language) are requesting their third loan as part of the Villa Exaltación regional office.  The group has 9 members: 8 women and 1 man.

The members' businesses are varied and include, for example: selling wooden boxes, sewing and selling sports clothing, selling fried chicken, selling blankets, selling fruit and selling meals.

The community bank is run by an executive committee and the head of the committee is the president, Justina.

Justina lives with her four children.  She tells us that she is divorced.  Justina's business is selling fruit and vegetables.  She also has a business renting out crockery.  She is requesting this loan to set up a small restaurant (or, failing that, she will buy a machine).  What is certain is that Justina would really like to expand her business.

When we asked Justina what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes sharing with the ladies in her group.

loans.use: To open a small restaurant

loans.name: Cesar Adolfo

texts.es:
Cesar Adolfo C. M., tiene 20 años, es soltero, vive con los padres en el  Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. No Tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NARCISA DE JESUS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Temistocles perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto de siembre de maíz y arroz.

Cesar se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de maíz y arroz, compra y vende los productos en ventanas en comercial Peña y vende en la casa o en el mercado de ventadas todos los días.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es buscar el bienestar económico para el futuro.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Cesar Adolfo C. M. is 20 years old, is single and lives with his parents in Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. He does not have children.

The members of V.R.C. Narcisa de Jesus are located in the community of San Temistocles belonging to Cantón Ventanas. This little area is dedicated to short-cycle farming work sowing maize and rice.

Cesar is dedicated to agriculture sowing maize and rice. He buys and sells products in Ventanas in commercial Peña and sells from home or in the market every day.

He is requesting the loan to plant maize and  purchase inputs and seeds. With the support of the loan, he would be helped economically to supply his necessities. He faces challenges like pests and illnesses and changes in the weather. His dream is to find economic wellbeing in the future. He likes to play sports.

loans.use: Purchase inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Sanga Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SANGA, (4 femmes toutes mariées), ont une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames au quartier SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, le prêt passé a été remboursé dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de bois de chauffe à travers   AWA S.. 
AWA S.  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10 chargements de charrettes en  bois de chauffe. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages voisins et effectue sa vente en famille à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes au comptant, en détail et souvent à crédit. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000FCFA utilisée pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et être réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the SANGA group are four married women who average 26 years of age and 5 children. Most of them live in monogamous families in SANOUBOUGOU I, one of the neighborhoods in Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali.

They are seeking their second loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet customer demand. The previous loan was repaid without problems. This group of women trades firewood through AWA S..

AWA S. intends to use her loan to buy 10 cartloads of firewood. She gets her supplies in the neighboring villages, and retails at her home to a clientele comprising mostly women, for cash and often on credit.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 45'000 (ca US$ 90) to be used in part to provide for her family's daily expenses, and to be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy and resell firewood

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor A. is from the village of Port Area, Iligan City. She is 22 years old, single, and has two infant children. To make a living, Amor owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, and toothpaste in the local community. Amor has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Amor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. Amor is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and snack foods. This loan will be Amor's fourth loan taken out by Amor from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and snack foods

location.town: Port Area, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add on a room to her house.

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en: Quyen  L. T. is 28 years old  with two children who  are at primary school.  Being a  tailor, she  opened a shop that makes trousers and shirts. Her shop is always busy with the orders of customers. She can get 3,500,000 VND profit per month. Her shop became more developed when she decided to take out loans from Seda credit program and invested all in her business.  Currently, she wants to have  a loan of 8,502,000 VND to buy cloth to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: to buy cloth to meet the demand of customers.

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.es: Teodocia, de 50 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Francisco de 66 años y sus dos menores hijas Pamela de 20 y Zulema de 15, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La tienda de Teodocia es una de las más visitadas en la ciudad de Tarma, desde muy temprano por la mañana abre su tienda en espera de que sus vecinos lleguen a comprar las cosas que necesitan. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y esta dispuesta ayudarlos en sus compras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos, lleva 11 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, espera poder ampliar su tienda y llenarla de más mercadería, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad de productos. Es el noveno crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos, para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
50 year-old Teodocia is a very unassuming and cheerful woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 66 year-old Francisco, and her two daughters, 20 year-old Pamela and 15 year-old Zulema, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Teodocia's store is one of the most visited in the city of Tarma.  She opens her store very early in the morning and waits for her neighbors to come and buy whatever they need.  Teodocia is a very cheerful and attentive saleswoman.  She always greets her customers with a smile and is ready to help them to make their purchases.  What Teodocia most enjoys about her work is chatting with her neighbors.  She has been in this business for 11 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to remain in her store all day without being able to go out.

Over time, Teodocia hopes to be able to expand her store and fill it with more merchandise, so that she can offer her customers a better range of products.  This is her ninth loan with MFP and she is ready to make her repayments on time since she doesn't want to cause trouble for her community bank where she is very well liked by the her fellow members.  Teodocia will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more products in order to better stock her store.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, and soap

loans.name: Yousef

texts.ar: يوسف عمره 34 سنة متزوج وله ولدان يعمل في الزراعة ونقل المزروعات له في عمله 5 سنوات يحب عمله ويجيد فيه المتعة في الاستفادة فهو محب للعمل مكب عليه بشكل مميز يريد من خلال عمله ان يؤمن الخضروات والزراعة الجيدة لأهل قريته يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء اسمدة وبزور وصيانة البيك اب في نقل الخضار والفواكه له خبرة كبيرة في هذا المجال يحلم في تطوير مشروعه حتى يتمكن من تحقيق التقدم المادي والاجتماعي له ولعائلته
texts.en: Yousef is 34 years old and married with two children. He works by farming and by transporting the goods he produces on his farm to his customers. He has five years of experience in his work. He likes his work and does it well, as he takes pleasure in doing things which are beneficiA.. He likes to work and is dedicated to his work to an extent which distinguishes him from others in his field. Through his work, he would like to provide the people of his town with high-quality vegetables and farm products. With a loan from A.-Majmoua, he would like to buy fertilizer and seeds, as well as have maintenance done on his pick-up truck, which he uses to transport his fruits and vegetables. He has a lot of experience in his field. His dream is to develop his business so that he can improve his and his family's life economically and socially.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm, as well as have maintenance done on his pick-up truck, which he uses to transport his farm produce.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena F., 47, gives her full effort to making her micro business a success. She and her husband Gerardo live in Caloocan City, Metro Manila. Nena spends every day in her “sari-sari” (variety) store to cater to the needs of herself and her family. She sells mineral water so that people do not have to drink water from the faucet. And because many families typically cook their own meals at least three times a day, Nena saw the opportunity to sell liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) to meet their cooking needs. She has been in business for ten years and manages without hired employees. Every month she earns Php10, 000. Because she needs  financial help for her business, she has applied for a Php 25,000 loan. She will use this money to purchase grocery items, mineral water and stocks of LPG. She believes that increasing her inventory will lead to a more successful business. 

Nena is determined to work hard and love what she is doing to bring the success she strives for. It is her dream to make her business prosper and expand in the future. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meetings where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her variety store

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en: Sarom, age 47, is married and resides with her children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Sarom sells vegetables, earning an income of $8.5 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also supported by her husband who buys and sells cows, earning an income of $6.5 per day. Their  standard of living has improved since Sarom has had her business.  She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more vegetables to resell. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a KIVA partner.

loans.use: buy more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Orlino

texts.en: Orlino, a 58-year-old married father of a school aged child, is a farmer working in the Philippines. His wife is a housekeeper. Orlino is requesting a loan to acquire inputs needed for their farm such as fertilizers, seeds and pesticides. He will also use some of the loan to pay for the services of planting and land preparation. In the future, Orlino hopes that his business will become more profitable to provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for his farming.

loans.name: Los Claveles Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS CLAVELES” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Collpani, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Isabel. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Tienda de barrio, venta de abarrotes, venta de estuco, comercio, producción y servicio.
 
La señora Isabel,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes, que inicia conjuntamente este prestamo, aprendiendo el mismo de su madre.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de material (compra de estuco), este material lo compra de la zona Pacajes, posteriormente lo venderá en su tienda de la zona Santa Barbara. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la que la el préstamo es rápido.
texts.en:
The Community Association “LOS CLAVELES" is beginning its first season with Pro Mujer ("For Women"),  as part of the Collpani Center.  The association is made up of nine members and is led by a board headed by Señora Isabel.  The businesses that community association members participate in are varied.  Among them are: neighborhood stores, grocery sales, sale of plaster, trade, production and services.

Señora Isabel indicates that it is the first time they are joining with Pro Mujer, and the entry came at the invitation of a promoter.  Today she has a grocery store, which will be the first one to start with this loan.  She learned the same business from her mother.

The loan that she will now draw on is for the purchase of materials (purchase of plaster).  She purchases this material from the Pacajes area, then sells it at her shop in the ​​Santa Barbara area. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, because she lives with her partner and three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes that the loan is fast.

loans.use: to purchase plaster

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is aged 53 and married. She has 7 children, two of whom are currently attending school. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 28 years in Kitale town, western Kenya. Her mixed farm produces maize, vegetables, eggs and milk, which are all sold locally. She earns additional income from her posho mill in the same location. 

Tabitha has a good record with Juhudi Kilimo, after successfully repaying her fifth loan of 100,000KES. She has made a loan request of 55,000KES in order to purchase additional stock of chickens and chicken feed. The extra income from this project will help to pay for the education of her children and to improve her family's livelihood. 

Her primary challenges have been poor weather conditions and diseases, which affects her production. In the future, she plans to buy a tractor to help improve her production.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Fedd Bamtari Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Fedd Bamtari, composé de vingt cinq femmes, est créé le 1er juillet 2011 jour de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois Gad Demba Peulh.Ces femmes qui sont parentes et voisines vivent dans l'entente et la solidarité, les principales activités qu'elles mènent sont l’agriculture, l'élevage, le petit commerce, la teinture et la transformation d'huile d'arachide.


Madame Sira la responsable est âgée de 44 ans, elle est marée mère de six enfants et a deux petites filles en charge, elle mène un petit commerce de légumes depuis des années et fait parrallèlement de l'embouche ovine; elle a une bonne expérience dans ces domaines. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en boubou blanc bleu.

Elle achète ses légumes( choux, carottes, aubergines, navets.....) dans les marchés hebdomadaires et revend dans le village.



Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité de petit commerce et d'acheter un mouton pour augmenter son cheptel.


Elle souhaite plus tard faire de l'aviculture avec les profits attendus et aussi renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
The Fedd Bamtari solidarity group of 25 women was formed on July 1st, 2011, the same day the Banc Villageois Gad Demba Peulh was launched.  The women are all related or neighbors, living in harmony and solidarity.  Their main businesses are farming, livestock, small-scale sales, dying, and peanut oil processing.

Sira, the group leader, is 44 years old, married and a mother of six, with two additional little girls in her care.  For years, she has been running a small business selling vegetables and also fattening sheep on the side.  She has considerable experience in both these fields.  She is pictured standing at right in the photo, wearing a blue and white boubou.

She purchases her vegetables (cabbage, carrots, eggplant, turnips, etc.) at the weekly markets for resale in her village.

Her loan will help her grow her small-scale business and purchase a sheep to increase her livestock holdings.

Later, she would like to use her anticipated profits to increase her savings and to begin working in poultry farming.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for resale

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es: El señor Eugenio casado con la Sra. Dominga tiene 1 hijo que esta a su cargo, el tiene su tierra de 6 hectáreas en la banda del rio donde siembra yuca, papa, sandia pero también trabaja  con su camión sacando árido del rio como decir: piedra, ripio, arena para las construcciones, todo lo que el siembra lo saca personalmente para vender en los mercados directamente al consumidor para poder sacar ganancias de su capital, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en lo que implica la siembra de yuca, es una persona muy amable y trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Sr. Eugenio and his wife, Sra. Dominga, have 1 child living at home.  He owns a 6-hectare farm on the river where he grows yucca, potatoes and watermelons.  He also uses his truck to haul dry materials from the river--stones, gravel and sand, for example--for sale to the construction industry.  He personally sells everything that he grows at local markets, directly to consumers, so that he can get the most for his hard work.  He will use this loan to buy the supplies he needs for his next yucca crop.  He is a friendly, hard-working man and he's grateful for the support the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 47 years old and married with six children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who runs a business buying and selling herbal medicine in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Marilyn is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional herbal medicine to sell. In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase herbal medicine to sell

loans.name: Dagbegnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DAGBEGNON est composé de deux personnes qui sont des amies. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Suzanne Claire est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Suzanne Claire est âgée de 47 ans et vit au Bénin. Suzanne Claire est mariée à un  agent de sécurité du nom de Marcellin. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés dont un est à leur charge. Suzanne Claire n’a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Suzanne Claire mène comme activité depuis trente ans la vente du maïs à son domicile. Suzanne Claire s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Suzanne Claire sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DAGBEGNON, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The group DAGBEGNON is composed of two persons who are friends. This is the first time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé in order to boost its businesses. The group's representative, by the name of Suzanne Claire, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 47 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a security guard by the name of Marcellin. They have four children, all in school. One of the children is still in their care. 

Suzanne Claire never attended school. To support herself and her children, she has been running a business selling corn out of her home for thirty years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and wanting to increase her sales and her revenues, Suzanne Claire and the other member of the group DAGBEGNON are requesting an initial loan.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Karina Marilin

texts.es:
Karina tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Chepén departamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Karina desde hace unos años cuenta con una mototaxi que es de su propiedad, la misma que alquila para realizar servicio de transporte público en su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) la cual la trabajan diariamente mañana y tarde, con las ganancias que obtenga podrá solventar sus gastos y necesidades personales.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2500 nuevos soles para brindar mantenimiento a su mototaxi y realizar unos arreglos en la casa de sus padres, con los ingresos que adquiera podrá pagar su crédito y mejorar su nivel de vida.  Karina es una persona trabajadora que con mucho esfuerzo a comprado su mototaxi para poderse ayudar económicamente y poder apoyar con algunos gastos diarios a sus padres.
texts.en:
29-year old Karina is single and lives with her parents in a house that has water and electricity. It is located in the urban area of Chepén District in the department of La Libertad. The main sources of income in the area are agriculture, animal raising, and tourism.

Karina has owned a motorcycle taxi for several years which she uses to transport up to three passengers for short distances. She works daily, both morning and afternoon, and with the money she earns she pays for her expenses and personal necessities.

Karina has approached Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2500 soles to maintain her vehicle and to make some repairs to her parents' house. She will be able to make the repayments out of her earnings and improve her standard of living. Karina bought her motorcycle taxi through hard work and a great deal of effort so she could support herself financially and help with some of her parents' daily expenses.

loans.use: to maintain her vehicle and make repairs to her parents' house

loans.name: Sarswati

texts.en:
Sarswati is 50 years-old. She is married and has 3 children aged 25, 21 and 18. 

In 2000, she established her tea shop business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supoorts her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys food materials for her business. 

In the future, Sarswati plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

As a borrower, to improve living standards extra trainings are needed. Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal. Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.

loans.use: to buy food materials for her business

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: La señora Yolanda tiene 3 hijos la mayor estudia la secundaria y los otros dos pequeños en la primaria. Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su localidad, platica que tiene con esa tiendita desde hace 15 años, comenta que primero era de sus papas pero debido a que estaban enfermos ella se hizo cargo del negocio y después ellos le traspasaron el negocio. doña Yola como de cariño le dicen esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de artículos para surtir el negocio como leche, huevo, harina, frijol, desinfectantes, agua embotellada, refrescos, enlatados, galletas, sopas, etc. para así tener su tienda mas surtida. La meta que tiene Yolanda es hacer un local más grande pero de cemento ya que en donde tiene sus productos ya no le caben, también dice que los días sábados y domingos vende cena como pozole, enchiladas, tacos dorados, tostadas etc. ella esta muy agradecida por lo que esta haciendo la financiera por que gracias a los créditos que le hacen su negocio esta mejorando.
texts.en:
Sra. Yolanda has three children. Her oldest child is in high school and the two younger ones are in elementary school. She has a grocery store in her town. Yolanda says that she has been in business for 15 years. Her parents started this business, but when they became ill, she was left in charge of looking after it. Afterwards, they passed the business on to her. Doña Yola, as she is known affectionately, is requesting a loan to buy products to restock her business such as milk, eggs, flour, beans, disinfectants, bottled water, soft drinks, canned goods, cookies, soups, and other items so that she will have more inventory.

Her goal is to have a larger store because she has spaces where her products no longer fit. In addition, she sells dinner on Saturdays and Sundays. Yolanda prepares stew, enchiladas, hard tacos, tostadas, and other dishes. She is very grateful to have financing and that the loans have helped to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ahjol

texts.en:
Ahjol is 41 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt,  in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His wife is unemployed, his eldest son is a college student, and his younger two children are secondary school students. 

Ahjol started his taxi business in 2006.  He drives an old Russian sedan which is 31 years old and no one wants to sit in that car nowadays. Therefore, he wants to buy another car for his business.  He is a hardworking and diligent man who says "I ran my business for a long time and I love it. Unfortunately, my car is getting old."   He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy a new car.

loans.use: buy a car

loans.name: María Patricia

texts.es: Patricia es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 9 años trabaja vendiendo productos femeninos por catálogo como cosméticos, accesorios, y productos de belleza, es madre soltera y su mayor anhelo es poder ofrecerle a su hijo de 9 años un mejor futuro, por ello trabaja diario con la ilusión de progresar. Actualmente Patricia quiere comprar mercancía en mayor cantidad pues así las utilidades son mayores y esto le traerá beneficios de descuentos y premios, su intención es cumplir en el menor tiempo posible con los pedidos de sus clientes y obtener mejores ganancias, sin embargo Patricia no cuenta con el capital necesario para surtir el negocio y comprar en las cantidades que requiere, por lo que solicita un préstamo con el cual mejorar las ventas y generar mas ingresos, logrando así una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Patricia is an enterprising woman who has worked for 9 years selling products for women by catalogue such as cosmetics, accessories and beauty products. She is a single mother and her greatest wish is to offer her 9 yeear old chilld a better future. For this she works daily in the hope of making progress. Currently Patricia wants to buy merchandise in bulk as the profits are higher and it also brings other benefits such as discounts and prizes. Her intention is to meet her customers' orders as soon as possible and get better returns. However, Patricia does not have the capital necessary to stock the business and buy in the quantities required. This is why she is asking for a loan with which to improve sales and generate more income, to achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise from a catalogue in bulk.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.ru:
Иван работает на одном из продуктовых рынков Ивано-Франковска. Раньше он работал на кирпичном заводе, но после закрытия предприятия был вынужден пойти работать на рынок. На данный момент Иван торгует овощами, а именно картошкой, огурцами, помидорами, луком, а также сезонными и несезонными фруктами, цитрусовыми, а зимой еще и рыбой. Он всегда предоставляет большой ассортимент фруктов и овощей по низким ценам, к тому же на этом базарчике мало конкурентов с аналогичным видом товара. Иван занимается реализацией продуктов уже на протяжении 4 лет. Его ежемесячный доход составляет 7 000 гривен. 

Раньше базарчик, на котором торговал Иван, был стихийным. Но недавно местные власти решили узаконить и облагородить этот рынок, вследствие чего там стали строить аккуратные киоски-будки, каждый из которых стоит 25 000 гривен. Иван хотел бы вложить средства, полученные от КИВА, в приобретение нового торгового киоска. Ему в ближайшее время необходимо внести первый взнос за киоск. Иван сам планирует торговать в новом киоске, а в прежнем, который будет перемещен в другое место, будет торговать его жена. В результате этого расширения Иван надеется, что его торговля увеличится в 1.5-2 раза. В будущем Иван хотел бы приобрести автомобиль, что становится все больше и больше актуально и для ведения бизнеса.  

Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Ivan works at one of the produce markets in Ivano-Frankivsk.  He previously worked at a brick factory, but was forced to find work at the market after the factory closed down.  Currently, Ivan sells vegetables, such as potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes, onions and also seasonal and nonseasonal fruits, citrus fruits, and also fish in the winter.  He always offers a wide variety of fruits and vegetables at low prices, and besides, there are not many competitors with similar products at the market.  Ivan has been involved in selling products for four years.  His monthly income is 7,000 hryvnia.  Previously, this market, where Ivan works, was disastrous.  Recently, however, local government decided to legalize and beautify this market and subsequently started to build neat kiosks-booths, each one of which costing 25,000 hryvnia.  Ivan wants to invest the money, received from Kiva, into the purchase of a new retail kiosk.  He needs to pay his first installment for the kiosk soon.  Ivan plans to work in the new kiosk, and his wife would work in the old kiosk, which will be relocated elsewhere.  As a result of this expansion, Ivan hopes that his sales will increase by 1.5-2 times.  In the future, Ivan wants to purchase a car, which is becoming more and more necessary for running the business.

loans.use: to purchase a new kiosk

loans.name: William Kipkoech

texts.en: William is a 49-year-old married man. He has two children aged 15 and 24. He describes himself as strict, courageous and kind. He operates a livestock sales where he sells cows, sheep and goats. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located Kakamega town. He describes his biggest business challenge to be that sometimes the marketplace is closed. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a cow. His business goal is to expand his business and add another outlet in Nandi shopping centre within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Matia

texts.en: Matia is a thirty three year old married man with a child living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been running a retail shop for two years despite challenges in price fluctuation. His dream is to build a permanent house for residence. Matia needs the loan facility to purchase sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Manuel Elenilson

texts.es:
Manuel, vive con su familia, con su esposa y una hija, él es carpintero, desde hace trece años administra el taller, este oficio lo aprendió desde joven y ha logrado mantener a su familia a través de los trabajos que le llevan los clientes.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de madera de cedro, aceituno, laurel, pega y pinturas, para mantener en el taller todo los materiales necesarios, así podrá mejorar su capacidad de respuesta y la calidad en su trabajo.
Manuel aspira tener un mejor movimiento en el taller, que sean más los clientes que le visiten, para que sus ingresos aumenten.
texts.en:
Manuel lives with his family, which consists of his wife and daughter. He is a carpenter. He has been running a workshop for three years. He learned this trade from a young age, and has managed to support his family through the work that his customers bring to him. 

He is applying for a loan to buy wood such as cedar, aceituno (paradise tree) and laurel, as well as glue and paint. This is in order to have all the necessary materials in the workshop. This will enable him to improve both his ability to respond to orders, and the quality of his work. 

Manuel's ambition is to have more activity in the workshop, and to have more customers visit, so that his income increases.

loans.use: To buy wood such as cedar, aceituno (paradise tree), laurel, as well as glue and paint.

loans.name: Robinson

texts.es: El joven Robinson a sus 20 años de edad tiene a su cargo una tienda que tomo en subarriendo desde hace tres años, luego de laborar en esta como empleado por varios años. Hoy día, el joven Robinson es quien atiende su negocio desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m durante toda la semana y vela porque marche bien. Este oficio lo aprendió de su familia quienes han sido siempre su apoyo y por quienes trabaja día a día arduamente con el ánimo de conseguir los ingresos suficientes para su sostenimiento. La tienda del señor Robinson esta con carencia de productos para lo cual el joven Robinson requiere de la compra de surtido. El sueño del joven Robinson es estudiar contabilidad y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Robinson is a young man who is 20 years of age. He took charge of a store that he subleased three years ago. Robinson had worked there as an employee for several years. Today he manages this business from 6am to 10pm every day of the week so that his venture does well. He learned this trade from his family, who has always been supportive of him. For this reason, Robinson works hard day after day and is motivated to earn sufficient income to support himself.

His store lacks an assortment of products, so he needs to buy inventory. Young Robinson’s dreams include studying accounting and expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Yesica Pola

texts.es: Yesica de 22 años, vive en la ciudad de Cartagena y es la propietaria de un negocio donde vende refrescos, meriendas, pañales etc. Su negocio está ubicado frente  a un hospital y es un kiosco, con el cual quiere seguir creciendo como empresario de la microempresa. Es producto de una tradición familiar de hace 30 años cuando fue propietario su padre y hace dos años se lo entregó a Yesica para que generara sus propios ingresos. Desarrollar su potencial de crecimiento es el objetivo de Yesica y esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará, productos de aseo personal pues planea comprar refrescos y tambien diversificar  e incluir en su oferta,  pañales desechables, toallas sanitarias, champoo para niños, lociones, etc. Con las utilidades producidas por este negocio, Yesica ha logrado pagar sus estudios universitarios de psicología, de allí se deriva el aprecio que ella tiene por desarrollarlo y aumentar sus utilidades para continuar fortaleciendo su bienestar personal. Ella sueña con tener varios locales comerciales en diferentes puntos comerciales de la ciudad, porque manifiesta ser muy emprendedora y capaz de  lograrlo.
texts.en: Yesica is 22 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena, she is the owner of a business where she sells refreshments, lunches, diapers, etc. Her business is located in front of a hospital; it is a kiosk that she wants to see grow as she is the owner of the microenterprise. Yesica is a product of family tradition since her father was the owner for 30 years and 2 years ago he gave it to her so that she would have her own income. Developing her potential growth is Yesica’s objective and this is exactly the reason why she wants her credikiva. This is her first loan provided through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, she will buy personal sanitary products, and refreshments as well as diversify her stock and include diapers, sanitary pads, children's shampoo, lotions, etc. With the profits, Yesica has been able to pay her education, she studies psychology at the university, and from the former she has the encouragement to develop her business and increase her earnings as well as continue to improve her personal wellbeing. She dreams of having various kiosks in different parts of the city as she declares herself to be very enterprising and capable of achieving her goals.

loans.use: buy personal sanitary products, refreshments as well as diversify her stock and include diapers, sanitary pads, children's shampoo, lotions, etc.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has two children, one of whom goes to school. She has one additional family member (mother). 

Angel sells second-hand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for five years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of second-hand clothes. 

Her major business challenges are seasonality, defaulters, and transportation. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and no access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, feeding the family, and school fees. Her aspiration is to build a house and to start selling at wholesale only.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Ayuen

texts.en:
Ayuen lives in bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 28 year, marriage, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Ayuen heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans, rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children

loans.use: to purchase beans,rice for sale.

loans.name: Cariñositas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CARIÑOSITAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Dionicia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de carne, venta de coca, venta de salteñas, venta de comida, tejido de chompas, venta de CD’s, servicio de construcción, venta de tucumanas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Dionicia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de coca; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su cuñada, quien desarrolla el mismo comercio, con el pasar del tiempo ella decide implementar su propio espacio de comercio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de coca) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente  lo comercializará a en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de crédito y ahorros.

loans.use: Compra de coca

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
Married with four children ages twenty-six, eighteen, sixteen and nine. Forty-one year old Fanta have been moving her business in garri, groundnut, bennie (sesame seeds) for 19years. Much was realized after accessing loan from ARD with Kiva’s help by Fanta as she can now boast of a reasonable savings account. As sales have been greatly increase. Also she has acquired a bigger store which serves not only for accommodating very large quantities of her good but also provide safe keeping for other business people. Working 6days a week and 10hours a day she earn about Le 1,796,500 every month from the business
She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Fanta requires a new loan in order to buy additional bags of garri and groundnut.

loans.use: to buy garri, beans, groundnuts, and bennie seed for her business.

loans.name: Victor Sindolfo

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Victor Sindolfo, and I run a small pulperia ( grocery store), called Pulperia Norma, in the center of my community. I have several years experience and the income I generate covers family expenses and other bills. I need to stock my store as the Christmas season is approaching and my sales will increase, and by stocking my store I will be able to offer a better service to my customers.

Hola Mi nombre es Victor Sindolfo, cuento con una pulperia de en el centro de mi comunidad,operando bajo el Nombre de Pulperia Norma, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos familiares y demas compromisos con los proveedores, necesito surtir mi negocio ya que se aproxima la Navidad y las ventas aumentan y de esa forma brindar un mejor servicio a mis clientes.

loans.use:
To purchase rice, beans, sugar, butter, ham, pork, beef, chicken and other item.

Compra de Arroz, Frijoles, Azucar,Mantenca, jabon, Carnes de cerdo y Res, Pollo y otros

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married and has two grown daughters. After graduating from a college of commerce, she started working as a market vendor. Today she runs her own business selling scarves and swimwear in the central city market. Presently, Tatyana has about $1,000 of working capital. Her monthly profit amounts to $150-200. Tatyana has been in this trade for five years now. There are very few other businesses selling similar items in the market where Tatyana has her kiosk. Because of this, customer demand continues to grow all the time. Tatyana has established a reputation as an entrepreneur of integrity. She has repaid every loan she has received from “Nadiya Ukraine” without any defaults. Tatyana is requesting a loan for $800 to re-stock her inventory before the spring/summer season. She is planning to purchase bright silk, chiffon and satin scarves, soft shawls and one and two piece swimsuits. Compelling prices and a wide range of fashion choices to suit every taste and lifestyle will attract many new clients to Tatyana’s business. An increase in sales will help her generate more profit and pay for her daughter’s college tuition.

Тетяна – одружена, в неї двоє дорослих дітей. Після закінчення технікуму Радянської Торгівлі, вона почала торгувати на центральному міському ринку. Зараз вона займається продажем шарфів, парео, купальників та плавок. Зараз в Тетяни приблизно 1000 доларів робочого капіталу. Її щомісячний прибуток складає 150-200 доларів. Тетяна займається цією торгівлею вже 5 років. На ринку, де розташований кіоск Тетяни, лише декілька інших підприємців займаються цим бізнесом. Саме тому постійно зростає попит з боку споживачів. В Тетяни склалася репутація чесного підприємця. Вона сплатила усі позики, які отримала в „Надії України” без жодних прострочень. Вона просить про позику в 800 доларів для того, щоб розширити асортимент товарів напередодні весняного/літнього періоду. Вона планує закупити яскраві шовкові, шифонові та атласні шарфи, м’які шалі, високоякісні парео, різні купальники. Помірні ціни та широкий вибір модних новинок задовольнять будь-який смак та приваблять багато нових клієнтів до кіоску Тетяни. Збільшення обсягів продажу допоможе їй отримати додатковий прибуток та заплатити за навчання сина в університеті.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Neyla Edith

texts.en:
Neyla started working for a lady making tamales in 2002. Over time she learned the business, in 2004 she decided to become independent, even though she didn't have much capital. Using the little she had, she was able to start selling tamales from her home. Later, with help from her family, she was able to get ahead and establish her business. Things have gone well and the business has grown, so that today she has two employees who help her meet demand.

At present Neyla is soliciting a loan in the amount of $925 to open another branch for the sale of tamales, and she needs cash to invest in the purchase of ingredients and publicity for her location. She will repay the loan over a period of 6 to 12 months. She thanks you very much for your support in helping her grow her business and have a better quality of life.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Neyla empezó trabajando con una señora haciendo tamales desde el 2002 y con el paso del tiempo ya en el 2004 decidió independizarse y abrir su propio negocio, ya que aprendió del oficio pero no tenia capital suficiente para invertir en su negocio, así que con lo poquito que tenía pudo empezar desde su hogar vendiendo tamales y posteriormente ella con la ayuda de su familia saco adelante la venta de tamales y poder establecer su negocio. Le ha ido bien con su negocio y ha crecido, así que ahora ya cuenta con dos personas que la ayudan para poder abastecer a la demanda que tiene.

Actualmente Neyla está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 925 para abrir otro puesto de venta de tamales y necesita efectivo para invertir en la compra de materias primas y publicidad para su local, ofreciendo pagar este préstamo en un período de 6 a 12 meses. Ella agradece mucho su apoyo para que pueda continuar creciendo con su negocio y tener una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: To open a new branch

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Señor Marcial R. N. is 36 years old and married to Helena. They have two sons: one is five years old and the other is three years old. They all live together in their own house. They both contribute to the family income: Helena is a dressmaker and Marcial has a forest nursery.

He began this activity three years ago, when he took a course on reforestation. He loves his job and he loves plants. In his nursery he has different types of plants such as roses, orchids, daisies, etc. He told us that he hopes to contribute to the preservation of the forests because they are the lungs of the planet. Marcial tells us that this activity is also very profitable, if he does it with the appropriate techniques. Now he speaks with various youth from the community who work with him voluntarily.

He has many clients, among them there is a group of Germans dedicated to reforestation and the preservation of green areas. As winter approaches, Marcial hopes to strengthen the care of his plants. For this he hopes to acquire meters of wire mesh with which he will improve the structure of his nursery. For this reason he requests a loan of $200 that he will use to acquire mesh.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

El señor Marcial R. N., tiene 36 años, está casado con Helena y tienen 2 hijos, uno de 5 años y otro de 3. Ellos viven todos juntos en una casa propia, ambos aportan con el ingreso familiar, Helena es modista y Marcial tiene un vivero forestal.

Se inicio en esta actividad hace 3 años, realizo un curso sobre reforestación, él ama su profesión pues le encanta las plantas, en su vivero tiene diferentes tipos de arboles típicos del nuestra foresta, así como también rosas, orquídeas, margaritas, etc.; él nos cuenta que desea aportar con la preservación de los bosques que son el pulmón del planeta. Marcial manifiesta que esta actividad también es muy rentable, si se realiza con las técnicas apropiadas, hoy día cuenta con varios jóvenes de la comunidad trabajando con él voluntariamente.

El posee muchos clientes, entre ellos hay grupos de alemanes que se dedican a la reforestación y preservación de áreas verdes. Como el invierno se acerca el desea reforzar los cuidados de sus plantas, para ello desea adquirir varios metros de tejido de alambre con los que mejorara la estructura de su vivero, para ello solicita un crédito de $200 que los utilizará para la adquisición del tejido.

loans.use: Purchase wire mesh

loans.name: Niluh Sami

texts.id:
Usually a pig can be sold for about $40-50 each after three months growing. A farmer can usually harvest 3-4x a year. Mrs Luh Sami A. has worked 3 years as a pig farmer. At this time she has only 3 pigs, thus she feels that she has not maximized her earning potential. Mrs. Luh Sami A. plans to farm 5 to 7 pigs at a time to earn more. Piglets now cost her about $15-20 each.

Translated From Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Tiga bulan pemeliharaan maka babi siap dijual dengan harga perekor Rp. 400.000,- sampai Rp.500.000,- . Dalam satu tahun bisa panen 3-4 kali untuk babi gulingan . Ibu Luh Sami A. yang sudah tiga tahun memelihara babi gulingan ini merasakan ada hasil tambahan dari usaha ini. Masalah yang dihadapi saat ini ternak peliharaannya masih terlalu sedikit, baru 3 ekor. Ibu Luh Sami A. berencana memelihara ternak sampai 5 sampai 7 ekor supaya bisa mendapat hasil yang lebih. Harga bibit babi saat ini berkisar antara Rp.150.000,- s/d Rp.200.000,- / ekor.

loans.use: Adding grower pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for home adaptations and merchandise purchase

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.en: Mrs. B. Adjovi is a married woman with 4 children. She started her business some years ago, but struggled to get an enough capital  to improve her business. She is applying for a loan of $100 so that she can buy more fish to resell. By doing so, she  will be able to make more profit and use it for her family's needs, and pay back this loan within 8 months. Thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy fish, smoke them, and resell them.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 45-year-old Georgina N.. She is married with four children, aged 16, 17, 18, and 19.

In 2004, Georgina established a fish and poultry business, and now requires a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional chickens to raise and sell.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about kuku. "Who or what are ‘kuku?'," you may ask. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons.

First, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two and either add to them as you go or wait for them to multiply naturally!

Second, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound.

Third, while they are growing, they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein.

I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons why raising kuku is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals? Prettier?), but this is all time and space will allow.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks to raise and sell.

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Mrs. L., 47, has been selling beef soup, cake and candy since 2001. She is married to Seang Sroy, 61, a truck driver for 26 years. They have one daughter who is working in a garment factory. They are living in Sam Raung Commune along Tonle Sap River, about 12 kilometers from Phnom Penh. L. is friendly and works very hard in her business. She hopes to build a new house for her family in the future.

She is requesting a loan for the fourth time in the amount of $1,200 to buy rice because the price is greatly reduced during harvest season.

loans.use: To purchase rice in harvest season

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Duong Thi H., 40 years old, lives with her husband and her two children in Y Yen, Nam Dinh province. She joined TYM Fund (Kiva's partner in Vietnam) since 1998. Before, she uses most of her loans to buy recycles. Every morning she bikes around 20-30km away from home to nearby villages to collect recycles. She then sells it to the recycling company, earning 3-4USD a day. The change in income is not a whole lot, but at least it's stable. This year Mrs. H. decided to open a small breakfast restaurant. The job is rather difficult, but the good thing is that she will not to go too far every morning like before, which is better for her age. Furthermore, her two kids can also help out in their free time. Mrs. H. would like to borrow 525USD to buy tables, chairs, and cooking utensils to prepare for her new restaurant.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Dương Thị Hồ, 40 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và hai con tại ý Yên, Nam Định. Chị tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1998. Thời gian trước vốn vay từ Quỹ được chị Hồ dùng chủ yếu vào việc thu mua phế liệu. Hàng tuần chị dành hầu hết các buổi sáng đạp xe cách nhà kH.ảng 20-30km, sang các địa phương lân cận mua sắt vụn về bán cH. các cơ sở thu mua. Mỗi ngày trung bình chị kiếm được kH.ảng 3-4USD. Kinh tế gia đình chưa có những thay đổi rõ nét nhưng có thu nhập thường xuyên. Sang năm nay chị Hồ quyết định chuyển sang bán hàng ăn sáng. Công việc tuy cũng khá vất vả nhưng ít phải đi xa, phù hợp với lứa tuổi của chị hơn. Hai con chị cũng có thể hỗ trợ mẹ ít nhiều.
