Chị Hồ muốn vay 525USD để mua bàn, ghế, nồi niêu ... phục vụ cH. việc bán hàng.

loans.use: Buy table, chair, cooker for restaurant

loans.name: Landy Del Socorro

texts.es:
Landy is married and has 3 children: 2 girls who are 17 and 15, and a 12-year-old boy. For 7 years, she has sold food out of her home. She has a broad clientele and usually sells take-out food. She started this business as a distraction, but it has become the principal source of income for their home. She now hopes to fix up her porch to make her kitchen more accessible to her clients.

Now she hopes to fix up her house so it is more accessible to her clients, and she is requesting a loan of $675, which she will repay in 6 months. With your help, Landy will continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Landy es casada y tiene 3 hijos, 2 mujeres de 17 y 15 años y un varón de 12 años. Hace 7 años esta operando en su casa una cocina económica, cuenta con una clientela amplia y generalmente la comida es para llevar, este negocio lo inicio como una distracción pero se ha convertido en la principal fuente de ingresos de su casa, ahora desea habilitar su porche para colocar la cocina en un mejor acceso para sus clientes.

Ahora desea habilitar su casa para que sus clientes tengan mejor acceso y solicita un crédito por US $675 que pagara en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Landy continuara con su cocina.

loans.use: To remodel her location

loans.name: Ana Liset

texts.es:
Ana Liset C. is 26 years old and single. She has been a shopkeeper for a long time but a year ago established premises to sell market items, hosiery and clothing. Her shop is strategically located 50 metres from the Caaguazú bus stop, and her main customers are the young travelling sellers in the area.

The loan which she is requesting is to invest in purchasing autumn-winter clothing stock, such as women’s blouses, baby and children’s clothing, t-shirts, trousers, etc. In the future she would like to sell shoes and lingerie for women, as there is not much competition in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

La señorita Ana Liset C., tiene 26 años y es soltera. Es comerciante hace mucho tiempo pero hace un año cuenta con un local de ventas de artículos de bazar, mercería y prendas de vestir. Su local que esta estratégicamente ubicado a 50 metros de la terminal de ómnibus de Caaguazú, y sus principales clientes son los pequeños vendedores ambulantes de la zona.

El dinero del crédito que está solicitando desea invertirlo en la compra de prendas de vestir de la temporada otoño invierno; como blusas para damas, ropas para bebes y niños, remeras, pantalones, entre otros. A ella le gustaría mas adelante vender zapatos y lencería fina para damas, ya que en la zona no existen muchos locales que se dediquen a la venta de estos.

loans.use: To purchase autumn season clothing

loans.name: Ololade

texts.en: Ololade Y. sells kitchen utensils in Igando Community. She is 45 years old and divorced with 3 children. She is faced with both the challenges of being a single parent and also the being breadwinner of the family. She lives at Igando, Lagos State, Nigeria. Ololade acquired the skill of trading for 3 years. She has been in this business since the year 1990. She needs a loan of $700 to enable her to buy more kitchen utensils for sales.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen utensils

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana has be dedicated to the sale of ceramic jars and vases for 3 years. She sells her products in the market near her home. Previously she sold cosmetics by catalog, but she was offered the ceramics business and she had no doubts about entering this business.

The loans that she has received have served to purchase ceramics wholesale.

She would like to have a store where she could offer toys and decorative items.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Ana se dedica a la venta de jarras y vasos de cerámica desde hace 3 años. Ella vende sus productos en el mercado cerca de su casa. Antes vendía cosméticos por catálogo, pero le ofrecieron la venta de cerámica y no dudo en incursionar en este negocio.

Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para comprar la cerámica por mayor.

A ella le gustaría tener una tienda donde ofrecer juguetes y adornos.

loans.use: To buy ceramics wholesale.

loans.name: Modupe

texts.en: Modupe "Mama" O. is 57 years old and married with six children in Lagos, Nigeria.  She is the leader of a microfinance lending group, and runs a business selling fufu from yams and cassava.  Mama makes fufu from the yams and cassava by drying the vegetables in the sun, grinding them to powder, and then boiling the powder until it is hard and smooth.  Mama learned this trade from friends of her mother many years ago, and has been selling this food staple for much of her life.  In order to keep up with customer demand, Mama now needs a loan of $600 to purchase more yams and cassava.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for food production.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru:
Буриевой Фотиме 52 года, замужем. Она занимается оптовой продажей конфет. Свою предпринимательскую деятельность она начала в 2003 году с небольшого количества кондитерских изделий. Данный момент она торгует на оптовом рынке «Солор» города Душанбе. Каждый день с ближайших районов приезжают клиенты, чтоб закупит у нее товар. Фотима закупает товар с поставщиков из Турции и Ирана, иногда с фирм. У нее много клиентов.  В ее ассортименте разновидность конфет производства России и Ирана и Турции. Также в продаже имеются конфеты местного производства. 
Для увеличения ассортимента и товарооборота, то есть закупа разновидностей конфет хочет получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони сроком на 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Fotima B. is 52 years and is married. She is a wholesaler of candy. She started her business in 2003 with a small quantity of confectionary products. Today, she sells her products at the wholesale market “Solor” in Dushanbe. Everyday customers come from nearby areas in order to purchase her products. Fotima purchases her products from suppliers from Turkey and Iran and sometimes from firms. She has a lot of customers. Fotima’s product assortment includes candy made in Russia, Iran and Turkey, as well as candy made locally.

In order to increase her product assortment (purchase different types of candy), Fotima would like to take out a loan for 4100 somoni which she will pay back over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase assortment of candy

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan Antonio inició el negocio para tener su propia fuente de ingresos y así poder sacar adelante a su familia. El inicio vendiendo aparatos eléctricos indispensables y de uso cotidiano a buen precio, y poco a poco logro hacer crecer su negocio.

El necesita un préstamo por US $375 que pagara en 4 meses para ahora comprar aparatos de uso en fábricas y así incrementar sus clientes. Con tu apoyo saldra adelante.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio started his business to have his own source of income and support his family. He started selling electric appliances at good prices, and little by little his business prospered. He is requesting a loan for 375 dollars to be paid back in four months. He will invest the loan in purchasing second-hand appliances from factories, and increase the number of clients he can serve. With your support, Juan Antonio's business will bloom.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing electrical appliances

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en: Mr. Nhor S. is a motorcycle taxi driver who is married to Mrs. Sopheap Heng. They have three children. Nhor can earn around $3 per day while his wife earns around $2 per day selling Khmer food. One of his children is a construction worker who earns $50 per month to help support the family. They live in Sralao Commune, Kampong Thom Province. To increase their income, Nhor needs a loan of $300 to purchase a trailer to use with his motor transport S. he can carry wood to sell when he is not driving the taxi. He will use the other $50 of the loan to purchase groceries for his wife's business.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer and groceries

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som N., 53, married and residing with her two children and husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, has a business selling many kinds of dried fish, eggs and sausage in the market. On average, she makes about $10 a day, while her husband works selling fruits, earning about $5 a day.

Som is asking for a loan of $1000 to add to her inventory of dried fish.

loans.use: To add to her inventory of dried fish.

loans.name: Blanca Mamerta

texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the Maria Antonieta Village Bank.   Blanca is 50 years old and separated; she has four children. Blanca has a stand in the April 12th Market, where she sells children’s clothing and traditional Ayacuchan clothing that she sews herself. She also travels to different regional fairs twice a week to sell her clothes.  Blanca needs a loan of 1050 PEN to buy baby clothing.  Blanca hopes that her business will grow.  

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Blanca es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta. 
Blanca es separada, tiene 50 años y 4 hijos, Blanca tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 D. abril en donD. venD. ropa D. niños y ropa típica ayacuchana que elL. misma confecciona, además viaja a las diferentes ferias D. L. región 2 veces por semana donD. también venD. ropa. 
Blanca necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. ropa D. bebe. 
Blanca espera que su negocio se amplié.

loans.use: Buy baby clothes

loans.name: Mirzakhan

texts.en: Mirzakhan I. is 49 years old. He is married with four children. After finishing welding school in 1988, he started working in the local factory. But when the factory closed, Mirzakhan had to start his own business. With his faith and enthusiasm, his auto mechanic business started to grow little by little. He purchased the necessary tools and began accepting clients in his business. During the last 10 years, he became one of the best welders in the city. He gained respect among people as a hardworking and very punctual man. Now, Mirzakhan is finding that the tools that he has are not enough to work at his job with full speed. For this reason, he is seeking a loan of US $1,200 that he will pay back over the course of 15 months. This loan will be used to buy modern tools and materials. With your help, Mirzakhan will be able to provide for his children's education and the well-being of his family.

loans.use: To purchase modern  tools

loans.name: Angeles De La Paz Group

texts.es:
El Banco Ángeles D. la Paz inicia su tercer ciclo con  16 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. comida, verduras, frutas, bebidas, ferretería, abarrotes en general y brindan servicio D. taxi.

Como es el caso D. Francisca que es separada, tiene 60 años y 4 hijos, Francisca venD. comida D. manera ambulatoria y también en ferias, tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes en su casa. Francisca necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz y azúcar.

Mientras que Maria es casada, tiene 45 años y 3 hijos, Maria se dedica a la compra y venta D. verduras. Maria necesita un préstamo D. 300 soles que invertirá en la compra D. zanahoria, cebolla.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles,  haciendo un total D. 12,800 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite, tomate, cebolla, gallina, cerdos, plátano, naranja, manzana.

Los sueños D. las socias son construir su casa, ampliar sus negocios y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
The Community Bank 'Angeles D. la Paz' ('Angels of Peace') is starting its third cycle with 16 members.

The members have different types of businesses like selling food, vegetables, fruit, drinks, hardware, groceries in general and offering a taxi service.

In Francisca's case, she is separated and is 60 years old with 4 kids. Francisca sells food on foot and also in markets, and she has a small grocery stO. in her house. Francisca needs a loan of 900 soles; money that she will invest in buying rice and sugar.

In Maria's case, she is married, 45 years old and has 3 kids. Maria dedicates herself to buying and selling vegetables. Maria needs a loan of 300 soles which she will invest in buying carrots and onions.

The members need different loan amounts like 300 soles, 600 soles and 900 soles, making a total of 12,800 soles of loans for the Community Bank.

Their loans will be invested in buying rice, sugar, oil, tomatoes, onions, hens, pigs, plantain, oranges and apples.

The members' dreams are to build houses, enlarge their businesses and for their kids to finish their studies.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, tomato, onion, hens, pigs, plantain, oranges and apples/Para la compra de  arroz, azúcar, aceite, tomate, cebolla, gallina, cerdos, plátano, naranja, manzana.

loans.name: Nakitto Plaxeda Group

texts.en:
Plaxeda is 37 years of age she is married with four children. Aged between 14years and twenty years they are all at school.
She stays in a six roomed house with electricity but no piped water. She fetches her water from the well.
She has two meals a day and her greatest expense in a month is feeding, school fees, and transport to her work place.
She sells matooke{ bananas} in the market where she rents a room to store her bananas 
She works four days a week and she receives about 50 customers a day. She sells both on retail and wholesale.
She has done this business for fifteen years now and the challenge she finds in her business is that at times she gets accidents on the way from collecting her bananas this is because she get her bananas from the village.
She has worked with MCDT for four years now and the reason why she chose to work with MCDT is because she wanted some capital to put in her business 
She plans to construct a rental houses to improve on her income.

loans.use: icrease stock

loans.name: Curcenco

texts.en:
M. Curcenco owns 6 hecatres of vineyard in Moldova, Muscat and Pino. In the arable land, M. grows cereals and vegetables that she sells at the wholesale market from the district. M. sells the grapes to the local producers of wine and to the exporters of fruits.

M. has run small businesses for more than 9 years. Together with her husband she also produces sheep and lambs that they sell in the third year. M. requested a loan to purchase building materials for the construction of a warehouse. The business is profitable because there is a high demand for agricultural products in that region.

loans.use: {urchasing building materials for the construction of a warehouse

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ana Maria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”, vive en el Jr. Comercio Nº 560, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 37 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 02 que todavía depende de ella.

Se inicio con un capital propio de S/. 10,000.00 por iniciativa propia, emprendió su  propio negocio de venta de granos y harinas al por mayor y menor.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio de venta de granos y harinas, al por mayor y menor, como sacos de arroz, almidón y frejoles.  Cuenta con un ambiente acondicionado y espacioso, ubicado en su misma casa, donde sus principales clientes son los moradores de la comunidad y amigos.
 
Con el préstamo de S/3,000.00 que cancelara a un  plazo de 04  meses, lo invertirá comprando más productos para surtir su negocio como sacos de arroz y almidón, y productos variados para atender los pedidos de  su clientela.

Es ella quien  toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, se siente más independiente, segura y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Ana Maria, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Ana Maria belongs to the communal bank "Corazón de Jesús". She lives at Nº 560 Jr. Comercio, in the district of San José de Sisa, department of San Martín. She is married, 37 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom still depend on her. She began her own business selling wholesale and retail grains and flour with her own capital, in the amount of 10,000 soles. She is currently continuing this work selling grains and flour, as well as sacks of rice, starch and beans. She has a comfortable and spacious environment, located in her own home, where her primary customers are residents of the community and her friends. With this loan of 3,000 soles, which she will repay in four months, she will buy more products to stock her business, such as sacks of rice and starch and various products to fill the orders of her customers. It is she who makes the decisions regarding her business's earnings. Personally, she feels more independent, secure and responsible in making her repayments. Ana Maria gives thanks to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of rice, starch and other wholesale products

loans.name: Sayali

texts.en:
M. Sayali is 36 years old, married, and lives with his wife and 6 children. He has been a farmer for the past 6 years, which he began with the goal of supporting his household and above all to satisfy the needs of his children. For Sayali, agriculture is an activity that he likes to do. Within it, vegetable production is what he likes most as it is easier to cultivate these plants and the product is profitable in season, which is annually.

But the earnings are greater and beneficial for every farmer, especially when buyers purchase the production in great quantities and the expense of transporting the products is avoided as the buyers come to harvest and take them away themselves. Now Sayali wishes to borrow money which he wants to invest in seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants. Be an important part of the growth of Sayali’s business. He is sincerely grateful to all of you.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Seeds, fertilizer, fuels, and lubricants

loans.name: Tajudeen

texts.en: Tajudeen M. makes furniture like chairs, tables, cabinets, etc. He is 34 years old and married with two children. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 nairas to purchase more materials to make furniture. He says thanks to Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more furniture materials

loans.name: Hamidan Pervaiz Akhtar Group

texts.en:
Hamidan baji is a very hardworking lady. She handles two businesses: one is bangle-selling and the second is sewing clothes. Her customers are from her locality. They come to her both for buying bangles and for sewing clothes. Her family is very happy with her supportive behavior. Her husband’s name is P. A. and he runs a grocery shop in the community. Hamidan baji is applying for a loan to buy groceries to expand her husband’s grocery shop. 

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality:

Rashida parveen baji wants a loan to buy a welding machine.

Shamila parveen baji wants a loan to buy iron for making iron rods to sell.

Abida baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her husband's grocery shop

loans.name: Mahmasaid

texts.en: Y. Mahmasaid is 20 years old. He is not married and he lives with his parents. He makes a living raising cattle in his house. He's the kind of boy who works hard to provide for his family. Every day, from very early in the morning, he tends his cattle, feeding them and milking the cows. Currently, Mahmasaid needs to buy young cattle that he needs to continue his business and, in turn, maintain his humble household. With your help this young and energetic boy can achieve his goals. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more young cattle to raise and sell

loans.name: Adonai

texts.es: Adonai C. M. de 44 años de edad reside en el departamento de La Libertad, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijas Maria de 9 años e Imelda de 7 años, ambas niñas estudian nivel básico en la escuela. Adonai es un hombre muy trabajador ha establecido su negocio donde fabrica teja y ladrillos de manera artesanal, su negocio genera empleo a tres familias mas, ya que Adonai cuenta con tres empleados quienes ayudan en la elaboración de sus productos, Adonai solicita un crédito para compra de materia prima como leña, tierra y barro para la elaboración de ladrillo y leña; de esta manera lograra aumentar su producción al igual que su volumen de ventas.
texts.en:
Adonai C. M. is 44 years old and lives in La Libertad department (state), alongside his wife and their 2 children, 9 year old Maria, and 7 year old Imelda. Both daughters currently study at primary school. Adonai is a hard-working man, and has established a business where he makes bricks by hand. His business creates work for 3 other families as well, so Adonai has 3 employees who help him produce his goods. Adonai requests a loan to purchase raw materials in order to make more goods; in this way, he will be able to increase his production to match his high volume of sales.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Nyame Ne Hene Group

texts.en: Victoria is thirty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to two children who are currently in school. She is a trader. Victoria deals in footwear and textiles. She hawks to sell. She is the leader of a trust bank group called "Nyame Ne Hene," which literally means "God is the King." She is seated in front in the group photograph. The members of this group are mostly traders, food vendors, and farmers. They work very hard to support their spouses and to provide for their families. They buy their raw materials, wares, or goods from Kumasi, and sometimes from nearby communities, and sell at the market square in the community they live in. Some trek to other towns to sell their products. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan. They are requesting the loan to procure more goods and raw materials to be able to expand their businesses and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Odeaza

texts.en:
Odeaza manages a hog-raising and a buy-and-sell business. The second business began when her eldest child entered college and Odeaza got the idea of engaging in something to supplement her hog-raising work. The combination of the two businesses really helps with income and helps provide for the educational needs of her child.

To help improve their living conditions, Odeaza also purchases fresh pork meat that she sells in their neighborhood at a retail price. This way, she is generating a daily income which is very helpful in meeting the daily needs of the family.

Odeaza is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 that she will use as additional capital for her current business. She hopes that it will bring her more income to use toward the education of her children and in supporting their family.

She is 40 years old and her husband's name is Wilson. In addition to their college child, they have a child in high school.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food stuffs

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Badeya est un regroupement de l’association Balimaya composé de 2 femmes mariées et  2 célibataires qui ont en  moyenne  34 ans et 1 enfant.  Elles vivent dans des familles monogames à Fama,  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de mariages, de  voisinage et font  de l’achat et la vente de   tissus, draps, pagnes brodés –uni wax, atiécké et charbon de bois etc.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur troisième  prêt de groupe tous les deux précédents  ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté. 
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 3 balles de tissus, 1 pièce et ½  d’uni wax, 1 pièce de brodés, 25 sacs de charbon de bois, 3 sacs d’atiécké et 5 balles de tissus pour draps. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants et effectuent leurs ventes à Sikasso ville dans les différents marchés et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante, au comptant, quelques fois à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 27.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elles comptent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir aménager un coin de vente.
texts.en:
Badeya is a group of the Balimaya association, composed of 2 married and 2 single women, who are on average 34 years old with 1 child. They live in monogamous households in Fama, one of the districts in the city of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They know each other through familial and community ties, and are engaged in the buying and selling of fabric, sheets, uni-wax and embroidered pagnes (a type of West African cloth), atiécké (a starchy food made from cassava), charcoal, etc. They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners) in order to meet the needs of their clientele, and are seeking their third group loan, with the two previous loans having been repaid without any difficulties. With this new loan, they intend to buy 3 bales of fabric, 1 and a half sets of uni-wax pagnes, 1 set of embroidered pagnes, 25 bags of charcoal, 3 bags of atiécké, and 5 bales of fabric for sheets. They supply themselves at the grand market in Sikasso town and in the neighbouring villages, and make their sales in Sikasso town at various markets and door-to-door in the districts, in cash, sometimes on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women. They foresee realizing a monthly profit of 27,500 FCFA each, of which one portion will be used for savings and family needs, and the remainder invested in their businesses. They intend to have more capital to better satisfy their customers and to set up a little shop.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell various items

loans.name: Las Morlaquitas(Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Morlaquitas está  ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca al Sur del Ecuador,  éste banco está conformado por un grupo de mujeres luchadoras que tienen una visión muy amplia de la vida, quieren dejar atrás todo aquello que pueda truncar su futuro y el de su familia pues  tienen mucha confianza que cada día les va a ir mejor  y podrán proporcionar a su familia un poco de la vida que siempre desearon tener, demostrando  que con mucho esfuerzo y empeño todo se puede lograr, todas las socias del banco viven en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca.

La señora  Luisa Narcisa  T. A.  es socia  activa del Banco Comunal Morlaquitas, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca en el  Sector de la Feria Libre, tiene 45 años de edad, es divorciada  desde 13 años porque su vida matrimonial no fue la que esperaba,  pues su ex marido con frecuencia la agredía física y psicológicamente, ya que en su hogar nunca existió comprensión, tiene 2 hijos de 23, 13 años de edad, su hijo mayor  trabaja en ETAPA (Empresa Municipal de Telecomunicaciones, Agua Potable, Alcantarillado y Sanitario de Cuenca) y estudia en el Sindicato de Choferes Profesionales del Azuay, su hijo menor estudia en un colegio de la localidad, no tienen casa propia por lo que  la casa en la que habitan es arrendada.

Luisa tiene su  profesión de estilista hace varios años, tiene 4 años en su local en la ciudad de Cuenca y 20 en la parroquia de Quingueo,  además se dedica a la venta de productos para la belleza de la mujer  YANBAL, en éste último  lleva seis años y nos comenta que tiene su propia clientela además le va muy bien en las dos actividades.

Luisa es una de las socias más alegres de su  banco comunal, trabaja junto a la fundación cinco ciclos y da testimonio que los créditos obtenidos  le han beneficiado de muchos apuros económicos que le han surgido y  ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio incrementando la línea de cosméticos Yanbal.

 Con el préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue lo va a invertir en la compra de más productos YANBAL  para incrementar su negocio con cosméticos para damas, caballeros y niños.
 
El gran sueño de Luisa es que su hijo llegue a culminar los estudios superiores.

La señora Soraya de Lourdes Arízaga  A. es otra socia del Banco Comunal Morlaquitas, vive en San Pedro vía a Racar en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 33 años de edad, es felizmente casada  tiene una niña de 2 años 7 meses, su esposo trabaja en la embotelladora Cristal lo que le permite aportar económicamente a su hogar buscando la estabilidad económica que necesitan, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.


Soraya es comerciante de ropa colombiana por catalogo lleva tres años en este negocio, y hace dos meses abrió una pequeña tienda en su casa,  comenta que le va muy  bien  pues ya cuenta con su clientela fija, esta actividad la realiza puerta a puerta en su barrio dándoles comodidad a sus clientes porque les entrega la mercadería y cobra  en el domicilio con el propósito de darles un buen servicio  y obtener más clientela, y hace dos meses abrió una pequeña tienda en su casa.

Soraya es una mujer emprendedora y carismática,  mantiene una buena relación con sus compañeras del banco comunal, lleva trabajando tres ciclos en su banco y asegura que los créditos recibidos le han ayudado mucho para mantener su negocio de ropa y para montar su tienda. Con el préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue  va a invertir en productos para su tienda, surtirla con vA. líneas y dar un buen servicio a sus clientes.

El mayor  sueño de nuestra socia  es tener su propio almacén de ropa.
texts.en:
The Morlaquitas Communal Bank is located in the city of Cuenca in the southern part of Ecuador. This bank is comprised of women who are fighters and have a very large vision for their lives. They want to leave behind all that could curtail their future and that of their families. They are confident that each day will go better, and they will be able to give their families a little bit of life that they have always wanted to have. They demonstrate that with much effort and strength you can achieve everything. All of the members of the bank live in the area of the city of Cuenca. Luisa Narcisa T. A. is an active member of the Morlaquitas Communal Bank. She lives in the area of the city of Cuenca in the Sector de la Feria Libre. She is 45, and she has been divorced for 13 years. Her marital life was not what she hoped for. Her ex-husband attacked her physically and psychologically. Understanding never existed in her home. She has two children, 23 and 13. Her oldest son works in ETAPA (Municipal Business of Telecommunications, Potable Water, Sewage and Sanitation of Cuenca) and studies in the Professional Drivers Syndicate of Azuay. Her youngest son goes to the local school. They do not have they own house, so they live in a rented house. Luisa has been a stylist for several years. She has been in her place in the city of Cuenca for four years. She has been in the Quingeo parish for 20 years. She also has been selling women’s Yanbal beauty products for six years. She has her own customers, and it is going well for her in both activities. Luisa is one of the happiest members of her communal bank. She has worked with the foundation for five cycles. She says that the loans she got have helped her in the times of economic hardships she has encountered. They suggested, and she achieved making her business grow by increasing the Yanbal line of cosmetics. With the loan from the ESPOIR Foundation she will buy more Yanbal products to increase the number of women’s, men’s, and children’s cosmetics in her business. Luisa’s big dream is that her son completes his post high school education. Soraya de Lourde Arízaga A. is another member of the Morlaquitas Communal Bank. She lives in San Pedro on the way to Racar in the city of Cuenca. She is 33, happily married, and has a daughter who is two years and seven months. Her husband works in the Cristal bottling plant, which allows him to provide for his household, while looking for the economic stability that they need. They do not have their own house, so they live in a rented house. Soraya sells Columbian clothing by catalog. She has been in this business for three years. Two months ago she opened a small store in her house. She says that it is going very well for her. She has a fixed customer base. She does this activity door to door in her neighborhood, providing her customers with the convenience of delivering and collecting payment in their home. She does this to give good service and get more customers. Two months ago she opened a small store in her house. Soraya is an enterprising and charismatic woman. She has a good relationship with her colleagues in the communal bank. She has been working with the bank for three cycles, and she affirms that the loans she has received have helped her maintain her clothing business and start her store. With the loan from the ESPOIR Foundation she will buy products for her store, stock it with various lines, and give good service to her customers. Her biggest dream is to have her own clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise like perfume, cosmetics, clothing for the entire family to increase their businesses

loans.name: Emeliza

texts.en:
Emeliza is 35 years old and a resident of Larion Bajo, Tuguegarao City. She works as a hog raiser and also helps her husband, a blacksmith, in making knives. She usually sells their products in Tuguegarao City and, sometimes, in other towns. The couple help one another in generating a larger income for their family, especially to support their children's education.

Emeliza is hardworking and she patiently maintains their small enterprises in order to improve their currently poor standard of living. For this reason, she is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders amounting to 5,000 PHP to be used as additional business capital. Emeliza is grateful that she can help her parents with their basic needs through her income. She is hoping that their business will become successful someday so that she can give her family a comfortable standard of living.

loans.use: As additional capital for her manufacturing business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia Z. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Tembladerani, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo y sus tres hijos.
La señora Virginia es comerciante de productos como licuadoras, edredones, chompas, sabanas, que ofrece principalmente en oficinas de la ciudad y su esposo es empleado de una oficina pública de esta ciudad, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para aumentar los productos que la señora Virginia ofrece e incrementar sus ingresos por el fin de año.
Esta es la sexta vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Virginia Z. lives in her own house in the Tembladerani zone, west of the City of La Paz, with her husband and her 3 children. Virginia is a merchant of products such as blenders, eiderdowns, sweaters, and sheets, offered principally in city offices. Her husband is employed in a public office of this city. Their family is maintained by their incomes.

The solicited loan is to augment the products that Virginia offers and to increase their incomes for the end of the year.

This is the sixth time they have solicited a loan and the socioeconomic analysis carried out qualifies them favorably, granting access to the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY PRODUCTS SUCH AS BLENDERS, EIDERDOWNS, SWEATERS, AND SHEETS TO SELL

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz tiene 37 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 4 hijos, en su casa propia. 
En su juventud se dedicaba sólo a la siembra y cuidado de sus plantaciones de café y plátanos, pero ahora con el apoyo de su esposo, desde hace 10 años, implementó una tienda de comestibles en un espacio pequeño de su casa, donde vende abarrotes de primera necesidad, enlatados y bebidas
Luz atiende desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, de ese modo ha ganado clientes, quienes le piden más productos, pero por falta de dinero no puede comprarlos, es por ello que recurre  a este crédito para incrementar la mercadería de su bodega, y así seguir siendo un apoyo económico para sus hijos y esposo. 

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, donde ha ratifica su compromiso de pagar puntualmente cada uno sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Luz, 37, lives with her partner, the father of her 4 children, in her own home. When she was younger all she did was farm and tend to her coffee and baN. crops. But now, with her husband's help, for the past 10 years she has run a small grocery store from a small area of her house. She sells basic needs items, canned goods and beverages. She waits on customers from 6am until 9pm. She has acquired customers who ask for more products but, because of lack of funds, she has been unable to get them. This is why she now has requested financing to increase the available stock in her shop in order to continue to be an economic support for her children and husband. This is her second loan with MFP and she promisses to make her repayments in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a Sewing Machine

loans.name: Mitchel

texts.en:
Mitchel S. is from the village of Iligan City. She is 30 years old. Mitchel is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mitchel makes and sells snacks and other delicacies. She used to buy and selling bananas. Mitchel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Mitchel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mitchel is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase the ingredients to make the food that she sells. This will be Mitchel's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Sophon

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophon S., age 34, and her husband, Mr. Sophal Phoung (pictured with his wife), age 36, have been married since 1996 and have one son and two daughters. They live approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sophon has been selling fish for seven years. She buys fish from market near her house and transports them to sell in a Phnom Penh market. Mr. Sophal Phoung assists his wife in the business.

Sophon is applying for a loan of $1,000 in order to build a concrete and brick room under her wooden house.

loans.use: To build a concrete and brick room under her wooden house.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 32 years old. Married with five children, Agnes works to support her husband economically. She lives with her husband in a rented apartment in a mining community. Agnes trades in pasties (meat pies). She prepares the pasties and supplies to retailers in her community. She has been in business for nine years and wants to give her business a facelift. Agnes requests a loan to procure bags of flour, sugar and other ingredients in bulk to be able to supply to more customers.

loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Kiddawalime Group, Mukono

texts.en:
K. Joyce is 52 years old and a widow with 7 children, who also takes care of 5 orphans. Joyce has had businesses managing a bar as well as having rentals in Bulindo for 4 years, and she is happy that she is able to make 50,000/= as profits a week.

Joyce says that although she has inadequate capital, she ensures that she takes care of her customers, hence prospering. Her goal is to ensure that she accesses school fees for her children and with the loan, she hopes to expand her businesses by buying more crates of beers, wine, and sodas for sale.

loans.use: Buying more beers, wine, and sodas for resale

loans.name: El Exito Group

texts.es: Son un grupo de personas que viven a las orillas del pueblo de Momostenango, Las personas integrantes del grupo se dedican mayormente  al comercio a la venta  de ropa, venta de cosmeticos y las otras integrantes se dedican a la venta de comida otras personas se dedican a la elaboracion de hilos para pañuelos, y se determino que tienen capacidad para solventar dicho compromiso con la Asociación,  ya  que el préstamo les permitirá mejorar el negocio que cada uno tiene, con el financiamiento en ASDIR ayudará a incrementar el capital que manejan, esto permite que pueden crecer de una buena manera con el negocio con la que cuentan, en el lugar donde residen estas personas no cuentan con accesos para los prestamos por tal razón han acudido a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un prestamo con el fin de poder ayudar a mejorar la economia de cada una de sus familias, y tener mejores conodiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This is a group of people who live on the outskirts of the village of Momostenango. Most of the members of the group sell clothing and cosmetics. Others sell food, and still others manufacture threads for handkerchiefs. The association has determined that they have the means to enter into this commitment, since this loan will help them better their businesses. The financing through ASDIR will help them increase their working capital and allow them to grow. They don't have access to any other loans and for this reason they have approached ASDIR to help them grow their business, which will give their families better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Thérése Bousso

texts.en:
Thérése Bousso G. is a 68-year-old widow who lives in the region of Diourbel, Senegal. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for thirteen years and has always paid back her loans on time.

Thérése raises sheep which she sells in the market, an activity very common in her village since there is a grand agricultural market in nearby Bambey. This loan allows her to buy eleven lambs.

loans.use: To purchase eleven lambs

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 33 years old and is married, with two children who go to school. She runs a retail shop where she sells general merchandise such as maize flour, sugar, and cooking fat. She has been in this business since 2004. She also sells foodstuff, such as chips, next to her retail shop. Together with her husband’s salary, they are able to meet their family's basic needs and pay school fees for their children. She is a very hardworking and focused lady. She previously took out a loan of 60,000 KES, which she used to expand her business and repaid successfully. She has requested a loan of 60,000 KES to stock maize flour, bags of sugar, potatoes, and firewood.

loans.use: To stock sugar, maize flour, potatoes, and firewood for cooking

loans.name: Verónica Agustina

texts.es: Verónica Agustina D. D.
texts.en: 41-year old Verónica Agustina D. D.

loans.use: to buy meat and basic necessities

loans.name: Business People Group

texts.en:
Paul D. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called Business People. He is 44 years old, married with 4 children who range from 10 to 18 years old. He also cares for a sibling. Paul is a high school graduate but could not continue education through college due to lack of support.

For 2 years he has been selling mobile phone rechargeable cards and exchanging local currency to United States Dollars at the Jacob Town Chicken Farm in Paynesville, Liberia. Paul started business with help from his father who gave him some money to do business.

He faces a problem because of other competitors who do business close to his business site. Paul keeps his business environment clean in order to keep customers returning. His goal and dream is to expand his business into other communities. Paul needs this loan to purchase more rechargeable cards and increase the size of his business.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Paul is holding the sign.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable cards and increase his business.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is a farmer from Western Kenya in the town of Kitale. He is 34 years old and married, with six children aged 2 to 12 years old. Four of the children are currently in school. He has been farming for 13 years and selling his milk, maize, and poultry to the local market. He also earns income from selling timber to the local market.

Harrison recently completed his second loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 25,000 KES, which he used to start a poultry project. He has requested this second loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 25,000 KES to expand the project. He says the income from this loan will help him improve the living standards of his family. His main challenge has been poultry diseases, which, if not treated, can cause mass death of chickens. In the future, Harrison intends to buy more dairy cows and be the main milk supplier to the local market.

loans.use: To expand his poultry project

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary S. is 16 and married. She has a 1 year-old child.  She is starting a business selling fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam. Mary needs a loan of WST$1000 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Mary joined SPBD. This is her 1st loan from SPBD. SPBD's loans are Mary's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Destiny Women Group

texts.en:
Kemah Togba, who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Destiny Women. She is 60 years old, widowed and has nine children, who range from 22 to 41 years old.  She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to poverty. 

For more than 10 years, she has been selling used clothes and shoes at Red Light Market in Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000-Liberian-Dollar portion of this 30,000-Liberian-Dollar group loan to buy more used clothes and shoes. She describes herself as a hardworking woman.

Her goal is to improve and expand her business and open many shops.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes and shoes

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es:
Herlinda pertenece al Banco Comunal Amor Divino y durante el tiempo que es socia aprendió a ahorrar.
Herlinda es casada y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 viven con ella y están estudiando, Herlinda vende pescado en el mercado Covadonga, vende pescado fresco y congelado, actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos, sus productos los compra de los mayoristas, Herlinda los demás días trabaja en una casa de cuidados de menores.
Herlinda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pescado.
Herlinda sueña con construir el segundo piso de su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Herlinda belongs to the Divine Love Communal Bank and during the time that she has been an associate she has learned to save. Herlinda is married and has 4 children of which 2 live with her and are students. Herlinda sells fish in the Covadonga market. She sells frozen and fresh fish, an activity that she performs on Saturdays and Sundays. She buys her products from wholesalers. Herlinda works on weekdays in a child daycare center. Herlinda needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of fish. Herlinda dreams of building the second story of her house and offering a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Porfirio Israel

texts.es: El señor Porfirio es un hombre muy trabajador, el y su esposa se dedican a la elaboración y venta de quesos. Son una familia muy unida y tienen muchas ganas de hacer que el negocio familiar crezca y vender en mas lugares, para incrementar sus ganancias. El señor Porfirio tiene dos niños pequeños y se preocupa por su educación, el quiere formar el patrimonio de sus hijos y requiere de este crédito para la compra de mas material para elaborar los quesos, el agradece su ayuda de antemano.
texts.en:
Sr. Porfirio is a hardworking gentleman. He and his wife make and sell cheese. They are a very close family. To generate more income, Porfirio wants to grow his business and sell in more places. He has two small children and is concerned about their education and providing them with an inheritance.

Porfirio is requesting a loan to buy more supplies for making cheeses and expresses his appreciation in advance for the support.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making cheese

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Roberto Antonio C. C., tiene la edad de 47 años vive en el barrio La Borgoña y su esposa se dedica a realzar los trabajos del hogar y le apoya en las labores del campo, él es agricultor desde hace 21 años y su actividad ha sido el sustento económico de toda su familia, ellos tienen 4 hijos de los cuales 2 son mayores de edad y dos adolecentes que así mismo le ayudan en las tareas de la finca.

La afectación de las plagas no ha permitido en este año una buena cosecha, esto ha afectado su economía doméstica, y es por esta razón que solicitan un préstamo para dar un mejor mantenimiento a los sembradillos y que la producción aumenté presentándole a futuro un mejor volúmenes en las ventas con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de vida y ofrecerle a su familia mejores condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Roberto Antonio C. C. is 47 and lives in the La Borgoña neighbourhood. His wife does the housework and helps him with work in the field. He has been a farmer for 21 years, and this has been the source of income for his whole family. They have 4 children, of whom 2 are grown and two are adolescents who also help with the farm work. Plagues prevented a good harvest this year, and this has affected the family's finances. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to provide better maintenance to his plants, so that production will increase, providing him with greater sales volume in the future. His goal is to improve their quality of life and offer his family better economic conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: better crop maintenance

loans.name: Sisters United Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva partner in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you the members of the “Sisters United” group. They are women with small-scale businesses in Waterloo small town, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan of SLL 5,700,000 in order to further develop their businesses.

The leader of this group is thirty-three-year-old Bondu M. who was born in Kono, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. She is married to a police officer and the couple has four children – three in primary school and the last not yet of school-going age.

Bondu, who has been a businesswoman for ten years now, is the owner of a small grocery shop where she sells provisions: sardines, milk, sugar, butter, mayonnaise, bread, etc. She also sells market food such as rice (the country’s staple food), salt, onions, Margi (used to give sauces a sweet taste), etc.

With the help of this loan, Bondu will buy more of the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy more sardines, milk, sugar, butter, mayonnaise, bread, rice, salt, onions, Margi, etc.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong T. T. N. is 30 years old. She has a shop that sells construction materials such as steel, cement, bricks, etc. She makes 4,000,000 dong (VND) profit from it. She has been attending a credit program since 2007, and she has used loans effectively and repaid well. Currently, she wants to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy more products to meet the demand of customers.

loans.use: To buy more products

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en:
Maryjane A. is from the village of Malibud, Gingoog City. She is 58 years old. Maryjane is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Maryjane owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Maryjane has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maryjane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maryjane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Maryjane is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Maryjane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 50 años, es una madre de familia muy jovial, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y su hija mejor, quien es motivo de todo su esfuerzo. Desde muy temprana edad ha trabajado apoyando a su madre en la venta de pollos, con el tiempo su madre viajó al extranjero, haciéndose cargo entonces del negocio. Su trabajo inicia muy temprano por la mañana, con la recepción de pollos de su proveedor y a las 8:00 de la mañana arranca su día laborar atendiendo amablemente a su clientela, que en su mayoría son amas de casa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es la comunicación amena que tiene con los clientes. Lleva más de 36 años en esta actividad; por lo que espera comprarse una camioneta para iniciar en el negocio de distribución de pollos a varios puntos de ventas.  Es su 25avo crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro y mayor cantidad. Es una persona muy responsable de su grupo comunal, por lo que es muy querida y respetada por el resto de las socias. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para abastecerse de cantidad de pollos para aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
María, age 50, is a very jovial mother.  She lives in her own house with her husband and her youngest daughter.  Her daughter is the motivation for all of her efforts.

From a very early age María worked helping her mother sell chickens.  In time, her mother traveled abroad leaving María in charge of the business.  Her work starts very early in the morning when she gets the chickens from her provider.  At 8:00 in the morning she starts her work day of kindly waiting on her customers.  Most of her customers are housewives.  What she likes most about her work is the pleasant conversations she has with her customers.  She has been doing this for over 36 years.

She hopes to buy a truck for her business to start distributing chickens to various sales locations.  This is her 25th loan with MFP.  She knows that if she pays on time she will be able to access another loan for a larger amount.

She is a very responsible person with her communal bank.  She is admired and respected by the other members.  She will use the requested loan to buy more merchandise.  She will stock more chickens in order to increase her earnings.

loans.use: To stock up on chickens

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin Q. is married and has one son. He has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from a young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread.

Elchin has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of food items. With a starting capital of $200 USD, he began this enterprise a year ago. Over time he has expanded his business and today this business has become a family operation, as his wife is also engaged in it.

Today Elchin needs to buy additional food items to increase the range of goods he has for sale. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN. He is ready to work even harder, to make sacrifices, and to push every once in a while to achieve his goals and to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Buwenge Kisa Kya Mukama Womens Development-Jinja Group

texts.en:
Buwenge Kisa Kya mukama is the group that 45-year-old K. Aisha is affiliated with. She has been relentless in the smooth overseeing of her five-year-old fish selling business. This has meant that she has summoned up of a lot of determination. She says all bets are off as to whether she will achieve long term success. 

The Buwenge neighborhood where she operates is a melting pot of fish-buying traders.  It goes without saying that this is a highly lucrative business from which she says she has benefited quite a lot. Aisha is happily married with eight kids. To set forth in this business she had to bank on profits from her agro-produce business. Prior to that she was more inclined toward a timber-selling business. At present, she has a side poultry business. 

$66 is what she says she makes in a week. With this loan, Aisha says she is going to buy more fish for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of more fish for resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of spare parts (shocks, wheel springs, bearings, etc.) for taxi

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
If we want more in life, we need to expect more. Vilma M., one of CCT's community partners, not only sets high expectations but also takes concrete steps to achieve them. Vilma, 48, graduated from college and is married to Diomedes, a Philippine National Police (PNP) officer. Together they have four children, one of whom does not yet attend school. The three others are already studying.  The family lives in Pasay City, Philippines.

Vilma runs both a carinderia (street-side food stall) and a sari-sari (variety) store. She caters to the physical needs of her neighbors with cooked meals and retail items like soap, shampoo, and seasonings, among others. Every day, Vilma earns around PHP350 with these two small-scale enterprises.

To help her continue operating her businesses, Vilma would like to apply for a PHP17,000 loan. She will use the money to keep her carinderia in good shape and to replenish the stocks in her sari-sari store. Vilma envisions transforming the small store into a big grocery. Vilma also wants to raise chickens and pigs for additional income.

Vilma does not highlight her trials but keep focusing on her expected outcomes. Ultimately, she wants to see her family's home renovated and her children graduating from college.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Replenishment of product stocks

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica C. is from the village of Poblacion, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old. Veronica is widowed and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Veronica owns & operates a business venture in the food sector butchering and selling meat in the market. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from butchering & selling pork in the market. Veronica has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Veronica joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Veronica is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to buy pigs for butchering. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Veronica from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy pigs to butcher into pork & sell

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina A. is from the town of Sikatuna. She is 47 years old. Agripina is married and has three children. To make a living, Agripina runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Agripina also plants and harvests vegetables in her backyard. 

Agripina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agripina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Agripina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), which will be used to buy fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es: La Sra. María se dedica al comercio de abarrotes en un pasaje centrico de la ciudad de Quillacollo, atiende todos los días desde muy temprano, le colabora en la venta de abarrotes su hija durante sus vacaciones su familia esta compuesta por su esposo quien trabaja como empleado en la fabrica de refrescos, sus hijos de diez y seis años y su hija de doce años, la señora a demostrado puntualidad en el pago de su anterior crédito, solicita el crédito como capital de trabajo para compra de mercadería por las fiestas de fin de año ya que  desea comprar abarrotes, como fideos, azúcar, aceite, etc. Es una persona muy trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Sra. Maria operates a grocery business in a centrally-located area of the city of Quillacollo.  She works at the store every day, from very early in the morning.  Her daughter helps her with the business during her vacations.  Maria's husband works for a soft drinks manufacturer and they have two boys, ten- and six-years old, and a daughter, twelve-years old.  Maria has a history of repaying past loans on time.  She is applying for a loan to collect working capital for her business.  She wants to buy grocery products such as pasta, sugar, cooking oil, etc.  Maria is a hard-working person and grateful for the help that she's received from the institution.

loans.use: Working capital for grocery business.

loans.name: George William

texts.en: K. George William is an individual client from Kyenjojo. He is 38 years old and married with 5 children ranging in age from 1 to 15. He is involved in the sale of matooke from Rutabo / Bwizi. George says that his customers are mostly daily home customers and transporters from Kampala. He has been in the business for over 4 years and he is able to make 30,000 UGX as weekly profits. He also owns a motorcycle that he rides and hires out sometimes to contribute to his daily income. He hopes for a stable family and a financially growing business in the future.

loans.use: Buying more matooke for resale.

loans.name: Chhi's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four low-income people who live in Siem Reap province. Chhi T., age 41, has been chosen as leader of the group. She is divorced, has three children and makes a living by selling fish. She earns a profit of about $2 a day and will use her portion of this loan to buy more fish to sell. 

There are three other people in this loan group: 
Mrs. T. makes a living fishing and will use her portion of this loan to buy more equipment.
Mrs. K. will use this loan to buy a used motorbike in order to replace a one.
Mrs. R. is applying for a loan to buy equipment which will allow her to catch more fish.

loans.use: To help expand four small businesses.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es: Viviana Martínez es una gran comerciante de muchos productos,  usted la puede encontrarla vendiendo desde cosméticos, pasando por carnes fría hasta  refrescos y útiles de higiene y de aseo personal. Su inspiración emprendedora fue porque sintió la necesidad de generar ingresos al hogar  y cuando no conseguía trabajo como empleada  formal, decidió vender mercancías  y le ha ido tan bien, que todas sus expectativas están asociadas al crecimiento de su negocio, para conseguir en compañía de su esposo  sacar adelante a sus cinco hijos,  que están en las edades de 5 a 22 años de edad. Con su credikiva, que es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo comprará colonias, champús desodorante y talcos, con ello planea lograr incrementar su capital de trabajo responder a perdidos realizados por sus clientes y seguir cosechando compradores que se conviertan en sus fieles clientes. Su gran desafío es tener algún día un local propio y terminar el condicionamiento de su vivienda, para lograr una mejor imagen y exhibición de sus productos.
texts.en:
Viviana Martínez is a great merchant of many products.  She can be found selling from cosmetics, through cold cuts, to beverages and personal hygiene and personal cleaning supplies.  Her enterprising inspiration came when she needed to generate family income and couldn’t find formal employment.  She decided to sell merchandise and has done well.  All of her expectations are associated with the growth of her business so that together with her husband she can support her five children whose ages range from 5 to 22 years.

She will use her Kiva loan, which is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy colognes, shampoos, deodorants and talc.  She plans thereby to increase working capital to meet pending customer orders and continue acquiring buyers who will become regular customers.  Her great challenge is to someday have a locale of her own and to finish furnishing her home to attain a better image and exposure of her products.

loans.use: To buy colognes, shampoos, deodorants and talcs.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg is 35 years old and lives with her retired mother in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. They live in an apartment that they bought in 2005. She graduated from the National University of Mongolia as a lawyer and established her legal advice and advocacy center in 2001. She has been operating her business for 12 years while earning her Master's degree in 2005. 

Oyunchimeg currently rents the place where she operates her business. She has gained a lot of experience in this field. She is a hard-working and polite person who says, "I like to help others. By operating my legal advice center, I assist many people to deal with every kind of problem while supporting my family." She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy furniture and office equipment for her workplace.

loans.use: To buy furniture and office equipment for her legal advice center.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. Jackline has a restaurant. She has been in this business for five years, and she works seven days out of every week. Jackline sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale/retail. 

Jackline has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, beans and maize flour. She also generates additional income through selling milk. 

The main business challenges for Jackline include thieves, transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling at wholesale only. 

Jackline lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills, rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy bananas, beef, beans and maize flour

loans.name: Gregoire

texts.en:
Gregoire H. is 45 years old, married, and has two children between 9 and 14 years old. He also takes care of one child who is 12 years old. Gregoire earns a living by selling second hand items, such as sheets and men`s, women's, and children's clothing.  He has been in this business for 20 years. His business is well-organized.  Gregoire works from 7 am to 7 pm every day except Saturday and he employs one person to help him. 

Gregoire is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase more second hand items to sell. By expanding his business, Gregoire hopes to earn more profits.  With the profits, he will save for the future and reinvest in the business. Thus, he will create another job for the people in his community.

loans.use: To purchase second hand items to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn P. is from the village of Palao, Iligan City. She is 40 years old. Evelyn is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling canned goods, junk foods, biscuits, candies, shampoo, soap & firewood in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & firewood. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Evelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & firewood

location.town: Palao, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Siyazama Group

texts.en:
Sizakele (pictured on the far right in a white shirt) is a 53-year-old woman. She and her husband have two children who are 17 and 22. They currently attend school.

She runs a retail business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Emandini in South Africa and sells live chickens and cold drinks at her home. She explains that she has been in this business for three years. Her main business challenge is dealing with customers who do not want to pay on time after they purchase on credit, and facing the death of chickens when it's very hot or cold. 

She requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses (WDB) and Kiva to buy live chickens and cold drinks. She will use the extra income to send her children to tertiary. In the future, she sees her business growing and having a farm. 

She commented that it would be good if WDB could give them money on an individual basis because groups give problems of delaying payment while she has finished her last repayment and wants to borrow money again.

loans.use: To buy live chickens and cold drinks.

loans.name: Muhammadi

texts.ru: Мухаммад проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 22 года. Холост. Живет вместе с матерью и сестрами. Его мама инвалид, а отец умер три года назад. Он один работает в семье. Он занимается животноводством. Зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. В основном он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности  занимается  уже год. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Muhammadi lives in Hamadoni. He is 22 years old and single. He lives with his mother and sisters. His mother is an invalid, and his father died three years ago. He is the only one working in the family. He works in animal husbandry. He earns money by raising cattle. Basically he breeds cattle for sale. He has been doing this work for a year.  He is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Parsitau Ole

texts.en:
Parsitau is 38 years old. He is married and has two children, aged four and six. Parsitau has been working in the livestock trading business for seven years. He sells livestock to butchers to the KMC, Kajiado, and Kitengela markets. Parsitau describes himself as hardworking.

Parsitau has applied for a loan of 40,000 KES to buy more livestock for his business. This will include two cows, five goats, and five sheep. This will be Parsitau’s second loan with KADET. He has been a good client who repays his loan well. 

Parsitau plans to use the proceeds from his loan to buy a truck to transport livestock to the market. In the future, he hopes to start supplying more livestock to surrounding markets.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
