Tomas, es comerciante de ropa, vive con su esposa y tienen dos hijos, todos trabajan en el hogar y él inicio el negocio gracias al apoyo de su esposa, no tiene un horario fijo, y tiene un buen record como comerciante, ha trabajado con créditos que son los que le han permitido alcanzar crecimiento.
Él Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa tanto para hombres y mujeres, como camisetas, blusas, pantalones, esta inversión le ayudara a mantenerse en el negocio contando con todo lo necesario para los clientes.
Para él, crecer y ser un empresario exitoso es su mayor deseo, aumentando  la clientela y alcanzando una mejor solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Tomas is a clothes salesman.  He lives with his wife and they have two children.  All the members of his household work.  Tomas started this business with the support of his wife.  He does not work fixed hours and he has a good record as a salesman.  He has worked with loans which have allowed him to grow his business.

Tomas is currently requesting a loan to buy men's and women's clothes such as t-shirts, blouses and pants.  This investment will help him to stay in business as he will have everything he needs for his customers.

Tomas' biggest wish is to grow and be successful as a businessman, increasing his number of customers and achieving better financial solvency.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (t-shirts, blouses and pants)

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.

Teresita has a shop that sells breads, beverages and canned goods. She has had this business for five years. Teresita has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy more products for her store.  For the future, she hopes to improve her business.

Teresita became a member of HSPFI this year.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: María Leidy

texts.es:
Generar ingresos propios después de separarse de su esposo con el fin de cubrir sus necesidades básicas y las de sus dos hijos impulsaron a María Leidy a crear su propio negocio, venta de mercancía especialmente de máquinas de afeitar para hombre, las cuales distribuye en diferentes municipios de Antioquia. 

Para María Leidy este negocio es su única fuente de empleo y aunque se siente bendecida por trabajar desde su casa, se ve enfrentada a dificultades que en ocasiones no le permite generar las ganancias necesarias pues algunos clientes no le pagan. 

En el futuro, esta emprendedora espera convertirse en una gran distribuidora de todo tipo de mercancía para cacharrerías; por ahora necesita de un préstamo para usarlo como capital de trabajo, pues a sus clientes les da plazo de 30 días para pagar y actualmente necesita comprar más surtido para cumplir con los pedidos.
texts.en:
The need to earn her own income in order to meet her and her two children's basic needs after separating from her husband inspired María Leidy to create her own business. She sells razors for men, which she distributes throughout various municipalities in Antioquia.

Her business is María Leidy's only source of employment and even though she feels blessed to work from home, she faces difficulties in that there are occassions in which she doesn't earn enough income because some customers do not pay her.

In the future, this enterprising woman hopes to sell all types of pots and cookware, but now she needs a loan for working capital, as customers are given 30 days to pay and right now she needs to increase her supplies to meet demand.

loans.use: to buy men's razors

loans.name: G.s. El Sol Naciente Group

texts.es: La señora Yanilda Del Carmen tiene 31 años. Ella se dedica al comercio de prendas de oro y plata. Algo que la ha afectado es la situación económica que atraviesa nuestro país debido a la falta de empleo. Aduce que su condición de vida en la familia ha mejorado ya que ha podido incrementar un poco los ingresos del hogar ya que ahora no solo su esposa trabaja. Yessica tiene 28 años. Su actividad es la venta de ropa usada y nueva. Ella desea establecer su propio negocio en su casa con vitrinas y más estabilidad, por lo que ese es su sueño. Candida Rosa tiene 27 años de edad, ella tiene 4 hijos menores de edad. Su negocio que es la venta de verduras y frutas  y además de ello posee una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación. Josefina tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y aun no tiene hijos. El crédito es para la compra de golosinas, granos básicos, leche, sopas. Sus éxitos recientes es que ha podido levantar su negocio con los préstamos.
texts.en:
Yanilda Del Carmen, 31, sells gold and silver items.  Something that has affected her is the economic situation the country is going through due to the lack of employment.  She feels that her family situation has improved a bit because she’s been able to increase household income somewhat since now it’s not just her husband who works.

Yessica is 28 years old.  She sells used and new clothes.  She wants to set up her own home-based business with display cases and more stability; this is her dream.

Cándida Rosa es 27 years old.  She has four minor children.  Her business is fruit and vegetable sales and she also has a small home-based grocery store.

Josefina is 27 years old, married and has no children yet.  The loan is to buy snacks, basic grains, milk, and soups.  Her recent successes are due to her being able to launch the business thanks to the loans.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 38 years old and married with three children. For the past two years, she has been running a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and she also earns an income selling food. Fe works hard to support her family and has borrowed and repaid four previous loans from NWTF.

Fe is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy merchandise to sell such as shampoo, groceries, and other items in her sari-sari store. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz  is 40 years old and married with three children. She started her poultry business 8 years ago. The reason why she started her business was her husband`s small salary as a school teacher. The business brought her family additional income. Her monthly profit is 300 USD. Her uncle helps her with her business.  Gulnaz usually sells chickens and turkeys to the local vendors, and her uncle takes poultry once per three months to the central bazaar. 
Gulnaz would like to expand her business to improve the living conditions of her family. For this purpose she applied for 1500 AZN.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens and turkeys.

loans.name: Las Nicaragüenses Group

texts.es:
El grupo las nicaragüenses lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras, originarias de Masaya. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Nemesia quien se dedica al destace de cerdo y la producción de sus derivados frito, chicharrón, moronga, nacatamal…etc. 

Con el crédito ella comprará cerdo para su negocio y materia prima maíz, chiltoma, cebolla, leña…etc.

Las otras integrantes son Ana Rosa tiene una pulpería en su casa y Ana del Socorro tiene una pequeña pulpería.
texts.en:
The "Las Nicaragüenses" group is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial women, who are originally from Masaya.

The group coordinator is Señora Nemesia, who works in pork butchering and making pork products: scratchings, blood sausage, nacatamal (corn, meat and rice in a banana leaf), etc.

With the loan, she will buy pigs for her business and raw ingredients such as corn, sweet peppers, onions, firewood, etc.

The other members are Ana Rosa, who has a small general store in her home, and Ana del Socorro, who has a small general store.

loans.use: to buy pigs for butchering.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es: La Sra. Trinidad es una persona muy trabajadora la  cual  labora   en una maquiladora  de  la  ciudad , esto  le  permitió  adquirir  su  vivienda   pero  debido  a  el descuento  realizado  para  el  pago de  su casa   se  vio en la necesidad  de autoemplearse  dedicándose  a la   venta de  productos  naturista en  el   cual  le   a   ido  favorablemente   y le   a permitido  seguir adelante   día  con día,  es  por  ello  que  en este  momento   ella  requiere  realizar  la  compra  de  mercancía para  tener  los productos  disponibles  para  sus  clientes   ya  que  ella se  preocupa  por  brindarles  el  excelente  servicio  que  la  a caracterizado.
texts.en:
Sra. Trinidad is a hardworking individual who is employed at a factory in the city. This allowed her to acquire a home because her house payments can be deducted from her paycheck. She also saw the need to become self-employed, so she decided to sell natural products and has achieved favorable results. This has enabled her to move forward each day.

For this reason, Trinidad needs to buy merchandise so that she can have products at her disposal to sell to her customers. She is concerned with providing the excellent service for which she is known.

loans.use: to buy natural products to sell.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. She helps to pay utility bills as a way of assisting her husband. 
Aba sells gari and charcoal at Elmina. In the picture, she is standing close to the gari she sells. Her loan will be used to buy bags of gari to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy bags of gari to sell.

loans.name: Aibek

texts.en:
Aibek is 26 years old and lives with his mother and sister in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His mother is a nurse in a local hospital and his sister is a college student. 

Aibek started his local transport business in 2008 by using his pick-up truck.  He also buys old salvaged cars and sells their parts.  He is highly skilled in his businesses. He is a talented young man who says "I am good what I am doing and I need some support to expand my business."   He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy a salvaged SUV.

loans.use: buy a salvaged SUV

loans.name: Maida Veronica

texts.es:
Maida es de Ciudad del Este, está casada con el señor Reinaldo, tienen un hijo pequeño de 1 año, son personas muy  jóvenes, con muchas ansias de progreso.            
Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropas varias en el mercado municipal de la ciudad, se inicio en la actividad con un dinero que junto de otros trabajos anteriores y un poco de dinero con lo que la ayudo marido. Comenta que además de ese trabajo que hace, busca el tiempo para poder estudiar.
Ella es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe duda que va a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, como ser pantalones, camisas, remeras, bermudas y otros, los cuales son muy solicitados en esta temporada.
texts.en:
Maida is from Ciudad del Este.  She’s married to Reinaldo and they have a little one-year old son.  They are young people with a strong desire to make progress.    

She has a small clothing sales business in the city’s municipal market.  She started this activity with some money she’d saved up from previous jobs and with a bit of money her husband helped her with.  She comments that besides the work she does she also looks for time to be able to study.

She is a very responsible person who very much wants to self-improve.  She has a jovial, entrepreneurial spirit.  No doubt she will reach all the goals she’s set for herself.

She’s asking for the loan to buy articles of clothing like pants, shirts, t-shirts, Bermuda shorts and others which are very sought after in this season.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Khasan

texts.en: Khasan is a successful businessman with a good history as a client. He was able to grow his business from small to large. Now, he is selling detergents and other home washing items. He is married and has four children. Khasan has six years of experience in trading. This business brings him a stable income and his monthly profit is 300 AZN. He would like to expand his business. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN. This will be his fourth loan from AqroInvest and he promises to pay back on time.

loans.use: to purchase more items in order to increase profits

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 55 year old man. He is married with two sons and three daughters, and is a school employee with a decent salary. 

Ahmad wants to finish paying the university fees for his two sons who are studying French language and social studies. For this reason, Ahmad needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Ahmad gets the loan, he will pay the university fees for his two sons. This will enable them to complete their studies and get their first degree. 

By getting this loan, Ahmad will be able to change his family life positively. He will offer his sons the opportunity to work and live in better conditions in the future. Ahmad is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay the university fees for his two sons.

loans.name: Tagavuma

texts.en:
Tagavuma is applying for another loan to renovate her house that got demolished during the rainy season. She will use this 40,000 Kes loan to purchase building blocks and renovate her house which got demolished during the rains. In the future, Tagavuma aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Tagavuma has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase building blocks and renovate her house which got demolished during the rains.

loans.name: Alba Nidia

texts.es: La señora Alba Nidia a sus 48 años de edad es madre de una hija de 20 años de edad. La señora Alba Nidia es una emprendedora quien desea iniciar su propio negocio de venta de mercancía a sus familiares, amigos y vecinos. Por varios años, la señora Alba Nidia trabajo como empleada en varios almacenes por lo que cuenta con experiencia en el sector. La señora Alba Nidia requiere de la compra de lociones, cosméticos y accesorios femeninos con el fin de tener surtido para la temporada de fin de año. Con lo anterior, la señora Alba Nidia podrá mejorar sus ingresos y así la calidad de vida de su familia. El sueño de la señora Alba Nidia es tener su propio almacén de venta de ropa y accesorios para toda la familia.
texts.en: Alba Nidia is 48 years old and is the mother of a 20-year-old daughter. She is an entrepreneur who would like to start her own business selling merchandise to her family members, friends and neighbors. For many years, she worked as an employee at a number of stores, so she has experience in the sector. Alba Nidia needs to buy lotions, cosmetics and accessories for women, so that she can stock a variety of merchandise for the holiday season. With this purchase, Alba Nidia will be able to earn more and improve her family's quality of life. Alba Nidia's dream is to own her own store to sell clothing and accessories for the whole family.

loans.use: buy various products such as body lotion, cosmetics and women's accessories

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr: Martine est âgée de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Martine est mariée à un cuisinier du nom de joseph. Le couple a quatre enfants  tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Martine vend depuis onze ans, divers produits (condiments et conserves) à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Martine  vend de la nourriture (haricot préparé). Martine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Martine contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Martine sollicite un dixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les neuf premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Martine is 32 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a cook, Joseph. The couple has four children to support, who are all in school. They also look after another child. The children are all living at home with their parents and the couple both contribute to household costs. 

For 11 years, Martine has been selling various products (condiments and tinned goods) to help meet the family's needs. In addition to this business, Martine sells food (prepared beans). She buys her supplies in a market in Benin. 

Martine is able to contribute to her family's various expenses thanks to the income from her business. In order to respond to her customers' growing needs, Martine has requested a tenth loan from Alidé. Her previous nine loans have all been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy various products (tinned goods, sauce, condiments, oil, trays of eggs, etc.).

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa, tiene 45 años, se dedica a la venta de frutas, es madre de 6 hijos,  desde que esta en Finca Perú ha progresado mucho esta muy feliz porque aprendió como llevar un buen negocio, aprendió a ahorrar y se encuentra muy satisfecha con el apoyo que le brindaron. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de frutas.
texts.en: Teresa is a member of the Smile Communal Bank; she is 45 years old and sells fruits. She is a mother to 6 children and since she has been a member of Finca Perú she has progressed a great deal and is very happy as she learned how to have a good business, save and is very happy with the support that she has received. The loan will be used to buy fruits.

loans.use: buy fruits.

loans.name: Kuña Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
Kuña Pyapy Mbarete es el grupo formado en ciudad del este, por 22 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que ven el la fundación paraguaya un lugar de ayuda a ellas, ya que no cualquiera las quisieron ayudar. Actualmente se encuentran en el sexto ciclo del programa de la fundación y desean poder llegar al máximo nivel y de esa forma poder salir adelante.
Edilda es una mujer, cuyo ejemplo de trabajo motiva a las demás. Ella es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, y por sobre todo muy amable. Comenta que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace ya un tiempo, y gracias a esto ha podido formarse ya una clientela bien definida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cosméticos, con lo cual podrá cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Ella al igual que sus compañeras se encuentran muy felices dentro del programa de la fundación.
texts.en:
“Kuña Pyapy Mbarete” is the group formed in Ciudad del Este by 22 women who are friends and neighbors in this city.  They are all heads of household who see Fundación Paraguaya as a help for them since no one else wanted to help them.  They are currently in the sixth cycle in the Fundación’s program and they want to reach the maximum level in order to get ahead this way.

Edilda is a woman whose work is an example for the rest of them.  She is a very responsible, hardworking woman but, above all, very nice.  She comments that she’s been selling cosmetics for quite some time now and thanks to this has been able to secure a well-defined, regular clientele.

She’s asking for the loan to buy cosmetics to fill customer orders.  She and her fellow members are very happy in the Fundación’s program.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is 40 years old, single, and has two children. She has been selling cereals for six years and earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES, which she uses to support her family.

Violet is requesting her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to buy dry maize and beans for her business. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her dreams are to buy a piece of land and build a store for her grains.

loans.use: to purchase dry maize and beans.

loans.name: Milva

texts.en:
Milva is 34 years old and lives in Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children.

Milva has a motorcycle and earns approximately 6,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She requested a loan to purchase motorcycle parts.

Milva has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, Milva hopes to have enough savings for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle parts.

loans.name: Edith's Group

texts.en:
Edith, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of  farmers in Kakamega South District. She is 48 years old, is married and has 7 children.

Edith likes to think of herself as a very experienced farmer. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Edith plans to use the profits from this coming season to save more money for the future.

In total, Edith’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate  acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Victoria Viatriz

texts.en:
My name is Victoria T., and I make and sell tortillas. I’ve had my business for five years. My son helps me with the packing and distributing. I have several clients since my store is near a bus station. With my income, I can support my family. My goal is to increase inventory so I can produce more. That way, I can remodel my store (located in my home), and provide a decent education for my kid.

Loan Use: Purchase corn flour, lime, salt, water, wood, matches, charcoal.

Mi nombre es Victoria T. me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años cuento con la ayuda de mi hijo para empacar y repartir mi producto, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que mi producto lo vendo cerca de una estacion de buses, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor produccion y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio (casa de habitacion) y darle un estudio digno a mi hijo.

loans.use: Compra de harina de maiz, cal, sal, agua, leña, fosforos, carbon.

loans.name: Mooui

texts.en: Mooui A. is a 53 year old married woman who has nine children. She joined SPBD in 2000 and has been a faithful and pleasant member to the program. She received her first loan from SPBD to start her sewing business back in 2000 and the business is very successful. She then received a second loan to start a grocery shop which is also now very successful. Her third, fourth and fifth loans were to re-stock her grocery shop to help maintain her customer base. She still needs more help from the program to expand her grocery shop so she can cater to the increased demand.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Laura Aide

texts.en:
Laura is a very enthusiastic and hard-working woman. She is married and has three daughters ages 11, 13 and 15. Although her husband works as a hospital orderly she decided to work to help him with the household expenses, so two years ago she opened her own business selling clothing. She is very driven and her business is going well. She has many new customers and her income is rising. She travels to other states to buy at factory prices. At this time, she needs to expand her product line so she is asking for a loan of $200 that she will use to buy merchandise. She promises to repay the loan within 3-6 months. Please help Laura's business and her family. They would be very grateful.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Laura es una mujer muy entusiasta y trabajadora, ella es casada y tiene tres hijas, de 11, 13 y 15 años de edad, aunque su esposo trabaja como camillero en un hospital, ella decidió trabajar para apoyarlo con los gastos de su hogar, para lo que inició su propio negocio con la venta de ropa hace dos años, a Juana siempre la ha gustado salir adelante y se esfuerza mucho para lograrlo, afortunadamente su negocio ha prosperado y ha logrado tener mas cliente y mejores beneficios.

Para obtener mayores beneficios, Juana viaja a otros estados donde obtiene precios de fábrica, ahora necesita incrementar la variedad de productos que ofrece, para esto requiere de un préstamo por $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Se parte fundamental en la vida de esta familia y en el crecimiento del negocio de Laura, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru:
Хайдаров Анварчон, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 2 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 4 лет. Он женат. Свою деятельность начал с продажи аксессуарами на рынке Панчшанбе. Он считает что его бизнес очень прибыльным. За товаром он ездит сам в соседнюю страну, но на этот раз хочет поехать в Китай, за имеющим спрос товаром. Для этого ему необходимо 1000$, для увеличения товарооборота.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Anvarchon [Anvar] H. has been an active client of MLF MicroInvest for more than 2 years. He has been in business for 4 years. Anvar H. is married. He started his business by selling accessories on a marketplace in Panchshanbe. Anvar H. believes that his business is very profitable. Usually he delivers his goods from a neighboring country, but now Anvar H. wants to go to China to buy the goods that are in demand. He asks for $1000 loan to help pay for the trip and increase the volume of the goods sold.

loans.use: Increase the volume of goods sold

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more mens and ladies undergarments

loans.name: Nancy Soledad

texts.es:
Nancy is a young woman with many hopes of succeeding, and the great strength that she possesses has allowed her to overcome each and every one of the economic difficulties that her family has had to face. She is the youngest of 7 siblings, and her already elderly parents couldn't continue supporting her. This is why she has become the main source of support in her house, and she had to postpone her dream of becoming a great professional for awhile. Her wish is to have a career after finishing her secondary studies, and this is what drove her to work in a shop that manufactures sweaters, where she offers her sewing services. She works every day from very early to very late and is one of the most outstanding workers in the shop. Nancy is very happy because this work that she does lets her save to be able to start studying at the university in her beautiful city. Nancy hopes to continue supporting her parents and to support her studies, and this is why she is requesting a loan of $200 to invest in a small sewing shop in her parents' home. This is how she will have extra income and will be able to increase the quality of life of her beloved parents. Let's support this young talent with a promising future. She is thankful for your anticipated attention and will.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Nancy es una joven con muchos deseos de superación y la gran fortaleza que posee le ha permitido sobrepasar todas y cada una de las dificultades de escasez económica que ha tenido que afrontar con su familia, ella es la menor de 7 hermanos y sus padres ya ancianos no pudieron seguir apoyándola y en la actualidad debido a esta razón se ha convertido en el principal sostén de su casa, por lo que tuvo que postergar por un tiempo su sueño de convertirse en una gran profesional.Su deseo de ocuparse en alguna actividad tras terminar sus estudios secundarios la condujeron a trabajar en un taller de fabricación de chompas ofreciendo sus servicios de costura, diariamente trabaja desde muy temprano y ahora es una de las trabajadoras que más destaca en el taller, Nancy está muy contenta por La labor que realiza y esto le permite ahorrar para poder empezar a estudiar una carrera profesional en la universidad de su bella ciudad.Nancy desea seguir apoyando a sus padres y sostener sus estudios es por ello que solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares para invertirlos en la implementación de un pequeño taller de costura en casa de sus padres, de esta manera podrá tener un ingreso extra y podrá elevar el nivel de vida de sus queridos progenitores.Apoyemos a este joven talento con un futuro prometedor, ella agradece por anticipado tu atención y disposición.

loans.use: Implementation of a small sewing shop in her home

loans.name: Susana Gabriela

texts.es:
Susana divorced recently and is going through a sad stage in her life. However, she has two children for whom she needs to move forward and work hard so that they may have a better future than she did. Two years before getting divorced, Susana started a small business selling tacos and menudos (tripe soup), and little by little, with a lot of effort, she got customers who came to buy menudos. However, her business has started to decrease, and she doesn't want it to close for lack of attention.

This is why Susana is requesting a loan for US$1125 to be paid in a period of 6 months. With this money Susana will be able to adapt her locale so that it draw the attention of potential customers and so little by little she can grow her small locale. With your help, Susana and her children will be able to have a nice Christmas, and will be able to make it through this trying time life has thrown at them.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Susana acaba D. divorciarse y pasa por una etapa triste D. su vida. Sin embargo tiene dos hijos por quienes salir adelante y luchar para que ellos tengan un mejor futuro que elL.. Hace dos años antes D. divorciarse, Susana comenzó con un pequeño negocio D. ventas D. tacos y menudos, y poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo fue haciéndose D. clientes que le iban a comprar menudos. Sin embargo a raíz D. su negocio comenzó a decaer y elL. no quiere que este negocio se cierre por falta D. atención.

Es por es oque Susana está solicitando un crédito D. US $1125 para pagarlos en un plazo D. 6 meses y con este dinero Susana podrá acondicionar su local, para que llame L. atención a más clientes Y así pueda crecer poco a poco su pequeño local. Con tu ayuda Susana y sus hijos podrán tener una bonita navidad, y podrán salir delante D. esta prueba que L. vida les dio.

loans.use: Recomedling her small food locale (Remodelar su pequeño local de comida)

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mrs. Mabel O. is married with 2 children, lives in Benin City; she has a store where she sells provisions & Foodstuff. She solicits for the loan of $275 to buy more provision and foodstuff for sale. She has been in this business since 2002.

loans.use: To buy more Provisions & Foodstuff for sale

loans.name: Gulkhanim

texts.en: Gulkhanim (her husband is pictured), born in 1957,  has sold hazels for 10 years. She and her husband have 3 children and live in Khachmaz town.  Now they need a loan of $725 to buy hazels in order to increase their income.

loans.use: to buy hazels

loans.name: Ho Thi

texts.vi:
Since the first day the TYM Fund expands to her area, Mrs. Hồ Thị Tám, 34 years old, has joined the Fund, borrowed money to invest more into her tailor shop. Her husband helps her to run the shop to. They have steady monthly income of 200USD. The family are happy with plenty of laughing from their two young children. This time she is applying for a loan of 400USD to buy material for the shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Ngay từ những ngày đầu tiên Quỹ triển khai, chị Hồ Thị Tám, 34 tuổi, đã mạnh dạn tham gia để có vốn đầu tư thêm vào cửa hàng may. Mặc dù là người khéo tay nhưng khi chưa có vốn để mua vải thì việc kinh doanh cũng có nhiều trở ngại. Sau khi vay vốn, cửa hàng đã phần nào đáp ứng được nhu cầu của khách hàng, từ đó cửa hàng may của chị ngày càng đông khách. Những lúc bận việc anh cũng hộ trợ chị trong công việc để kịp tiến độ cho khách và giữ uy tín. Công việc làm ăn ngày càng phát triển, đời sống sinh hoạt được cải thiên, gia đình đầy ắp tiếng cười của 2 con trẻ. Vòng vốn này chị Tám tiếp tục vay 400USD để mua vải may. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình 200USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Yolanda Guadalupe

texts.es:
Yolanda M. works selling cosmetics. Her husband works as a laborer and she started this activity to help her husband in supporting their household. Four years ago she mainly sold to her relatives but she now has customers from diverse circles and is doing very well.

She requests a loan for US $250, which she will pay back in 4 months, to buy merchandise. With your help Yolanda will be able to keep improving.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Yolanda M. se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos, su esposo es obrero empezó con esta actividad para apoyar a su marido en la manutención de su casa, hace 4 años principalmente le vendía a su familiares ahora ya a conseguido clientes de diversos círculos y le va muy bien.

Solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu ayuda Yolanda seguirá adelante.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Comprar mercancia)

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
My house had been built mainly from wood and the walls have been added in different stages. I would like to build the house in cement and to lay a floor because living like this can be risky due to bad weather. This is important because I would not like to risk loosing it. Therefore, I request a loan of 850 USD. 

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi casa en un principio era de madera y poco a poco e ido construyendo en ella ya cuenta con sus paredes alrededor, me gustaría pronto tener mi casa de concreto y colocarle la loza ya que mi vivienda a estado en riesgo por los malos tiempos, así una vez terminada no perderla, de esta forma solicito la cantidad de $850.00 dll.

loans.use: To lay concrete floor

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo works making gift bags and piñatas to order. He has one school age son that helps him with his business. He is a widow and the only one working to support his family. This is the twelth time that he is requesting a loan from Impro and the second time he requires the support of Kiva. The money will be used to purchase materials (paper, cardboard, glue and colored paper).

His work and his desire to work allow him access to this credit because he has experience as a craftsman. He is a very responsible person because in all of the time he has worked, his behavior with regard to the loans he has obtained has been good and he has not had difficulty making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Arturo realiza todo trabajo de cotillones y piñatas a pedido. Tiene 1 hijo en edad escolar que le ayuda en su negocio. Es viudo y el único que se encarga de trabajar para su familia. Es la décima segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva, el crédito será destinado para la compra la compra de materia prima ( Papel, cartulina, carpicola y papel de color). Su trabajo y las ganas de trabajar le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia como artesano. Es una persona muy responsable ya que en todo el tiempo que trabaja, su comportamiento en los créditos otorgados fue bueno y no tuvo problemas para efectuar sus pagos respectivos.

loans.use: Purchase paper, cardboard, glue and colored paper to make gift bags and piñatas

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
first loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=34803&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Miriam belongs to the Magnolia Village Bank.

She lives with her husband, is 26 and has a 7-year-old daughter. She sells ladies' clothes in a store located in a busy shopping arcade in Ayacucho.

She orders her products from Lima. She also does housework and has a moto-taxi with her husband.

Miriam needs a 1000 soles loan to buy polo shirts, pants and pullovers. She would like to extend her business to supply more products, and to have her own house.

loans.use: Buy polo shirts, pants and pullovers.

loans.name: Folake

texts.en: Mrs. Folake O. is 44 years old and is married with 4 children.  Folake sells frozen fish wholesale and retail.  Women who cannot go to the cold room to buy in bulk come to her to buy fish which they go about hawking.  Folake is standing between her two freezers where she stores fish, and on top are some cartons of fish waiting to be picked up by their owners.  Folake also sells cooked food to school children and workers who could not take breakfast before leaving home. She needs a loan of $425 to enable her to buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more cartons of frozen fish to sell

loans.name: Behka

texts.en:
Behka was born in 1966, and she is from the village of Filipovići, near the town of Foča. She is married and she has three children. Her husband is unemployed, but sometimes he finds something to do for someone in order to earn some money for his family.

They are doing agricultural work and that is their only secure source of income. They are also have one cow and they sell milk and milk products in the village.

They want to use this loan to expand their agricultural business and to buy seeds for their greenhouse. They want to make reserves of vegetables for the winter.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge, es un señor casado y tiene dos hijos. El se dedica a la venta de estopas, trapo cortado, trapo de primera y otros artículos.

Jorge, se dedica a este rubro hace ocho años y  su taller se encuentra en su propia casa.

Jorge, con sus ganancias  aporta a los ingresos de la casa, y junto con su esposa hacen frente a los gastos  de su familia.

Jorge, comenta que tiene bastante demanda de sus mercaderías en los talleres y ferreterías de la ciudad. El desea terminar un tinglado que tiene en el fondo de su casa que es  más grande y cómodo que su actual taller, para que así pueda comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima y confeccionar las estopas, trapos cortados y de primera. Y podrá abastecer la fuerte demanda que tiene.
texts.en:
Jorge is married and has two children. He dedicates himself to the sale of burlap, cut cloth, superior cloth and other articles. Jorge has dedicated himself to this business for eight years and his shop is located in his home. With his earnings, Jorge provides the income for his home and together with his spouse they pay their family expenses. Jorge comments that he has a lot of demand for his merchandise at shops and hardware stores throughout the city. He wants to finish a shed that he has in the back of his house which is larger and more comfortable that his current shop. This will allow him to purchase a greater quantity of prime material to make his products and supply the demand he has.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cloth and used clothing.

loans.name: Ni Nengah Sumadi

texts.id: Rumah Ibu Ni Nengah Sumadi terletak di daerah pinggiran kota kabupaten tetapi dengan suasana pedesaan yang masih sangat kental. Kehidupan masyarakatnya yang berjalan menurut adat istiadat Bali  membuat lingkungan disekitarnya tampak begitu harmonis. Ibu Nengah Sumadi saat ini memelihara dua ekor penggemukan  dan nerencana untuk menambah jumlah ternaknya. Walaupun selama ini usahanya yang masih kecil ini dielolanya dengan cara sederhana namun terbukti mampu memberikan nilai tambah bagi pemasukan keluarga, karena selama ini dari keuntungan yang diperolehnya dipakai untuk mencukupi kebutuhan keluarga selain mengandalkan pendapatan suaminya yang bekerja sebagai petani. Saat ini Ibu Ni Nengah Sumadi mengikuti program ternak babi yang dikelola Yayasan Dinari dengan jangka wakyu pinjaman selama enam bulan dan waktu pengembalian pada akhir periode pinjaman. Pinjaman yang diperolehnya dipakai untuk membeli bibit penggemukan dan sebagian lagi untuk membeli pakan. Hasil yang biasa diperolehnya selama ini dari memelihara babi penggemukan tersebut sekitar Rp 300.000 – Rp 400.000 per ekor tergantung berat babi tersebut dan itu dipergunakannya membantu suami mencukupi kebutuhan rumah tangganya.
texts.en:
Mrs Ni Nengah Sumadi lives near the outskirt of a middle sized town. The Balinese tradition is still very important in many aspect of her community life, which contribute to the harmony of the village. Mrs. Nengah Sumadi farms two fattening pigs using simple traditional method. The farm income is ample enough to supplement her husband's farming income. Currently Mrs Ni Nengah Sumadi is enrolled in DINAR foundation's pig farm assistance program. She is applying for a 6 month loan that will be used to purchase piglets and feeds. She usually can earn $33 to $45 per pigs, depending on the weight. She uses that earnings to help her husband to afford her daily expenses.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase piglets and feeds

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Mrs. Carmelita J. B., 53, is happily married to Petronilo B. Sr. They have one son. They live in Katipa, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. Carmelita  has been a barangay (village) secretary since 1993.

She has been a member of Paglaum MPC since 2001. She used her previous loan to improve their sari-sari store. (The word sari-sari means "various kinds." Most sari-sari stores are privately owned shops that are located inside the owner’s house.)

Carmelita is requesting a loan of PHP15,000 to purchase more stock for their sari-sari store.

loans.use: Purchase  goods for sari-sari store

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr:
Née à Lomé en 1961, Madame S. Rose vit seule avec ses trois (03) enfants depuis son divorce avec son mari. Infatigable et très dévouée, elle se débat chaque jour pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. N’arrivant pas à faire face aux énormes difficultés quotidiennes et à bout de souffle, elle s’est adonnée à la vente de bois de chauffe et de résidus de noix de coco très recherchés dans la localité. Mais elle connaît souvent des moments de ruptures et la demande de sa clientèle en bois de chauffe ne cesse d'augmenter.
Pour disposer d’un peu de fonds de roulement et renforcer son activité, elle sollicite un financement destiné à l’achat des bois de chauffe et autres qu’elle va revendre en détail dans son quartier. Ce financement lui permettra de satisfaire ses clients, d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire et surtout relever le niveau de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in Lomé in 1961, Mrs. Rose S. has been living alone with her three children since her divorce from her husband. Tireless and devoted to her family, she struggles daily to support her children. Since she was not able to come to terms with her enormous daily difficulties and worn down by them, she began selling firewood and coconut residue which is very much in demand in her area. However, she has moments where her stock is expended and her clientele's demand for firewood is continually growing.

In order to have a bit more working capital and bolster her business, she is requesting a loan that she will use to buy firewood and such, items she will retail in her neighborhood. This loan will allow her to satisfy the needs of her clientele, grow her sales and, especially, improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of firewood and coconut residue for re-sale

loans.name: Celestino

texts.en:
Celestino is a member of the Yanapanakusun Village Bank. “Yanapanakusun” means “Let’s help ourselves” in Quechua, the first language of many of the group members. Celestino is 40 years old and is married with four children. Celestino sells lumber to carpenters and contractors. He has had this business for the past eight years. Prior to that, he was in college to get his degree in Education. Celestino doesn’t have a set daily schedule, but he usually works from 6am to 12pm. 

Celestino is requesting a loan to buy tornillo and cedar wood. Celestino’s goal for the future is to have his own airplane.

loans.use: Buy tornillo and cedar wood

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
La señora Manuela pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Paz II”, vive en el pasaje Leoncio Prado Mza. D lote 19 – Las Brisas del Cumbaza, distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 38 años y es madre de 2 hijas, ninguno depende de ella. Es conviviente su pareja se dedica a dar servicio de motocarro por las calles. Con el primer préstamo de S/ 300 decide invertir en la compra de pollos y venderlos por kilos. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco.

Actualmente sigue con el mismo negocio y además cuenta con 1 motocarro propio, que trabaja todos los días para tener un ingreso que le ayude a pagar las cuotas del préstamo con puntualidad.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500 que será pagado en 4 meses comprara pollos en cantidad para repartirlos a las bodegas y venderlos por kilos en el mercado, además de dos llantas nuevas para su movilidad que le servirá para transportar los pedidos de sus clientes.

Manuela esta muy contenta por todo lo obtenido y agradece al Manuela Ramos quien le brinda el apoyo que necesita.
texts.en:
Manuela is a member of the communal bank called La Paz 2. She lives on a small street called Leoncio Prado in Las Brisas del Cumbaza, in the district of Tarapoto in San Martin. She is 38 years old and has 2 children, neither of whom are still dependent on their mother. Manuela lives with her husband and now works as a motor scooter driver, providing a taxi service. With the first loan she received, she bought chickens which she resold by the kilo. She's been working with the bank for 2 years.

She still continues with that business, and also has her own motorscooter for the taxi service which she operates every day. The business provides the income she needs to make regular payments on the loan. With the new loan, wihch she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase more chickens to sell to restaurants and in the market, as well as new wheels for her motor scooter.

Manuela is very satisfied with what she has achieved and appreciates very much the support she receives. .


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chickens to sell to the restaurants and markets, as well as new wheels for her motor scooter.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sudarni

texts.id: Ketut Sudarni,seorang ibu yang ulet bekerja, untuk membantu suaminya I Gede Suparmita yang berpropesi sebagai dagang, Sudarni juga memelihara babi dirumahnya,yaitu babi penggemukan.Sudarni sudah dua kali periode ikut bergabung dengan Dinari, Sudarni masuk di kelompok KWT Teratai Mekar dan pelunasan di akhir periode. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.050.000,-,Sudarni membeli 3 ekor bibit babi,dan sekarang babinya sudah besar besar dan dipelihara untuk penggemukan .babi-babinya siap dijual dengan harga perekor dari Rp.800.000,--Rp.1.000.000,-. Sudarni memberi makan babinya 2x sehari,disamping dedak dan konsendrat, Sudarni juga memberikan makanan tambahan,seperti daun talas,daun pisang,batang pisang,dan lain-lain. Keuntungan yang diperoleh perekor Rp.80.000,-, keuntungan ini dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhannya ,juga untuk pendidikan kedua anaknya yang duduk dikelas 5 SD dan 1 SD. Dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari,Sudarni akan membeli beberapa ekor bibit babi lagi dan sisanya untuk biaya pakan. Rumahnya dibangun sendiri dengan bangunan yang semi permanen.
texts.en:
Ketut Sudarni, a mother who is willing to work, to assist her husband I Gede Suparmita whose profession is a trader/merchant. Sudarni also rear pigs at home, pigs to be fattened. Sudarni had already participated in DINARI twice; Sudarni joined the KWT Teratai Mekar group and settled at the end of the period. With an initial capital of Rp.1.050.000,- (about USD100), Sudarni purchased 3 piglets, and the piglets has now grown and is fed to be fattened, these pigs can then be sold be between Rp.800.000,- to Rp.1.000.000,- (USD80 to 100). Sudarni feeds the pigs twice a day, besides feed and antibiotics, Sudarni also give additional food like taro and banana leaves and others. Profit earned each pig can be Rp.80.000,- (USD8), this profit will be used for the family’s expenses, also to pay for the two children’s education, in the 5th and 1st grade. With this loan from DINARI, Sudarni will buy several piglets again and the balance for payment of supplies. Her house is self-built using semi-permanent materials.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy piglet's and it's feeds

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina tiene 46 años, tiene cinco hijos, de los cuales dos de ellos viven fuera. En su juventud, sus padres sembraban numerosas hectáreas de cítricos y plátanos, ella se levantaba a las 4.00am para preparar el desayuno, porque a las 7.00am ya estaban cultivando sus chacras, entonces se quedaba para cocinar y luego llevar los almuerzos a la chacra, quedándose a apoyar en los cultivos. Actualmente, esta dinámica de trabajo la realiza solo en épocas de cosecha, el resto de su tiempo lo ocupa realizando manualidades en su casa, para cada uno de sus tejidos emplea todo su ingenio y creatividad, produciendo de acuerdo a los pedidos de sus clientes. A Paulina le agrada mucho tejer, y le resulta más rentable; en este negocio invierte para la compra de los materiales como; conos de hilos de diversos colores, adornos, plantillas, etc., y por cada prenda gana entre 5 y 8 soles, estos ingresos le permiten aliviar sus necesidades básicas y urgentes de su casa. Paulina es una cliente muy alegre, es la encargada de arrancar las sonrisa de los demás integrantes de su banco comunal; este es su 1er préstamo con MFP, comprometiéndose a pagar todas las cuotas fijadas. El dinero solicitado lo empleará en la compra de materiales diversos para sus trabajos de manualidades, así podrá tejer más y con diversos colores y modelos.
texts.en:
Paulina is 46 years old and has five children, two of whom no longer live at home. In her youth, her parents planted many hectares of citrus fruits and plantains, and Paulina got up at 4:00am every morning to prepare breakfast, because at 7:00am they were already working in the fields. Afterwards, she stayed in the house to cook, to later bring lunch to the fields, then staying to help with the farmwork.

These days, this particular arrangement only takes place in the harvest season, and the rest of her time she spends knitting in her house. With each of her creations she employs all her ingenuity and creativity, producing to the exact specifications of her customers. Paulina really likes to knit, and it's very profitable for her. With her business, she invests money in materials like spools of yarn of different colors, adornments, knitting templates, etc. For each garment, she earns between 5 and 8 soles, and this income allows her to take care of her basic necessities and household needs.

Paulina is a very happy client who is charge of getting smiles out of the rest of the members of her communal bank. This is her first loan with MFP, and she promises to make all her payments. The money she is asking for will be used to buy diverse materials for her work, and in this way she'll be able to knit more garments, and in many colors and models.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of knitting materials

loans.name: Juan Alejandro

texts.es:
En el municipio de Chichigalpa en la ciudad de Chinandega, el señor Juan V. posee su propio negocio de pulpería el cual fue establecido por él y lo ha logrado surtir siendo este el ingreso percibido para mantener su núcleo familiar.

Hoy en día el señor V. atraviesa una necesidad y es la de invertir en la compra de las verduras y por esta razón ha acudido a Ceprodel muy confiadamente para ser beneficiado con un crédito y de esta manera mejorar su situación económica y la de su familia.
texts.en:
In the Chichigalpa neighborhood of Chinandega, Juan V. owns a small grocery, a business that he built from scratch and that he's worked hard to keep going because it's the sole means of support for his family. Now, Sr. V. needs to buy vegetables for the business so he's approached Ceprodel for a loan, trusting that they will be able to help him fund the purchase and, ultimately, improve his economic situation and that of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali has been selling fruits and vegetables for fifteen years. Ali doesn’t own a shop; he sells his fruits and vegetables from his van which means he is a mobile salesman. He is 33-years old and lives in Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children.

Ali does his work well and knows how to treat his clients. His clients can be anybody. When he first started his business, he had difficulty finding a cheap van. Ali decided on this business because he wanted to work independently. In the future, he plans on improving his business. Ali has requested a loan of $1000 US from A. Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his van. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.

loans.use: To do maintenance work on his business van

loans.name: Amina A

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Amina A. A. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with one child who is 8 years old. Amina has been running a secretarial-service business since 2006. She works at the business for nine to 12 hours per day, six days per week. Amina currently earns about $150 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase a computer for her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Amina thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a computer for her business

loans.name: Sami

texts.en: Sami is a 34-year-old man living in Furn El Chebbak, Mount Lebanon. He has been working in pipe repair for the past nine years. Today, Sami is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200 to purchase tools and goods to increase his sales.

loans.use: purchase tools, etc.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a fashion designer, and she also sells sarongs. Caroline is 50 years old and married with 6 children. She desires to pull her family out of poverty. She hopes to receive a loan for the amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs and one sewing machine so that she can meet the demands of her numerous customers. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and one sewing machine

loans.name: Santa Teresa Group

texts.en:
The members of Santa Teresa Group all know each other, and some of the members belong to the same family. The president of the group is Karina. The group has fourteen members, each of which have different types of businesses, including selling cosmetics, clothes, groceries, computers, chocolate, artisanal crafts, porcelain decorations, breakfast, and lunch. Also, Raul lends out DJ equipment for parties.

Everyone would like to use the loan to buy more stock, material, and tools for their businesses. They all have competition in their industries, but they are confident in their business abilities and will be responsible in paying back the loan. Also, since they have taken out loans in the past, they know the importance of everyone paying back on time in order to have access to future loans.

loans.use: To buy more stock for sale

loans.name: Kinyajui

texts.en: K. is a subsistence farmer who grows wheat and maize. He has three children. With the little money that  he earned from the sale of wheat in 2008, he opened a Jaspen Auto shop where he sells spare parts for motor bikes and bicycles. He says that the demand for these spares has gone up since the government eliminated the tax on imported motorbikes. He is now seeking a loan of kshs. 50,000 to buy more spare parts for the motorbikes. His aspires to start and manage his own transport services.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motobikes

loans.name: Jema

texts.en:
Jema is a member of the Dodoma east borrower group in Kihesa Iringa,she is 27 years old woman ,she is separated from her husband,she has 1 child.

 Jema  started her own clothing business selling clothes 5 years ago,she works 7 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 75000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Jema`s first loan from BRAC _Tanzania.She requested the amount of 150,000Tsh in order to buy more clothes.

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Jema hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte M. sells corn bread at moree junction near cape coast. Charlotte has received junior high education.  She is married and has two children .Her husband is a carpenter. Charlotte has been selling corn bread since 2006. She supports her husband in the payment of her children’s school fees. Her loan will be use to purchase more maize, sugar, and fire wood to bake her corn bread for sale.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to give quality education to her children.

loans.use: Her loan will be use to purchase more maize, sugar, and fire wood to bake her corn bread for sale.

loans.name: Keng

texts.en: Keng V. started her business a long time ago. She is a grocer. She is 50 years old and a widow. She has one daughter who is married and assists her in the business. She currently sells foods and some cooking supplies to her neighbors who live near her house. Keng V. requested a loan of $300 in order to make her business more successful.

loans.use: To make her business more successful

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La socia Rosa Elena, es natural de distrito de Anta, e la provincia de Anta y departamento del Cusco, ubicado a 1 hora y 10 minutos de la provincia de Cusco.

Nuestra socia vive en la comunidad campesina de Inquilpata, en concha calle;  ella tiene 33 años de edad, y tiene 2 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella  compra y vende animales menores, entre los que se tiene a los cuyes, las aves de corral, chanchos pequeños. Nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para poder comprar más animalitos menores y así mejorar su producción y su futura venta.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member, Rosa Elena, is a native of Anta District, Anta Province, Department of Cusco. This area is located an hour and ten minutes away from Cusco Province.

Rosa Elena lives on Concha Street in the rural community of Inquilpata. She is 33 years old and has 2 children. Rosa Elena divides her time between doing her household chores and managing her small business of buying and selling small animals such as guinea pigs, poultry, and piglets. She needs a loan to buy more animals so that she can improve her production and future sales.

Rosa Elena values and appreciates the opportunity to receive a loan and promises to make her payments on the established due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase more animals

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en: M. Sharofat is 44 years old and is divorced with two children. Her business is the main source of income for her family. Sharofat participated in the training and now she has been running her business already for ten years. She embroiders the national skull-cap for men and women. She is really hardworking, getting up very early and going to bed very late. When she is not embroidering the skull-caps she is selling them in the local market. Sharofat is planning to expand her business. She requested 4,000 Somoni to purchase necessary supplies for embroidering national skull-caps. Having obtained a loan from IMON seven times, Sharofat had shown herself as a reliable client. Your support will really help her. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to improve her living standard. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy supplies for embroidering national skull-caps

loans.name: Peace And Unity Group

texts.en: Mariama B. is the leader of the Peace and Unity Group, which also includes Alusine T.Z. K. and Salamatu C.. Mariama is 40 years old and is married. She has 3 children who attend school. For the past three years, Mariama has been selling staple foods, such as rice and fish, and cooking supplies at one of the major junctions in town. The group is seeking a loan of 1.5 million LE, with which all three members will be able to expand their businesses and increase their incomes.

loans.use: To expand the inventory of their roadside shops

loans.name: Nora María

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Nora O. se dedica a su negocio de venta de calzados los que son ofrecidos tanto para damas, caballeros y niños en su establecimiento.
 
Ella se ha destacado por ser una dama muy entusiasta y busca la manera de cómo mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y es por esta razón que solicita el crédito para adquirir de sus proveedores la mercadería y así realizar sus ventas en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Nora O. sells footwear for ladies, gentlemen, and children in her business located in the department of León. She has been notable for being an enthusiastic lady who is always looking for ways to improve the conditions of her business. For this reason, she is asking for financing to buy merchandise from her suppliers to sell in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy footwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Retail sale of smoked fish

loans.name: Chhich(Thach)

texts.en: Mrs. S., 39, is a local vegetable seller who started her business at the market in 2000. She is married to Mr. Py, 55, who is a staff member working in industry. This couple has been married for many years and is blessed with two young children. One grown child is married and lives separately, while other one is a single person who currently raises animals to earn a living. Since many years ago, the family’s house has been damaged, and their standard of living has been affected. Because of this, S. needs to borrow a loan from Kiva to be used to repair her old house. She proposes to use the rest of the loan to sustain her business growth. (S. and her husband are in the picture above.)

loans.use: To repair her old house.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet G. is from the village of Gigson Bonifacio. She is 42 years old. Janet is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Janet owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as rice, sugar, salt, vinegar, shampoo, and soap in the local community. Janet has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these a toothpaste ctivities.

In 2008, Janet joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. Janet is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Janet from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase supplies of rice, sugar, salt, vinegar, shampoo, and soap

loans.name: Cristina Soraisa

texts.es:
Cristina S. de 24 años, vive en una zona periurbana ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento solo tiene agua y luz como servicios básicos, esta separada de su esposo y no tiene hijos.

Los padres de Cristina comenzaron con el negocio de la tienda ya hace muchos años atrás. Cuando sus padres tuvieron una edad avanzada y ya no podían trabajar ella se hizo cargo de la tienda. Ahora Cristina trabaja con su hermana todos los días desde las 06h00 hasta las 21h00 tienen un aproximado de 200 clientes todos los días, vende la libra de arroz a $ 0.23, la libra de azúcar $ 0.5, atún a $ 1.00 etc. Una de las dificultades que tiene son las calles enlodadas por causas de las lluvias.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, piedras y la mano de obra para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, en el futuro quiere tener una sucursal de su tienda y poder así asegurar el futuro de sus padres.
texts.en:
Cristina S. is 24 years old and lives in a periurban district located along the Perimetral Highway of Guayaquil. Her house is made of cement and receives only water and electricity as its basic services. She is separated from her husband and has no children.

Cristina’s parents opened a store many years ago. When her parents became elderly and could no longer work, she took over the store. Now Cristina works with her sister every day from 6am until 9pm. They serve approximately 200 customers each day. They sell rice for $0.23/lb, sugar for $0.50/lb, and tuna for $1.00/can. One problem they encounter is when the streets get muddy because of the rain.

With this loan, Cristina will buy cement and stone, as well as pay for labor to make improvements to her home. In the future, she would like to open another branch of her store so that she can secure her parents’ future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement & stone; pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase food ingredients like maize, fish, and spices

loans.name: Ratna Sari Group

texts.en:
Ni Putu A. (0) is a 34-year-old female living in the town of Banyubiru. Ni Putu is the group leader of a fifteen-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ratna S. (MUK-0005).

Ni Putu is married and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 150,000 IDR a month.

In 2008, Ni Putu joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan of 1,400,000 IDR which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. The loan will be her 2nd from MUK.

Ni Putu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.


About MUK:
The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.


*****************************************************
Ni Putu A. (0) merupakan 34 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Banyubiru. Ni Putu adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 15 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah RATNA S. (MUK-0005).

Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Putu sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 3 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Putu menghasilkan sekitar 150,000 IDR. Dalam 2008, Ni Putu bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. 0 Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,400,000 IDR.

Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.

Tentang MUK:
Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Lidy

texts.fr: Lidy est une femme de 36 ans, elle est célibataire sans enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DAROU-KHODOSS depuis 3ans et a eu 7 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle développe un petit commerce de produits cosmétiques et d'effets vestimentaires. Et parallèlement elle fait de l'embouche bovine. Les ressources financières générées par son activité lui permettent de se prendre en charge et de pouvoir faire face à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Lidy is a 36-year old woman who is single without children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois (credit association) in DAROU-KHODOSS for three years and has benefited from seven consecutive loans. She is building up a small business selling cosmetics and clothes. At the same time she does beef fattening. The financial resources generated by her business allow her to take care of and provide for her needs.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her commercial activity

loans.name: Olga Isabel

texts.es:
Olga Isabel P. A. tiene 26 años, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 6 años de edad en San Jacinto, Departamento de Bolívar, donde se dedica desde hace 4 años  a elaborar y vender artesanías como hamacas, mochilas y también prepara y vende un delicioso refresco congelado, elaborado con frutas naturales  llamado boli. En la actualidad solicita un crédito  $ 1.500.000  el cual será invertido en la compra de hilaza para hamacas, hilo fino para bolsos y lana para elaborar mochilas y comprar mercancía como ropa, cosméticos y calzado que adicionará a su negocio. 
La mayor parte de la niñez de Olga la vivió en un corregimiento de San Jacinto Bolívar llamado Bajo Grande hasta sus 10 años, de donde fuè desplazada y huyéndole al conflicto armado que ocurrió en ese momento, se vino a vivir a San Jacinto, pero hoy todo eso es parte de su historia. La señora Olga ha recibido dos créditos con la fundación, los cuales ha pagado muy bien. Su negocio ha servido de mucho a su familia, debido a que los ingresos de su esposo no son muy altos y ella siempre ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Olga sueña con tener su casa propia, ampliar su negocio y con ello  aumentar los ingresos familiares.  Su desafió más grande ocurrió cuando tuvo que  salir de su población  de origen para salvar sus vidas; soportar algunos momentos de situaciones económicas difíciles y en estos momentos vivir separada de su esposo por asuntos laborales. Gracias a Dios están superando esta situaciones y espera un futuro más promisorio para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Olga Isabel P. A. is a 26-year-old woman with a 6-year-old son. They live in San Jacinto, in the department of Bolívar, where she has been making handicrafts, such as hammocks, backpacks and bolis (frozen juice pops) for the last 4 years. She is currently requesting a $1,500,000 COP, which will be invested in purchasing hammock cord, fine thread to make handbags, and wool to make backpacks. She will also buy such merchandise as apparel, cosmetics and footwear to expand her business.

Olga spent a large part of her childhood living in a small town in San Jacinto Bolívar called Bajo Grande, until she was 10 years old and was displaced while fleeing from the armed conflict at that time. She then came to live in San Jacinto, but this is all a part of her history. Ms. Olga has obtained two loans, which she has already repaid, from this institute. Her business has been very beneficial to her family because her husband's income is insufficient and she always helps with the household expenses. Olga dreams of obtaining her own house, expanding her business, and in so doing increasing the family income. Her greatest challenge was having to leave her town in order to save her life because she had to withstand difficult moments and financial hardships. She and her husband now live in apart for job reasons. Thank God that they are now overcoming these difficulties, and she now hopes for a more promising future for both her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cord, thread, wool, clothing, cosmetics, and footwear

loans.name: Khon

texts.en:
Mrs. Khon P., 62 years old (shown in the photo), is a silk weaver. She has three married children: two sons and one daughter. She lives with her daughter on an Island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Khon is old, however, she still strong enough to work. 

She does not have enough capital to purchase silk materials for her weaving business, so she is asking for her first loan of $200 to help her capital.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; Ellos son 15 miembros  alegres y trabajadores; los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y se reúnen una vez al mes en el local de Arariwa en el distrito de Huanchac departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Dolores, tiene 43 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos de 22, 18, 16, 12 años de edad  la socia alternando sus actividades del hogar se dedica  a prestar el servicio de llamadas a celulares y teléfonos fijos de forma ambulatoria, en el mercado de cascaparo  y todo el dinero que ingresa ella lo deposita la banco a plazo fijo y vive de los intereses, Nuestra socia recarga sus 3 celulares personales y los alquila a 0.50 céntimos el minuto a cualquier destino nacional, 

Nuestros otros socios se dedican en su mayoría a las llamadas de celular a celular y a las llamadas fijas desde celulares, son un grupo de amigos que tienen el mismo rubro. Nuestro socio el Sr Gabriel llegó después de la foto porque tenía permiso y llego atrasado al banco por lo que no aparece en este grupo.

Los socios agradecen el préstamo y se comprometen a seguir cumpliendo con el pago de sus deudas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank 'San Rafael'. There are 15 happy and hard-working members. They live in the city of Cusco and get together once a month in the Arariwa area, Huanchac department, in Cusco. Dolores is 43 years old. She has 4 children - 22, 18, 16 and 12 years old. She alternates her activities in her home with her door to door phonecall service business, lending mobile phones and landlines. She deposits the money she earns in the bank and lives off the interest. Dolores recharges her 3 personal mobiles and rents them out at 50 céntimos per minute to all national destinations. The other members mainly work with mobile to mobile calls, and landline calls from mobile phones. They are a group of friends who have the same purpose. One member, Gabriel, arrived after the photo was taken because he had permission and arrived late to the bank. For this reason he isn't in this photo. The members are thankful for the loan and promise to continue meeting their debt repayments within the established time period.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Recharge mobile phones

loans.name: Kaïré

texts.fr: Madame Kaïré Dioufest vendeuse de tissus du genre thioupe (indigo). E lle est également la femme de charge de la garderie d'enfants mis en place par le programme du CCF. Elle est à sa deuxième demande de prêt au sein de U-IMCEC.Ainsi, les bénéfices tirés de premier prêt lui ont permis de contribuer aux charges familiales. Cette fois ci, elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 FCFA pour s'approvisionner en marchandises et aider son mari qui est au chômage aux charges quotidiennes de la maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kaïre Dioufest sells special tinted fabrics (indigo). She is also the lady in charge of the nursery put in place by the CCF program. She is requesting a second loan from U-IMCEC (a Senegalese association of mutual savings and loans institutions).
