The profits she made from the first loan have allowed her to contribute to the family expenses. This time she is asking for a loan of 100,000 FCFA in order to get supplies of goods and to help her husband, who is unemployed, with the daily household expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To get fabric supplies for her business

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred A. is from the village of Capatan, Tuguegarao City. He is 33 years old. Fred is married and has one small child. 

To make a living, Fred owns and operates a business providing transportation services. The main source of income for the business comes from operating motorcycle transport services. Fred has been engaged in his business for over nine years and earns approximately 4,200 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Fred joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fred has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. 

Fred is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be Fred's second loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories.

loans.name: Faeqa

texts.en:
Faeqa Z. is a 37-year-old woman and the mother of an 8-year-old daughter, Faeqa was widowed and left with a young girl to raise, so she decided to start her own business and raise her daughter. 

Faeqa and her daughter moved to Faeqa's father's house after she lost her husband. She received a good amount of money from her father to rent a store and buy the goods needed to start a children's and women's wear store. After two years, the store started to prosper and established a good customer base.

Faeqa wants to increase the number of customers and the benefits of the store, so she took a $2000 dollar from FATEN to purchase more clothes to sell.

Faeqa, who appears in the photograph with her daughter, helps her father by paying for household expenses. She uses profits from the store to finance her daughter's education.

loans.use: Purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica runs a stall selling women’s shoes and children's toys at the Berryessa Flea Market in San Jose, California. Before opening her own business, Monica spent five years working for a watch salesman at the market and refining her own sales skills. However, she worked long and difficult hours and did not retain control over the profits she made. In 2001, Monica decided it was finally time to become her own boss. Getting started was difficult, she said, especially figuring out things like permits, but she is glad she did. 

Monica’s stall is now open for business Thursday to Sunday every week, and she has one employee who helps her on the busier weekend days. A $3,500 loan from Opportunity Fund will allow her to increase her inventory and consequently boost sales. To help manage the growth, Monica’s husband, Paul, will begin working at the stall with her. Until recently, Paul made a living selling paintings. He explains that the market for artwork has suffered recently. The couple is excited to have the opportunity now to work together at Monica's stall. 

"I already have the satisfaction of working for myself, but I hope my business grows more," said Monica when asked about her goals for the future. She is proud of her success and that it enables her to send money to Mexico to help her parents and to support her sister's education. While she has a few cousins in the United States, the rest of her family lives in the state of Oaxaca in Mexico.

Monica first learned about Opportunity Fund from a brochure that a cousin gave her. Her experience has been very positive and she hopes to get a slightly larger loan in the future. "I am very grateful to Opportunity Fund," says Monica, "because I'm going to keep moving forward with my business."

loans.use: To increase product inventory for her flea market stall

loans.name: Suemalo

texts.en:
Suemalo F. is 55 and married with 8 children (ages 4 - 24).  She owns a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Suemalo has 4 years of experience in this business.  Suemalo needs a loan of WST$2900 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 550 talas or US $229 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2006, Suemalo joined SPBD.  This is her 6th loan with SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Suemalo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: New Foundation Business Group

texts.en:
T. H., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called New Foundation Business. T. is 46 years old and is married with four children who are between 11 and 20 years old. He also cares for one sibling. T. is a senior student in college. He lives in Montserrado County and is served at the Redlight branch of this MFI, (LEAP).

For seven years, T. has been operating a pharmacy in Jacob’s Town, Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 10,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 47,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more(drugs) medicines for his business.

T. describes himself as a kind and polite man. His dream is to improve his business and build a clinic.

loans.use: To buy more medicines for his business

loans.name: Komyeneh Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Komyeneh” group from Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesspeople who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in order to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Hawanatu T.. Hawanatu was born in Mayorloh village about twenty-seven years ago. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary school. Hawanatu has had eight years of experience in business. She sells cigarettes, batteries, toothpaste, bars of soap, etc. She will use her share of the loan to buy batteries, toothpaste, bars of soap, etc. wholesale to add to her current inventory. 

(Attached to this photo is are snapshots of some borrowers who were not able to be present for the group photo.)

loans.use: Buy batteries, toothpaste, bars of soap, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI II sont des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 4 enfants et vivent majoritairement dans des familles polygames à N'Gala, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités hivernales. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, AMATOU S. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de main d’œuvre pour entretenir environ 1,5 hectare de petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée de consommateurs et de revendeurs. 
Elles comptent réaliser après la campagne, un bénéfice moyen de 50 000FCFA environ.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi II group are married women who are on average 41 years old and have 4 children. They mainly live in polygamous families in N'Gala, one of the villages in the Dioïla prefecture, Koukiro region, Second Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali. They have been working with Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities during the rainy season. They cultivate millet, groundnut and beans as cash crops. They are on their second planting loan and the first one was repaid on time. With this new loan, Amatou S. plans to buy supplies and small equipment and to pay for the labour costs to maintain about 1.5 hectares of millet and groundnut. After the harvest, the crops will be sold in Massigui to a clientele of consumers and resellers. They hope to earn an income of 50,000 francs on average from this planting.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labour, engrais, herbicide, sarclage et petits équipements

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive D. V. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 41 years old and is married with five school-aged children. Olive owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Olive joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Olive is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her 3rd from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: Paulina, de 51 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos por quienes trabaja arduamente. Por muchos años apostó en la fabricación de zapatos y no le resultaba rentable, ya que no contaba con la maquinaria necesaria para dinamizar su trabajo. Por ello se dedicó a la fabricación de correas para jóvenes y niños, en el taller de su casa conjuntamente con su esposo y su hijo. De esta manera trabaja arduamente hasta altas horas de la noche, ya que tiene muchos pedidos que cumplir, asegura además en distribuir a los diversos puestos de la mercadería que produce, de esta manera podrá ganar más clientela. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que no requiere de mucho esfuerzo como la fabricación de zapatos, en cambio le permite captar buenas utilidades. En adelante, desea seguir trabajando con su esposo, para alcanzar la solidez  económica y el fortalecimiento de su capital de trabajo. Es su 21avo crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder  a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará remaches, ojillos, piedrecitas para adornar las correas juveniles que fabrica.
texts.en:
Paulina, 51, is a hard working mother.  She lives in her own house with her husband and two children for whom she works very hard.  For many years she worked at shoe manufacturing but didn’t do too well because she lacked the necessary machinery to propel her work.  She therefore went into making belts for young adults and children in her home-based workshop with her husband and children.

She works very hard this way until quite late at night because she has many pending orders to fill.  She also makes it a point to distribute merchandise to the various sales points in order to acquire more customers.  

What she enjoys most about her work is that it doesn’t require as much effort as shoe making and yet produces good profits.  In the future she’d like to continue working with her husband to attain economic stability and to strengthen her working capital.

This is her 21st loan with MFP.  She knows that if she repays it on time she will be able to attain another one more easily and without causing complications to her communal bank.

She will use the requested funds to buy rivets, eyelets and decorative stones to decorate the belts she makes.

loans.use: To buy materials to make juvenile belts.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce M. is a palm kernel oil processor at Elmina. Joyce has a junior high educational background. She is married and has four children. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will enable her to produce larger quantity of palm kernel oil for sale. She hopes to build a house from the profits that she makes.

loans.use: Her loan will enable her produce larger quantity of palm kernel oil for sale.

loans.name: G.s. El Calvario Group

texts.es: La señora Marina Isabel tiene 38 años es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos de 3, 6 y 14 años respectivamente. Marina se dedica a la venta de pan, ella tiene más de cuatro años de dedicarse a esta actividad la cual dio inicio con recursos propios vendiendo de manera ambulante, pero ahora vende en un lugar fijo. Cabe señalarse en principio fue con ayuda y apoyo de un familiar que pudo arrancar con su negocio. Ella solicita este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de más pan, siempre con el objetivo de vender más y ganar más. Otra integrante del grupo es Doña Francisca Paula, la cual tiene 51 años es casada y tiene 3 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de camas de madera y también a la venta de camioncitos de madera de juguete de manera ambulante, pese a que también realiza entregas a los departamentos de Masaya y Granada. Ella inicio con este negocio desde hace 6 años debido a la falta de empleo que aqueja el país y buscando una alternativa para sufragar los gastos del hogar. Ella solicita este crédito con el objetivo de invertirlo en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de los camioncitos de madera, que es lo que actualmente posee más demanda.  Así podrán invertir en materia prima para sus negocios.
texts.en:
Marina Isabel is 38 years old. She is a single mother with three children, 3, 6, and 14 years of age. For four years, Marina’s business has been selling bread. She started the business with her own funds and the help of a family member. Initially she worked as a roving vendor but now sells from a fixed location. Marina is seeking this loan to invest in purchasing more bread, always with the objective of selling more and earning more. 

The other member of this group is Francisca Paula; a 51-year-old married woman with three grown children. Francisca sells wooden beds and wooden toy trucks as a roving vendor. She also delivers her products to the departments of Masaya and Granada. She began the business six years ago because of the lack of jobs in the country. She was looking for an alternative way of meeting her household expenses. Francisca will use this loan to invest in raw materials for making wooden toy trucks, which are now in high demand.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Benito

texts.en:
Benito N. is from the village of Bayo, Iguig, Cagayan. He is 38 years old, and married, with 2 infant children. To make a living, Benito raises pigs for breeding. Benito has been engaged in his business for more than 7 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

Benito joined ASKI this year to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benito is requesting his first loan, for 5000 PHP, to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated by the business to financially support members of his extended family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Hafswa

texts.en:
N. Hafswa is 36 years old and lives in the town of Luweero in the Luweero region of Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Hafswa has a business selling produce, which she has had for 5 years.         

To help expand her business, Hafswa has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more produce.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Hafswa hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Hafswa hopes to open up other branches.

loans.use: more produce

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna D. is from the village of Benoni, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 48 years old, married and has 6 adult children. Lorna owns & operates a seafood store where she buys and sells fish such as milk fish, mackerel & sardines. She has been engaged in her business for over 19 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish such as bangsi & boboron. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish like bangsi & boboron

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma C. is a widow who lives in Brgy. Cabagnaan, La Castellana, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store. Thelma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Thelma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 20,000 PHP helped her to earn a monthly profit of 6,000 PHP, raising her family's standard of living. This time, for her 17th cycle loan, she is borrowing 20,000 PHP with which she intends to buy stocks of goods and soft drinks for her general store so that she can continue to save up for the improvement of business. Thelma C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Jose Alexander

texts.es:
José es cliente de 19 años de edad que reside junto a sus padres en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, perteneciente a la región Piura y se encuentra situada a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza de ovinos, los cuales alimenta por un periodo de tiempo para comercializarlos posteriormente con los pobladores de su zona.  A la fecha y por el buen trato que da, tiene muchos clientes fidelizados que lo estiman y apoyan.  Adicionalmente trabaja en un hotel como jardinero.  Con los ingresos que percibe apoya la economía de su familia.

José desea adquirir alimento para engordar a su ganado y posterior mente comercializarlos. Con ello logrará percibir mayores ingresos por sus ventas, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Jose is 19 years old and lives with his parents in one of the homes that make up the agricultural district of Tambogrande which belongs to the Piura region and is located four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. 

He raises sheep which he feeds for a period of time so that he can later sell them to the residents of his area. To date, and because of the good deals that he gives, he has a lot of loyal clients who consider and support him. He also works at a hotel as a gardener. He supports his family with the income that he receives. 

Jose wants to buy feed to fatten his livestock so that he can later sell it. This will allow him to make more profit from his sales. To meet his goal, he has requested a loan from field partner Edpyme Alternative in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles (PEN).

loans.use: Purchase feed to fatten livestock to later sell it.

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a married man. He has one child who is still young for school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

He has operated a M-pesa (mobile money transfer) service. He operates in a shop. His potential customers are market dealers and the neighboring community. Suleiman faces major challenges of not enough capital and a lot of competition in his business. He hopes to operate a big M-pesa (mobile money transfer) in the future.

With the 40,000 KES loan, he wants to pay for his M-pesa (mobile money transfer) business permit. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To pay for his M-pesa (mobile money transfer) business permit

loans.name: Dynamique Group

texts.fr: M’Lwamira P.  est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe d’affaire Dynamique, âgée de 50 ans, mariée, mère de 3 enfants qui étudient a l’université. Son M. est un enseignant.la cliente  M’Lwamira P. est  vendeuse des divers (bâches, couvertures, etc.). Elle s’installe au long de la Rue, au point de vente de l’entrée du quartier Katindo II-Katoyi. Elle démarra son activité avec un fonds propre reçu de sa fille ainée. Il ya 3 ans qu’elle est en activité. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouvelles marchandises (1 ballon de bâches, 1 carton d’huile végétale, farine masoso, 1 ballon de couverture, etc.).  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, passer le reste de sa vie en paix. La cliente M’Lwamira Pelagie remercie Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe bora est constitué de 29 membres.
texts.en: M’Lwamira P. is an entrepreneur and president of the Dynamique business group.  She is 50 years old, married, and mother of 3 children who attend university.  Her husband is a teacher. M’Lwamira P. is a seller of various items (tarpaulins, blankets, etc.) She sets up along the Road, at the retail area at the entrance of the Katindo Il-Katoyi neighborhood.  She started her business with funds received from her eldest daughter.  She has been in business for 3 years.  This new loan will help her stock up on new merchandise (1 ball of tarpaulin, 1 carton of vegetable oil, Masoso flour, 1 ball of blankets, etc.)  In addition, she aspires to grow her business, and spend the rest of her life in peace. M’Lwamira P. thanks Hakima for their work dedicated to poor women excluded by traditional banks. The Bora group consists of 29 members.

loans.use: 1 ball of tarpaulin, 1 carton of vegetable oil, Masoso flour, 1 ball of blankets, etc.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth C. tiene 42 años y vive en la ciudad de Bogotá, donde es   propietaria del negocio: “Solo gorras.com “ ; ella es una mujer que trabaja permanentemente para generar importantes ingresos para su hogar y sacar a su familia adelante,  que la conforma con sus tres hijos en las edades de 15, 17 y 23 años de edad. Su negocio consiste en la fabricación de cachuchas o gorras para publicidad, empresas de vigilancia y dotaciones varias estas últimas   se usan para mejorar condiciones de salud higiene y seguridad de las empresas; su clientela inicial fue la policía y en la actualidad también le produce a restaurantes entre otras empresas. Cuando inició  este negocio, hace 9 años, lo hizo con dos máquinas y con el crecimiento de su clientela ha logrado aumentar su infraestructura básica.  Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y su primer credikiva también, con el comprará una máquina bordadora, con la que proyecta mejorar su acabado ofreciendo un servicio adicional como valor agregado a sus productos.
texts.en:
Ruth C. is 42 years old and lives in the city of Bogotá, where she is the owner of the business "Solo gorras.com" [Only hats.com].  She is a woman who constantly works hard to earn money for her household and improve her family's life.  She has three children who are 23, 17, and 15 years old.  

Her business is making hats for advertising, security companies, and other businesses which use them to improve hygiene and security conditions.  Her first customer was the police and now she produces hats for restaurants and other businesses.  When she started her business nine years ago, she had two machines.  As her number of customers has increased, she has increased her basic infrastructure.  

This is her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and her first loan with Kiva.  With the loan, she would like to purchase an embroidery machine so that she can offer an additional service which will add value to her products.

loans.use: Purchase an embroidery machine

loans.name: Sherzod

texts.en:
J. Sherzod is a gentleman who has dedicated himself to the business of farming and raising livestock for the past seven years. He is married and has three children. The necessity that he is currently faced with is the need to invest in the purchase of cattle. For this simple reason he is seeking the support of IMON International to obtain a loan to purchase cattle to sell. Sherzod is grateful to everyone supporting him.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase calves to expand his business.

loans.name: Dmitriy

texts.en:
Dmytriy is married and has a grown son. Dmytriy runs a farming enterprise growing crops such as tomato, cabbage and marrow squash. He lives in the small town of Gladkovka.  Dmytriy first tried his luck in the farming business 20 years ago. Presently, he has 60,000 Grivnyas of turnover capital. His average net profit amounts to 3,300 Grivnyas a month. 

Dmitriy is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to invest in growing 3,000 early spring tomato, 1,000 cucumber, and 500 marrow squash bush-type plants, and 10,000 cabbage clusters.  Dmytriy is an experienced farmer. He knows that the key to success in growing vegetables in greenhouses is to know what to plant and when. Dmitriy enjoys his job. He likes to supply his customers with healthy, organic produce every year.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, clear plastic film and fertilizers for his greenhouses

loans.name: Viviane

texts.en:
Viviane is 54 years old and is married, with seven children between 12 and 22 years old.  Viviane has been running the pub for the past 3 years.  This business is well organized.  She employs 4 people to help her.  Viviane works from 8am to 11pm every day.

Viviane has requested her first loan from Vision Finance Company, s.a,  in order to expand her business by buying new materials and more beer, like Primus, and so on.  With an expansion, Viviane hopes to earn more profits than before.  With this profit, she will be able to buy her own house, pay school fees for her children and save money for her future.

loans.use: to purchase new material and more beer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase firewood and pay wages

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is 35 years old and married with eight children.  He offers public address services.  He has been earning a living from this business for twelve years.  He runs the business with three employees.  He has been able to sustain his business because of his hard work and dedication.  He hopes to have a fully established business in the future.  He has requested 30,000 KES to buy a generator.

loans.use: to buy a generator.

loans.name: Khetholuhle Group

texts.en:
Sibongile is 31 years old and single with three children between the ages of 5 and 9. All three children attend school. She runs a clothing business in Kwa Zulu Natal in Empangeni, South Africa. In the photo she is pictured raising her hand.

She’s been in the business for two years and sell clothes to the community from her home. She requested this loan through WDB and Kiva so that she could start selling groceries in her shop. 

She says that the main challenges to her business are customers who buy clothes on credit and fail to pay on time.  She says that the extra income from this loan will help her take care of her children and generate more profit. In the future, she see herself having room to sell so that she does not inconvenience her children in the house.

loans.use: To start selling groceries in her shop

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Vann, 52 years old, is a tailor. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. They are married with two children and they are now working in Thailand. 

This family can make $17.5 per day, and they spend it on food, $60; electricity, $4; and other things, $5. 

Vann would like to request a loan of $1,000 to repair her house to make it more comfortable for her career as a tailor. After this loan she expects that her family will get more income and will live in better a situation than now. She plans to buy a new sewing machine and another machine that is related to her career.

loans.use: To repair her house to improve her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Erikson Jose

texts.es:
Erikson es un joven de 26 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de león, esta casado , es padre de dos hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad respectivamente, el es comerciante se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pizzas. 
Inicio su negocio hace 5 años, su papa es dueño de una panadería y fue el quien lo impulso a poner su propio negocio. Así que el se fue a Managua a tomar un curso de panificación para capacitarse en técnicas de elaboración de pan y sus derivados,  además de la experiencia que adquirió en la panadería de su padre. De esta manera el logro poner su pizzería, con los ingresos que la generado este negocio también puso una pulpería en su casa  la cual es atendida por su esposa, este es otra fuente de ingresos que el tiene. A el le gustaría expandirse en toda la ciudad de León incluyendo sus municipios porque hay mercado para vender su producto, pero le falta transporte, no tiene en que movilizarse por tal motivo no ha podido expandirse. Debido a eso es que solicito el préstamo para comprar una moto y poder distribuir sus productos. Con esta inversión el espera incrementar sus ventas por medio de las entregas a domicilio , mejorar sus ingresos que le permitan ahorrar para realizar  una de sus metas que es poner su propia panadería, construir su casa y poder expandir su negocio fuera de la ciudad de León.
texts.en:
Erickson, 26, lives in the city of León.  He’s married and the father of two children who are 5 and 2 years of age respectively.  He’s a merchant that manufactures and sells pizzas.  

He started his business five years ago.  His father owns a bakery and he pushed him to open his own business.  This is how he went to Managua to take a baking course to learn techniques for baking bread and bread derivatives to add to the experience he’d gained from his father.  This is how he managed to set up his pizzeria.  With income generated from this business he was also able to set up a grocery store at home that his wife tends to which is an additional source of income for him.  

He’d like to expand throughout the city of León including its surrounding towns because there’s a market for his product.  However, due to lack of transportation he’s been unable to expand.  Because of this, he’s asked for a loan to buy a motorcycle to be able to distribute his products.  With this investment he hopes to increase his sales through home deliveries, to increase income so that he can save up because one of his goals is to open a bakery of his own, to build his house and to extend his business beyond the city of León.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: St Theresa Girls Ss Credit Scheme Group

texts.en: Julius is a 29-year-old married man with two children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has operated a retail shop for two years which he started with 400,000 shillings and now has 1,000,000 shillings. His hardship is debtors and his low capital base and his vision is a wholesale business plus educating his children. Julius needs the loan to buy soap, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.use: To buy rice, soap and sugar to sell

loans.name: Mara Cecilia

texts.es: Mara de 43 años va a recibir su segundo credikiva y está muy satisfecha porque con el primero compró en mayor volumen carnes, y víveres en genera y aumentó su venta de alimentos especialmente a la hora del desayuno y la cena. Ahora con su nueva financiación comprara mesas y sillas plásticas, para reemplazar las que tiene en muy mal estado y esto brindará una mejor imagen de su negocio y sus clientes estarán mucho más confortables. Así mismo comprará más víveres en mayor volumen y de contado con lo cual ahorrará en su compra y esto le representa más ingresos.  Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “con la ayuda de los créditos recibidos puedo aumentar las ventas y mejorar la oferta de menús;  esto me ayuda a continuar con los proyectos que tengo  para el otro año en el  negocio. Gracias por la ayuda.” Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Mara por favor ingre4se al siguiente enlace: http:// kiva.org/lend/261326
texts.en:
Mara, 43, is going to receive her 2nd Kiva loan and is very satisfied because with the first loan she bought meat and general provisions in greater volume and increased her sales of food, especially at breakfast and dinner time. Now with her new loan she will buy plastic tables and chairs to replace the ones that she has that are in very bad shape. This will give her business a better image and her customers will be much more comfortable. She will also buy more provisions in bulk and in cash which will save her money on her purchases and therefore give her more income. 

Her message to the Kiva lenders is the following: "With the help of the loans received, I am able to increase sales and improve the menu offerings. This helps me to continue with the projects that I have for the business next year. Thanks for the help." If you want to know the story of Mara, please follow the link: http:// kiva.org/lend/261326

loans.use: to buy plastic tables and chairs and supplies in greater volume and quantity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plaster the walls.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, 42 years old, is a security guard’s wife. Her husband's income every month is not enough to maintain their daily needs, so she ventures in the rice business. She has been doing this for five years. She is happy that now, the business is gradually improving. 

She was blessed with five children and is doing her best to continue to send them to school with help of her rice business activity. She wants her children to finish college for their future welfare. 

To further grow her venture, she is requesting a loan amount of 25,000 pesos to buy rice and materials such as hollow blocks and cement for the renovation of her business stall, where she stores sacks of rice for future sale. 

Jocelyn hopes to earn bigger income from her business to extend financial help to her nephews, who are out of school at the moment. She hopes that ASKI, Kiva's partner, will always be generous and helpful in reaching her goals in life.

loans.use: to buy rice and materials such as hollow blocks and cement for the renovation of her business stall.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor Alejandro Isabel de 65 años es un hombre trabajador y esforzado quien tiene una panadería. Este negocio lo inicio hace 15 años con esfuerzo propio con 6 quintales diarios de harina ahora realiza entre 10 a 12 quintales de harina de acuerdo a la venta. 
El realiza desde pan de molde, pico, bolillos y galletas su venta mensual es de 20,800 córdobas y su inversión es de 10,000 córdobas. El con el crédito comprara una moto lo que le permitirá regar su producto de una mejor manera.
texts.en:
Alejandro Isabel 65, is an energetic, hard-working man who owns a bakery.  

He started his business 15 years ago, through his own efforts. At the beginning, he used 600 lbs. of flour a day, and now he uses between 1000 to 1200 lbs. a day, depending on sales.  He makes loaves, picos (triangular sweet breads), rolls and cookies. His monthly sales are 20,800 cordobas and his investment is 10,000 cordobas. 

With the loan he will buy a motorcycle that will allow him to better distribute his products.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for use in his business.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda tiene 44 años, es una mujer alegre y muy trabajadora, es madre de tres hijos ya mayores de 26, 22, y 20 años quienes son independientes, aunque viven en su casa que compró junto a su esposo, quien falleció hace algunos meses. El trabajo de Hilda consiste en la compra y venta de ropa, se va a la ciudad de Lima en busca de los últimos modelos. De esa manera cumple con el pedido de sus clientes y al cabo de 15 días realiza la cobranza, entre sus compradores están los amigos, vecinos, familiares. Lleva ya cuatro años en este trabajo, y sola ha logrado cubrir las necesidades de su hogar y para ella misma. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que dispone de mucho tiempo para poder realizar diferentes actividades, le va bien, ya que tiene muchos clientes que le son muy fieles por que les da un buen producto y a un precio muy cómodo. Espera poder mantener ese ritmo de ventas y mas adelante crecer. Este será el tercer crédito con MFP, le gusta mucho su grupo porque se siente que son responsables. Con el monto solicitado, viajará a la ciudad de Lima para comprar ropa exclusiva y de temporada para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Hilda is 44 years old and is a friendly, hard-working woman.  She is a mother of three children who are 26, 22, and 20 and are now independent adults.  She lives in the house she bought with her husband who died several months ago.  Hilda buys and sells clothing for a living and goes to Lima in search of the latest fashions.  This is how she fills her customer's orders and charges them, her friends, neighbors, and family, bimonthly.  She has been doing this for four years and alone she has been able to cover her household and personal expenses.  What she likes about his job is that she has time to undertake different activities.  Things are going well for her as she has a lot of customers that are very loyal because she gives them a good product at an affordable price.  She hopes to be able to maintain this sales rate and in the future, to grow.  

This will be her third loan with MFP.  She likes her group a lot because she feels that they are responsible.  With the amount requested, she will travel to Lima to buy exclusive and seasonal clothing to stock her business.

loans.use: purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Maria Erlinda

texts.es: María Erlinda se dedica a una pulpería desde hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio. Ella comenzó vendiendo golosinas y refrescos con el tiempo de las utilidades que le generaba el negocio siguió invirtiendo para tener un mayor volumen en su inventario. Es por eso solicita este crédito para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, fósforos, cigarrillos entre otros. Ella sueña con ampliar más su negocio y brindar los productos que necesitan.
texts.en: Maria Erlinda has operated a corner shop for more than 10 years.  She sold snacks and soft drinks at first, then used profits from the business to expand her inventory.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy merchandise for the business: everyday food staples, detergents, matches, cigarettes, etc.  She wants to continue expanding the store and provide the products that her customers need.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Las Naranjas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Las Naranjas y se integra D.  seis señora quien  cada una  se dedica a diferente actividad, L. señora  quien se le tomo L. entrevista se llama Tereza es viuda y a su responsabilidad tiene  a dos hijos que L. apoyan con los ingresos D. L. casa.

     ElL. solcito el préstamo para invertirlo en  L. compra y venta D. ropas para luego venderlo fuera D. L. localidad, en esta actividad lleva  un año y once meses en L. que comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un buen ingreso además antes también compraba productos agrícolas D. L. región.

   Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó ya que es una mujer soL. y no quiere  que le haga falta lo mas necesario y  también  apoyar a sus  hijos que un están a su responsabilidad.

  Lo que más desea es que con este apoyo que le están brindando y  su actividad pueda  salir delante.

  Las personas que integran en el grupo  son las señoras: Rosalinda quien  invierte al préstamo  en L. compra D. ropas para damas, caballeros, niñas y niños, L. señora  María Vitalina invierte en L. compra y venta D. cosméticos, así también L. señora  Silvina quien  invierte en L. compra  D. frutas D. L. región, CarmeL. invierte en L. compra D. productos para surtir su papelería, y por último L. señora Hilda quien invertirá en L. compra D. mercancía para surtir su tienda D. abarrotes.
texts.en:
The Las Naranjas (Oranges) group is maD. up of six women who each has her own business.  Tereza is the one who gave the interview.  She is a widow and has two children who help her with the money for the house.

She is requesting a loan to buy, and then sell, clothing at a distance from where she lives.  She has been doing this work for a year and eleven months and she tells us that it is going very well.  She has had a good income while previously she also bought farm products from the area.

She was inspired to do this work when she, as a single woman, didn’t want to miss out on what she needed, and also to help her children who are her responsibility.

What she most wants from this financing is that it will help her get ahead.

The other members of the group are: Rosalinda, who will use the loan to buy women’s, men’s and children’s clothing, María Vitalina who will buy cosmetics, Silvina, who wants to buy fruit from their area, CarmeL., who will purchase products to supply her stationery store, and lastly, Hilda, who will buy merchandise to supply her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy clothing.
